Manager.description: While testing the behaviour of down- and uploads with a single file File.txt for editing, I now noticed a spooky file File_conflict_20121030_084503.txt on the Android. I use server 4.5.1a Android 1.3.14 Jota Text Editor (Android) with enabled setting to use abackup version when editing. This editor creates a backup file with filename File.txt~ . Perhaps this backup file (renaming, swapping names of current and backup version ???) is causing the reported issue. In previous tests I disabled the backup file creation in the Jota Text Editor settings and everything (editing on the server, editing in Windows client and editing on the Android device) appeared to work fine, at least I did not notice problems when synchronising the Android client manually - for this see bartoszprzybylski/owncloud-android#43 ) The Delete button however only offers to the delete this particular file on the server(!). The Windows client does not show such a file in the file list. Questions: Please can you explain why the Android client offers "delete on the server" ? Should the text become "delete locally" because there is no File_conflict_TIMESTAMP.txt on the server but a conflicting backup file File.txt~ locally ? [UPDATE] I think I was wrong. The file is indeed on the server. This exact local file name (File.txt~) should be listed locally in the Android client, or File.txt~___conflict_TIMESTAMP [UPDATE] I think I was wrong. The file is indeed on the server.
Manager.title: Files like File_conflict_TIMESTAMP.txt when editing files on the Android device (Jota Text Editor)

Manager.description: Connecting to SSL secured hosts that require SNI (Server Name Indication) support is currently not possible without accepting all certificates, which is of course undesirable. It would be nice if the owncloud Android client would properly support SNI so hostname based TLS negotiation can be performed, thus securing a valid trust chain and communication. I've done some research and found a couple of resources indicating that SNI is possible on Android. http://source-android.frandroid.com/libcore/luni/src/main/java/libcore/net/http/HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java http://source-android.frandroid.com/libcore/luni/src/main/java/libcore/net/http/HttpConnection.java http://source-android.frandroid.com/libcore/luni/src/main/java/org/apache/harmony/xnet/provider/jsse/OpenSSLSocketImpl.java There is an setHostname() method in OpenSSLSocketImpl that if called causes NativeCrypto.SSL_set_tlsext_host_name() to be called. That in turn calls SSL_set_tlsext_host_name(). Hopefully, this is helpful.
Manager.title: Add SNI support for SSL hostname verification

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Download valid .epub file to ownCloud directory on GNU/Linux Wait for client to sync to ownCloud (tested on 4.5.1 server default install, 1.1.1 client) Open OwnCloud Android client (tested 1.3.12) The .epub file then appears as a folder clickking on it "opens" an empty folder Other files similarly sync'ed (ODT, PDF) open fine after downloading.

Manager.description: In spite of what the OC desktop clients do, it would be nice to have a "Keep directory up to date" option for directories, as well as it is available for files now. The typical use case is a "magic folder" that is always in sync between your desktop, OC and your phone (so that you can work on the files also when you're offline, and as soon as you get back online, your changes are propagated). Another use case is a Music folder to be kept in sync (streaming is not very reliable, and definitely doesn't work when you're offline :-) ) It shouldn't be too hard to implement, as the file synchronizer already seems to be able to handle directories (am I wrong?), and so the only step is to add a long-press feature to directories to enable the synching option. Another design issue is where to store the data. I believe the user should be able to choose where to mirror the OC directory locally (and the default "/sdcard/owncloud" is used for single-file sync). Finally, like the desktop clients should do, the first sync should support a "merge" strategy. The use case here is: I have my files already stored on owncloud, and I also copied them to the phone via USB (because it's quicker and cheaper than using my 3G dataplan). I'm a good Java developer, but new to Android. I'm willing to provide some programming help and all the necessary testing if you're keen on adding this feature.
Manager.title: Directory synchronization

Manager.description: Hello, we have a self signed SSL Server for Owncloud in iOS we have no problems with it. But the Android app didn't allow.

Manager.description: The android client will try to fetch status.php from the user-provided URL on account creation. For the situation when there are no or wrong credentials entered, it should show an approriate error message.

Manager.description: Every now and then after entering the apps security PIN I don't get to my owncloud root directory but get the configuration site where I should enter the URL and access details of my ownclod account. This is quite annoying as entering URLs and passwords with special characters on the mobile keyboard is rather unhandy. Also after successfully reentering the account data it looks like the app does a full rescan of the file database which can take a while and eat a lot of battery depending on the size of the data in your owncloud. The version of my app is 1.3.14
Manager.title: app loses owncloud access data when installed in the SD card

Manager.description: I have a folder in my owncloud account that contains several 100 GBs of video files. As I quite surely never will need them on my mobile phone and they make the indexing of the whole folder structure a quite lengthy process it would be nice to tell the app to exclude some folders from syncing or indexing. This could maybe be achieved similar to the way which k9mail goes: there one can set folders as main folders that are automatically synced with every sync process and other folders, where only the folder structure itself is indexed. If you enter one of the latter folders theres a button that lets one load the content of the folder if needed. By this one could restrict the folders that one needs to be synced or indexed on the mobile phone and therefore keep syncing/indexing times short and battery saving.
Manager.title: feature request: exclude certain directories from syncing/indexing

Resolving deltas: 100% (9681/9681), done. Submodule path 'actionbarsherlock': checked out '90939dc3925ffaaa0de269bbbe1b35e274968ea1' ./setup_env.sh: Zeile 5: android: Kommando nicht gefunden. ./setup_env.sh: Zeile 6: android: Kommando nicht gefunden. ./setup_env.sh: Zeile 9: android: Kommando nicht gefunden. There are errors because the folders "tools" and "platform-tools" are missing in the PATH. There should be an information that its presupposed.

Manager.description: There are two very good open-source apps to sync calendars and contacts on android via caldav/carddav, both developed by Marten Gajda (http://dmfs.org/). According to Twitter he is currently working on an extension to sync tasks via caldav as well (caldav-todo app, http://code.google.com/p/caldavtodo/) and is looking for programmers to help him. Maybe this would be a good chance to collaborate and push the integration of calendar/contact/tasks syncing into the owncloud android app? Best, PR
Manager.title: Possible Support for App Development

Manager.description: Just got a new Nexus 4. On the website my WebDAV URL is: http://example.com/owncloud/remote.php/webdav/ so this is what I tried to use in the client. It says "Testing connection..." and the text quickly disappears but the Connect button is simply greyed out. This is confusing, it would be nice if it threw a red error message saying "Unable to connect - please make sure to use the same URL as you use to access your web interface" or something like that, otherwise we are left with no idea ... trial and error. I think some people are giving up at that point and giving the app bad reviews on the store, "doesn't work" since they don't figure it out and give up. Optimally the app would detect if they are using the WebDAV link as on their website and if so, automatically retry the correct URL stripping off the additional "/remote.php/webdav/" part but a simple error message would also fix it for 99% of the people too impatient to figure it out.
Manager.title: Setup dialog URL

Manager.description: It could be even one way but I don't see a way to sync folders? Would be nice to have just a checkbox to download an entire folder. Not sure about two way syncs on this app since it could cause some outrageous bandwidth fees over 4G, so I guess this couldn't be done without the option to have owncloud only sync when on wifi. Otherwise you do it manually like it is now. I have a user case which applies I think to a lot of users soon - I am trying to break free from iTunes. iTunes library has a folder hierarchy even for a single song e.g. /artist/album_name/song_name/song.mp4 ... so to try and sync over 1000 songs would take an incredibly long time. But could apply to anything, "Documents" folder etc.
Manager.title: Sync folders

Manager.description: There are multiple problems with the top bar menu which are all kind of related: When you start the app or are in the base folder of your ownCloud, the top bar menu shows a slash. This is not understood by most people as »root folder«, except maybe Linux users. Especially here it seems the slash and dropdown doesn’t need to be there at all, because clicking the slash only exposes a menu with the slash being the only entry. When you’re in the root folder, the menu should simply not be there. This brings up a general issue – the dropdown always also shows the current folder as first entry, which doesn’t make sense because you’re already in it and clicking it does nothing anyway. Then when you are in a sub-subfolder we of course need to label the base folder as something in the dropdown. Here we should put the username of the current user When you open a file then, suddenly the top bar says »ownCloud« and it’s not possible to get to the dropdown anymore. Instead of »ownCloud«, it should display the name of the file, as well as enable the path dropdown. cc @davivel (btw who else is working on the app?) UPDATE - pending tasks: remove the dropdown menu prevent the »ownCloud« title seems tappable (changes background color) in the root folder

Manager.description: When downloading music files with the owncloud client, they aren't found in the media player until you plug the phone to a computer (using it as usb memory stick). The reason is that when the phone is removed from the computer, the "Media Provider" Update event is triggered. This event recognizes changes in the file system and rebuilds the index which then is used by the media player. This event should also be triggered, when music files were downloaded. I didn't test it, but the same could apply for pictures and the android gallery app.
Manager.title: Trigger Update of Android Media Provider

Manager.description: I want to rename the file "wiki/todo.txt" to "dev.txt". The owncloud app strips off the slashes in the path, so the file is now called "wikidev.txt" and is located in the uppermost level of the WebDAV file structure, instead of in the "wiki" folder.

Manager.description: I have set up an owncloud account with quite some data and folder structure in it. Obviously, syncing that would take some time so it isn't strange that not everything is visible at my phone right at once. But it seems that the client is trying to sync everything from A-Z and in that order, while I'd think that syncing that what I need the most would be preferable. And what I need the most, are these items that I'm actually looking for. So if I browse into a folder "Work", it can be assumed that I want to see its contents, so syncing the rest should be stopped and the contents of the Work-folder should be shown. This way, by prioritizing the syncing, the user experience is way more natural, since you don't notice that some folders haven't been synced yet (as you haven't watched in them yet). When you compare owncloud to dropbox (which works this way), there is a significant difference in the time it takes to show a directory. Actually, thinking about it. On the android client, which behaves a lot like the dropbox client on android right?, the server is 'always right', why would syncing a file list then take so long anyway?
Manager.title: Let synchronization be smarter / faster

Manager.description: During synchronization, apparently something went wrong. In my notification bar, I can read "synchronization has failed on account.....". Nothing more. I'd like to solve the problem but have no means of knowing what the problem is. Would it be an idea to have a menu option for a debug log so one could actually see what went wrong?
Manager.title: A place to check for errors

Manager.description: I believe the current version of the Android app 1.3.20 can not handle uploading files of any size using the owncloud app when running on Android 4.2.1 and 4.2.2. Tested on a fresh Android 4.2.2 code base on a Samsung Galaxy Nexus with factory images "yakju" for Galaxy Nexus "maguro" (GSM/HSPA+) from https://developers.google.com/android/nexus/images#yakjujdq39 Uploading files, and the instantupload of pictures fails at different percentages. Even small textfiles fail during the upload. Manager.description: Hi, I use the owncloud android app and the "instant upload" feature. I think this feature is very cool but I have some problems with it (I've a SGS 3 + Cyanogen 9.1) : First, it seems that it only syncs the photos taken after the option is activated. It would be nice if it could sync all the photos taken by the camera available. Second, I store my photos on a external SD card (mounted as /mnt/extSdCard). When I sync my photos using InstantUpload, the app copy all my photos on the server (that's normal) but also on /mnt/sdCard/Owncloud/... (just as the app does when it downloads a local copy of a file on the server). So all my photos are stored twice on the system. Thanks
Manager.title: Instant Upload - Some improvements ?

Manager.description: I set up my ownCloud at home, and immediately went to get the Android app. It took me about 30 minutes of picture taking to figure out the procedure for getting instant upload to work, and I wanted to suggest that the method by which I had to do it, was perhaps not as obvious as it should be. Here is how I did it: Create the InstantUpload folder via the web interface in the root "/" of my ownCloud account. Upload a picture to the InstantUpload folder via the web interface. Test a manual upload from my Note to the InstantUpload folder (if you hadn't completed steps 1 and 2, it would fail telling you that the first time you had to be online, which is unfortunately not as clear as it needs to be). Take a picture, and look at your notification shade to see it now uploading automatically. My suggestion is not to have the instructions come up as a toast notification, but as a true notification that sits in the notification shade. I had to take a few pictures in a row to be able to even read the whole message. At that, tapping the notification should bring you to a step by step instructional page outlining how to enable Instant Upload properly. Now, it is very possible that what I had to do was not the standard way people are getting instant upload to work, but it worked for me - so even if it sits here in the GitHub for someone else to find, so be it. Thank you for reading. Jay
Manager.title: Galaxy Note - Getting Instant Upload to Work

Manager.description: If you store a lot directories (300 including subdirectories is sufficient), then any sync of the Android client will keep your webserver busy for a few minutes. The apache log shows approximately the following: x.x.x.x - tom [13/Apr/2013:10:54:17 +0200] "PROPFIND /remote.php/webdav/articles/A/ HTTP/1.1" 207 1425 x.x.x.x - tom [13/Apr/2013:10:54:17 +0200] "PROPFIND /remote.php/webdav/articles/B/ HTTP/1.1" 207 1360 x.x.x.x - tom [13/Apr/2013:10:54:18 +0200] "PROPFIND /remote.php/webdav/articles/C/ HTTP/1.1" 207 945 x.x.x.x - tom [13/Apr/2013:10:54:18 +0200] "PROPFIND /remote.php/webdav/articles/D/ HTTP/1.1" 207 982 x.x.x.x - tom [13/Apr/2013:10:54:19 +0200] "PROPFIND /remote.php/webdav/articles/E/ HTTP/1.1" 207 922 As you can see, each PROPFIND operation can take up to second and every sync triggers a PROPFIND for every directory in the cloud. Consequently the sync takes a few minutes in which the webserver is quite busy. This wastes many resources. The iOS client uses a different model: It queries the webserver every time the user changes directory and only asks for the content of the directory the user wants to see. I think this makes a lot more sense than the 'loop through everything' approach. It would be great if this was configurable. My standard use case is: On the laptop, copy a file to owncloud, grab the tablet, read it. On Android I get a five minute wait between the copying and the reading and also my webserver is too busy with basically no-ops.
Manager.title: Implement iOS (non-sync) browsing mode.

Manager.description: Expected behaviour Many camera's these days use exif metadata to define whether an image was taken in landscape or portrait mode, yet always store the image in landscape mode. To properly display such images, the exif data should be parsed for rotation information and this information should be used to apply the proper rotation to the image before displaying it. Actual behaviour I have found the the owncloud client on android ignores the exif rotation information. As a result, images are displayed in the wrong direction. Turning the android device to put the image upright triggers the auto-rotate function resulting in the image being rotated back to its wrong orientation. Environment data Android version: 4.1.1 Device model: Asus Transformer Prime TF201 Stock system, with all official updates applied ownCloud app version: 1.4.0 ownCloud server version: 4.5 Logs Skipped. I don't think this issue requires logs. If you do need them, please tell me which ones to upload.
Manager.title: Image viewer should use exif data to rotate image before displaying

Here the correct files: 21.05.2013 13:18 3'185'208 DSC_0438.jpg 21.05.2013 13:18 3'359'122 DSC_0439.jpg 21.05.2013 13:18 2'039'503 DSC_0440.jpg 21.05.2013 13:19 2'142'841 DSC_0441.jpg 21.05.2013 13:19 2'090'055 DSC_0442.jpg Here the files uploaded via instant upload from android: 21.05.2013 13:23 113'208 DSC_0438.jpg 21.05.2013 13:24 1'311'122 DSC_0439.jpg 21.05.2013 13:25 1'015'503 DSC_0440.jpg 21.05.2013 13:25 2'142'841 DSC_0441.jpg 21.05.2013 13:26 2'090'055 DSC_0442.jpg What's strange is the fact that this are not incomplete uploads, but realy corrupted (+incomplete?) uploads Attached the correct (left side) header of DSC_0439.jpg and the corrupt (right side) upload of it When I comprae the file byte per byte, then I see that the corrupt upload of DSC_0438 starts with the bytes which are shown at offset 0x2EE000 in the correct file. In file DSC_0439 they start at 0x1F4000 In file DSC_0440 they start at 0xFA000 Not sure if it's related to issues #42 or/and #91

That way I could centralize everything and not have to move things later. ownCloud has made it possible for me to start getting rid of my dropbox. You guys are awesome.

Manager.description: There are several Android devices in the family. Somtimes the mobil devices are refreshed, damaged or handed to someone else in the family. Every time the privat information should be cleared, in most cases the Apps are also cleared. So the need to buy apps multiple times over time is evident. To ease and overcome this, I invision to have an app repository in my OC, where all the apps that where bought are residing. Actually the idea is, that there could be a OC-app serving as "buying agent", that buying agent "installs" the apps into that repository for further use (not as an app that runs in the OC rather an app that will be available for redistribution to be installed on multiple devices, Than another service app in the OC would act as a "market place" that can be accessed by all mobil devices. All devices/users with access to the privat OC-bought apps repository, should be able to access the app market (kind of an internal store, where my Mobil devices could install all apps from this "internal store" - to the device. This is kind of a apps archive and "redistribution" idea for apps in my home mobil device infrastructure.
Manager.title: OC-Application "Store"

Manager.description: SETUP.md is rather light on details on setting up a new environment for building the OC Android app. I'd like to setup an environment under Jenkins to be able to build and test every commit to develop. What I feel is missing: List of 3rd party libraries the app uses and links to how to build and install them List of software dependencies needed to build the app, specifying versions there are version dependencies Steps needed to build the app from the command line and for different environments (i.e. Eclipse). IMNSHO, without these details it makes it difficult for someone new to the project to get up an running quickly.
Manager.title: As DevOps I'd like a complete guide on building the Android OC client so that we can perform automated builds in Jenkins

Manager.description: The OwnCloud Android app performs pretty poor on large file trees. FileListListAdapter traverses recursively through all subfolders get the file size of a directory while filling a view in getView(). This results in large database interactions in performance critical sections of the application. There are two possible solutions to this issue: calculate file size of directories on an own Thread. calculate file size of directories while syncing and safe directory size to the database. the latter one should be preferred as it doesn't fuck up the adapter and won't fill up the CPU/RAM/Stack
Manager.title: Poor performance on large file trees

Manager.description: By tapping the OC icon in the notification pull-down you can trigger an exploit which allows you to browse all your OC content without entering a PIN. There are many ways to trigger this: during or after an upload, using InstantUpload or manual upload, etc. Obviously, a prerequisite is that you have activated the app PIN in your settings. Example: Take a photo in order to trigger InstantUpload. Wait for the OC icon to appear in the notification bar. Pull down the notification bar and tap the icon. This will display the photo that was just uploaded. Tap "menu" and then "details". The file details are displayed. Tap the "back" button once. This will take you to the directory listing (in this case the "InstantUpload" folder). Tap "back" again and you are in your root directory, with full access to all directories, files and app settings. Step 5 should return to the photo. Step 6 should return to the home screen. Whenever directories are accessed, the user should be prompted for the app PIN, if one has been set. Samsung Galaxy Ace 2 running Android 2.3.6, app 1.4.1 and OC 5.0.7.
Manager.title: Exploit: Avoid the PIN prompt by tapping the OC icon in the notification pull-down

Manager.description: I really much miss the possibility to so select a folder for syncing on Android which is outside the /owncloud-folder. At the moment I still have to use Dropbox for making backups/syncing of appdata (like e.g. Titanium Backup). Many apps have Dropbox implemented which makes it easy to use. But since they are basically just uploading a file/folder, it would be very easy to replace this function by Owncloud, if the Owncloud-syncclient for Android would able to select the folder the data is stored on the phone.
Manager.title: wish: possibility to sync folders outside of /owncloud/*

Manager.description: owncloud don't detect pictures taken with latest sony xperia acro s firmware (before i use cyanogenmod 10, it works perfect). I use build in camera app. Android version 4.1.2 (firmware 6.2.b.0.200), owncloud version 1.4.1
Manager.title: InstantUpload don't work on latest Sony Xperia acro s firmware

Manager.description: Please add the ability to choose which subfolder inside the owncloud root directory should be synced (as in the PC client). I have several subfolders, some are external storages, and I don't want all of them synced to my mobile device.
Manager.title: Let user choose what folder in the remote server should be taken as root for synchronization

Manager.description: Expected behaviour App to react in a quick fashion, especially when in the same network as the server, with full WiFi reception. Actual behaviour The app is running unusably slow at the moment. Just when I start it, it takes about half a minute before it shows any folder listing, before it just shows the title bar and white for the rest of the screen. Then when it finally shows the file list, every action (clicking on any folder, clicking the back button, or even just clicking on the settings button or trying to save them) sometimes (every second time or so) takes about 10 seconds... frequently also the popup "App is not reacting. Do you want to close it?" pops up. I have no files which I keep "up to date", the synchronisation in the account is disabled, I mainly use ownCloud on the android to access one file, which I infrequently manually download; I do have "Instant Upload" enabled (but that doesn't seem to be fully working either, it doesn't upload all my images, only some of them, but that's another story). When I'm saying the app is slow, I mean there is no feedback whatsoever if the app is still doing something (let alone what it is doing), the user interface is just stuck; when coming back from settings it sometimes just turns black for a few seconds... When coming back from the lock screen, I can't even scroll in the file list, I have to wait for a few seconds... Any more information I could provide to help resolve this? The GN shouldn't be that out of date for the app to run so slow? What could cause this? From my momentary perspective also the battery seems to drain quite fast when the app is running... Edit: Clearing the App's data didn't change anything. Will try reinstalling next, just to be sure. Edit 2: Great: After a re-install, it doesn't seem to be able to connect to the account again. It always (first time with the still existing account data, and two more times with the (definitely correctly) entered password) says "invalid credentials". Edit 3: Removed and recreated the account, restarted the phone, re-tried entering the password several times, but now still just getting an unjustified "Invalid credentials" (the provided credentials are definitely correct). I guess this is basically the worst-case-scenario - going from unusably slow to not usable at all... Any hints what I could try? I've exhausted all usual methods of resolving Android app problems I could think of! Environment data Android version: 4.2.2 Device model: Galaxy Nexus Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 1.4.1 ownCloud server version: 5.0.7 Logs Web server error log no relevant entries ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) no relevant entries
Manager.title: App unusably slow / Unjustified "Invalid credentials" after reinstall

Manager.description: (Like in the web interface, see owncloud/core#993. Same for iOS, see owncloud/ios-issues#85 ) An idea from iOS apps, probably also used elsewhere: The last entry in the list always says how many items there are in the list, for example »34 entries«. It should state the number of files and folders at the current level, like »5 folders and 49 files«. In grey and centered so it looks different from the actual files.
Manager.title: As an ownCloud Android user, I want to know how many files and folders I am looking at

Manager.description: this free software project, if developed a bit, would enable syncing owncloud calendars with android's calendar app: https://github.com/gggard/AndroidCaldavSyncAdapater however, it's incomplete. there's no other free software app i know of that allows caldav to be used with android's default calendar. the only other option i know of is acal, and it's got some fairly major issues. it would be really nice if owncloud's calendar could be used on android with free software.

Manager.description: Expected behaviour The Owncloud file client on Android and iPad doesn't show files, that were deleted on the server before. Actual behaviour The Owncloud file client on Android and iPad shows the last file, that was deleted on the server before. Trying to access that file from the Android/iPad client results in an error message, that either the file is broken or doesn't exist. It works after a while and I assume, because I closed and reopened the ownCloud site in my browser on the server. Steps to reproduce On the server delete some files in the browser. In the Android or iPad ownCloud client hit 'Refresh' Server configuration MAMP-Stack from week 29/2013. Operating system: OSX 10.6.8 Web server: Apache/2.2.23 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.2.23 OpenSSL/0.9.8x DAV/2 PHP/5.4.10 Database: SQLite PHP version: 5.4.10 ownCloud version: 4.5.13 Browser: Firefox 22.0 Operating system: OSX 10.6.8 Client configuration Android: 2.2 Latest ownCloud client iPad: iOS 6.1.3 Latest ownCloud client

Manager.description: This is my first time submitting an issue so bear with me. Expected behaviour Able to choose a default app for playing downloaded songs (mp3) instead of the built-in ownCloud music player. Actual behaviour When I try to download or listen to mp3-files that I have already downloaded, ownCloud still tries to open them in the built-in ownCloud music player instead of Google Music that I have choosen as my default player. I have already tried the following from the ownCloud music player: Hit "Menu" > "Open with" and set Google Music as my default/standard player. But ownCloud does not respect this and insists on opening the file with the ownCloud built-in music player first so I have to use the "Open with" every time I want to listen to a mp3 from the ownCloud app. Is there a way to disable the built-in ownCloud music player? Environment data Android version: 4.1.2 Device model: Samsung Galaxy Note II Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 1.4.3 ownCloud server version: 5.0.9
Manager.title: Deactivate the built-in ownCloud Music Player?

Manager.description: Currently uses the big yellow Gingerbread style progress bar even if the phone is 4.0+.
Manager.title: Progress bar in Instant Upload Notification should use ICS style on 4.0+ phones

Manager.description: I am using my own installation of OwnCloud 5.0.10, and the Android client 1.4.4. My WiFi network at work redirects all traffic to a login page. Once you've logged in it remembers your device (presumably by MAC address?) and stops redirecting traffic. If I attempt to browse my server using the Android client before I log in, no error is displayed. Instead, I'm presented with an empty / folder. If I exit the client, browse to a website, log in to WiFi, then return to the client, then I can see my files. I'd expect that if the client receives a nonsensical response (e.g. a WiFi login page) it'd display some sort of error message instead of just an empty file list.
Manager.title: WiFi login page causes Android client to fail silently

Manager.description: Consider the following use case: I use my device as an offline reader for PDFs that I find throughout the day on my desktop. When I find a document that I want to read later, I copy it to an ownCloud-shared folder. When I get to my Android device, I want all files collected during the day to be available on it, even in offline mode. Currently I have to perform the following tiresome sequence on the device: Press "Update" and wait until finishes Open the folder used to store new documents Click on each of the documents so that it gets downloaded and opened in a PDF viewer Close the viewer and proceed to the next file. When there are more than a couple of new files this sequence becomes a really boring thing to do. What I want to suggest is that certain folders can be marked as auto-update, just like it can be done for individual files today. The above scenario becomes much more simple: 0. Mark a folder as "auto-update" (once) Press "Update" and wait until all new files are downloaded to the device.
Manager.title: Enhancement: allow folders to be synchronized automatically.

Manager.description: I' running the owncloud app version 1.4.4 on a 4.3 android phone. If i have enable ssl via the webinterface and download a file up to 97MB, the server gets busy up to 100%. The only thing what i can do, is reset the server, no input are possible. Smaler files are no problems if ssl is enabled. If it is disabled i can also download bigger files without problems. Owncloud server is 5.0.10 Is this a problem of the ssl certificate or is this a problem of android 4.3 or a problem of the owncloud app?
Manager.title: If ssl is enabled and i download a big file the server gets busy to 100%

Manager.description: If I have a weak network connection it happens quite often that my mobile phone loses the connection during an instant upload. The app informs me that the upload failed but it is quite hard to find out which files are uploaded and which not when I'm back on my desktop. It would be a great improvement if the Android app would remember which instant uploads failed and try to upload them again later. Maybe after a given timespan or simply if a new instant upload gets triggered because the user took a new photo.

I feel very disheartened that a copy-paste style of building an existing project, on a fresh environment, by following the available instructions, fails. How to properly integrate them and result in a buildable OC app project from the main source, vanilla as is?

Manager.description: Hi, I have been using owncloud to sync Linux, Windows and Android devices for a while already. I placed the files to sync on the clients in a "clientsync" folder. I just reinstalled my phone from scratch (Samsung Galaxy Nexus cyanogenmod 3.0.72) and the latest version of owncloud that I installed (1.5.0) does not seem to allow me to sync only the remote "clientsync" folder. Instead it syncs the whole of my owncloud storage which has thousands of files irrelevant to my phone. Is there a way to sync only the remote "clientsync" folder like it was in the past? Thanks.
Manager.title: Select which server folder to sync

Manager.description: I use Titanium backup to make backups of all my apps. Now, I'm very anal retentive and want to back these up to my ownCloud instance, so I set Titanium to back up to a folder under ownCloud. However, the only way to get it to sync is to 'upload' each file manually, which is time consuming. Yes, I can do it 'once' and then it will sync changes, but if I install a new app I have to remember to do this. I think a feature that'd be useful, would be to set up a folder on my Android and allow that to sync any changes and upload folders/files automatically.
Manager.title: Upload Files From Folder

Manager.description: Having installed new owncloud with setupscript and am using Android app on my new S4. Login seems to work, but i don't see any data. Also, uploading will fail. Won't create folders too. Any idea? Best
Manager.title: Android Version 1.50 with jellybean Workaround on new Samsung S4

Manager.description: Didn't find this in issues for enhancements or anything so thought I would throw it out there. Would be nice to have a menu of button option to add a new folder/directory whenever you are uploading a file via Share ... for instance, under gallery you're viewing a picture, you click on share icon like you would for Facebook, Owncloud, etc, right now you can only upload to existing folders, would be nice to be able to add a new directory :)
Manager.title: FEATURE: Add option to add folder/directory when uploading (via Android Share As)

Manager.description: Expected behaviour Files added or removed from root folder should appear or disappear from Android client when the client is refreshed. Actual behaviour Files appear correctly after the first login. After that, files in the root folder do not change to match changes made on the server. If a file is added, removed or renamed it will remain the same in the Android client. Refresh, reboot and app relaunch don't help. Resetting the app data or reinstalling the app does cause the contents to refresh once (after logging in again). Folders work normally. Files inside folders work normally. The problem is only with files in the root folder. Steps to reproduce Install Android app Login and note files in root folder are correct Change a file (add, delete or rename) using the web interface or sync client. Refresh the Android app and note that files in the root folder do not change Environment data Android version: 4.3 and 4.2.2 Device model: Galaxy Nexus and Nexus 7 Stock or customized system: One custom, one stock ownCloud app version: 1.5.0 ownCloud server version: 4.5.13 running on CentOS 6 (installed from epel yum repository)
Manager.title: Android client not displaying changes to root directory

Manager.description: I cannot login with my Android Device when i set a password with german umlauts (äöü). If I change the password to a password without umlauts then the login works fine. The same problem appeard in the past with the Windows Desktop Client but for this client the problem has been fixed with version 1.4.1 ( owncloud/mirall#1017 ) Here some details of my current setup: Google Nexus 4 ownCloud Android App Version 1.5.0 ownCloud 5.0.12 on Ubuntu Server 13.10 64bit
Manager.title: Login problem with passwords that include german umlauts

Manager.description: The app should be renamed to owncloud files to prevent users from thinking that calendar and contact sync are implemented
Manager.title: Rename owncloud to owncloud files

Manager.description: cc @jancborchardt
Manager.title: As an android app user i want to move my files to a different folder

Manager.description: Since I upgraded from OC 5 to 6.0 (RC2, RC4 and now the final version), every time I upload a file to a shared folder (==a folder someone has shared with me) Android app (v 1.5.1), the upload is done correctly (the file gets uploaded), but the rename seems to fail (files remain with their temporary name: .ocTransferIdXXX). The apps shows that an error happened in the upload. I don't know if the issue is client-side or server-side, it is happening on both Android and IOs clients (not while uploading through browser or windows desktop client). I've created an issue also on the IOs section (owncloud/ios-issues#146) I would appreciate it if someone could try to reproduce the issue so that we know if it's a general problem or something wrong with my setup. Steps: 1- User A shared a folder "MyFolder" to User B with all the permissions granted 2- User B, using the Android mobile app, tries to upload a file to MyFolder The upload fails on the client, but the file has been uploaded but not renamed from the temporary name (which includes the .ocTransferIdXXX suffix) Cheers Cheers
Manager.title: [OC Android 1.5.1][OC 6.0.0.13] Upload issue on shared folder

Manager.description: Provide an option to specify the InstantUpload-Folder. It would be nice if it wouldn't be just the hardcoded locale-dependent like SofortUpload. I've got the need, that I have to sort all data of my phone in on one folder and in another the data of my Laptop, so it would be nice, if the DirectUpload function would move the file automatically into a nested tree, without doing manual actions. Use something like a menu, which chooses a folder and use only as default the folder SofortUpload.
Manager.title: Path for Instant-Upload-Folder

Manager.description: I just ran into this issue: A few days ago I downloaded a file with Android ownCloud -> Green triangle with down arrow appeared. Today I wanted to view the file again (it was updated on the server in the mean time). The file date was updated, so Android ownCloud detected a file change. The green triangle stayed however. When selecting the file, it opened the old version of the file (which I of course noticed too late). Solution: Long click on file "Update file". This is not intuitive. Possible fixes: Suggestion A: Delete offline file when update is detected (green triangle dissappears as soon file date changes). Suggestion B: When clicking an updated file warn user that file has changed on server and suggest to download uptodate copy. Suggestion C: When clicking file, download new version. In case of no connection, suggest to open old version of file. EDITED @rperezb and @owncloud/android-developers : Taking into account the feedback in this issue as well as the current behavior of the ownCloud iOS app the option selected is *C - When clicking file, download new version. In case of no connection, open old version of file * In case of conflict (different versions local and server) the way to go is the regular one: Open the local version Set the file as conflict one (labelled with the icon) Fix the conflict taking advantage of the sync option where the user will be offered to rename, duplicate or cancel EDITED @malkomich: TASKS [GIT] Create 333_update_server_changes_on_download_files branch from master in android repo @malkomich [DEV] Perform a sync operation when the file is opened @malkomich [DEV] Launch an advise and capture it when the sync/download operation finish @jabarros [DEV] Update dinamically the content of the file on the file preview @jabarros [QA] Create 333_update_server_changes_on_download_files branch from master in QA repo @jesmrec [QA] Merge 333_update_server_changes_on_download_files branch into master in QA repo (PR #1736) [QA] Create test plan @jesmrec [QA] Validate test plan @mcastroSG [GIT] Merge 333_update_server_changes_on_download_files branch into master in android repo BUGS Media files (audio and video) are not refreshed when a new version is downloaded from the server #333 (comment) [FIXED] Image files are not refreshed with the new version when clicked [FIXED] Too many messages "file is already synced" [READY_TO_TEST] Not previewable files are not refreshed with the new version when clicked [FIXED] Track download progress in previews when a fresh version of the file is downloading in background [FIXED] Conflict resolved with both files does not end properly. #333 (comment) App crashes after set a photo as available offline and tap on another photo #333 (comment) [FIXED] Available offline state is not shown properly #333 (comment) [FIXED]
Manager.title: Automatic download for already downloaded file when file updated?

Manager.description: Hi, It would be nice to access to the changelog from the interface instead of searching the web or going on the google play store. Regards, jpg
Manager.title: Add access to the changelog in the interface

Manager.description: Are there any instructions available how to setup the project in IntelliJ?
Manager.title: Development using IntelliJ / Android Studio

Manager.description: Expected behaviour On same wifi as owncloud server, I expect uploads to happen fast without issue. If it does fail for whatever issue, I expect it to recognize it fast. Actual behaviour Doesn't happen all the time, but sometimes the upload fails or even stalls. I think the uploads also seem slow for being on the same wifi as the server, but I can't really say for sure. What do I mean by stall? While uploading a 25 megs file, the notification bar says it has been at 38% for atleast a confirmed 1 hour, with no sign of moving or registering as a fail. When I click the notification icon, it opens up the file view, but shows no progress bar at all. The file isn't visible on the server through normal web view. As best I can tell there is no way to cancel this upload either. The destination folder wasn't a shared folder, just a normal one. Steps to reproduce Upload multiple files (above 2 megs, sometimes around 20 megs). I was uploading through the share within ROM Toolbox trying to backup all my apps. But I have had this happen with share within Gallery too with multiple files. Rinse and repeat until it happens. It doesn't happen all the time, I was able to upload probably 300 megs until one file stalled. Environment data Android version: 4.1.2 Device model: Droid Bionic Stock or customized system: rooted stock ownCloud app version:1.5.2 ownCloud server version: 6.0.0a (stable) Logs Web server error log The date this happened is 12/29. The log wasn't set to everything until after the event, so basically nothing was shown in the log on the issue. The server log was set to whatever is default with the installation. Debug OC\Files\Cache\Scanner !!! No reuse of etag for 'cache' !!! cache: Array ( [fileid] => 113 [storage] => home::ricky [path] => cache [parent] => 1 [name] => cache [mimetype] => httpd/unix-directory [mimepart] => httpd [size] => 307996384 [mtime] => 1387989356 [storage_mtime] => 1387989356 [encrypted] => [unencrypted_size] => 0 [etag] => 52bb172d29f2c ) data: Array ( [mimetype] => httpd/unix-directory [mtime] => 1388335368 [size] => -1 [etag] => 52c0577333d6c [storage_mtime] => 1388335368 ) 2013-12-29T17:10:11+00:00 Warning PHP Invalid argument supplied for foreach() at /media/hd1/www/owncloud/apps/files_versions/lib/versions.php#519 2013-12-25T18:12:05+00:00 Warning PHP Undefined index: all at /media/hd1/www/owncloud/apps/files_versions/lib/versions.php#477 2013-12-25T18:12:05+00:00 ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) Unfortunately I tried doing a search with ASTRO File Manager, and I was unable to find any "owncloud.log" files located internally or on the sd card.
Manager.title: Upload Issues

Manager.description: Hello guys! Owncloud is missing some basic features to make it usable on android. I'm unable to share pictures from owncloud to other applications. All I can find is the "Open With" option, with does not comply with the interface guidelines. Steps to reproduces: Open an image with OwnCloud Search for Share button to share it with other applications. What should happen: There should be a "Share it" button which can be used to share the pic with other applications. I.e. WhatsApp What actually happens: There's a "Open With" Button which enables me to view the picture in the Gallery App, never the less, I'm unable to share the picture with other applications than that one, neither from Owncloud itself nor from the opening Gallery App My System: Motorola Photon Q with Cyanogenmod 10.2 (Android 4.3)
Manager.title: Owncloud for Android breaks sharing workflow

Manager.description: Being able to download/synchronize an entire folder on android would be a very usefull feature. Use case: We have a tablet that we use for photo presentations. if it would automatically update when we added new images to our owncloud gallery it would save a lot of time :-)
Manager.title: Download/Sync a folder to disk

Manager.description: Based on the latest Flat UIs would really look nice to have a simple progress bar instead of the yellow gradient. Alongside, is it also possible to change the button yellow to blue/white based on Holo Theme.
Manager.title: Change Progress Bar Gradient

Manager.description: Hello, ownCloud client 1.5.2 on KitKat When I have setup the ownlocud client to do a instant upload, but only when on WIFI, this works fine so long I'm on wifi when taking the picture(s). When I am out of any wifi connection and take fotos, then I expect the instant upload to start as soon as I have a wifi connection. Currently these fotos are never uploaded to the owncloud server
Manager.title: Automatic retry of instant uploads captured while offline when appropriate network is recovered

Manager.description: I have been trying to allow @davivel to do some testing with the Android application. I got him a user setup but the uploads are failing and the site is very sluggish. He had suggested I open a new ticket and work with someone to improve the site performance and get it setup so that it is working at 100% so we can start the Android app testing.
Manager.title: Sluggish performance and upload failures

Manager.description: On my phone the file was named »IMG_20140131_190416.JPG«. After upload, the file is only named »_20140131_190416.JPG«. Why is »IMG« cut from the beginning?
Manager.title: Upload cut »IMG« part of name

Manager.description: The version on f-droid repo is still 1.5.2. Is there a reason ? On play store it's 1.5.3.
Manager.title: F-droid version

Manager.description: After enabling the InstantUpload feature, all photo files seem to be duplicated by the client - they exist once in their original location in the DCIM folder, and once in the /owncloud/user@ochost/(Instant|Sofort)Upload folder. This seems redundant to me - I don't see any use in having those duplicate files? The only thing I can think of which such a copy could achieve would be marking which files are successfully uploaded? But there surely is a simpler way of doing that than to just copy the file? Maybe store a file with the same name as the image plus e.g. .hash suffix, containing a hash of the uploaded file? Those copies just wastes a lot of space on my (non-extensible) internal storage. Using the latest version available in Market (1.4.3). Server version is 6.0.1 (but is going on since 5.0.13 at least).
Manager.title: InstantUpload files duplicated in ownCloud folder

Manager.description: Not sure if this is the right place. Among many other folders I am syncing one with MP3s. When I click on one, I can play and hear it. But I cannot load it into the music player nor to a playlist. I want to avoid copying files from the OwnCloud directory to the music folder with the default Android FileManager. This goes against the idea of syncing. Any ideas?
Manager.title: As an user I would like to open audio, video and image files in other applications from the OC app, even though they can be previewed into it. (BEFORE: How to add MP3 to a playlist without using the Android file manager?)

Manager.description: Our ownCloud account(s) password(s) is(/are) stored in plaintext under the "password" column, into the database file: /data/system/account.db Wouldn't it be - for example - possible to at least obfuscate it in order to have it a bit more protected ? Even though we should not, you know that many of us have rooted phones, and it could be a (slight) security plus for our ownCloud account(s) security not to store them as pure plaintext ... don't you think so ? Versions: Owncloud Android Client version: 1.5.2 Android version: 2.3.7 (rooted)
Manager.title: SECURITY: Accounts passwords stored in plaintext

Manager.description: As you know we generate »filename (2)« for duplicates. Currently sorting goes like this: filename (2) filename (3) filename Which makes it pretty confusing since the original document is all the way on the bottom. Instead it should go like this: filename filename (2) filename (3) Even worse, when you have numbers in parentheses which exceed 10, it sorts like this: filename (18) filename (19) filename (2) filename (20) filename (21)
Manager.title: Sorting is off for filenames with (2) numbers in parentheses

Manager.description: Currently when viewing a picture, the background is white. This brightness really distracts from the picture itself. Instead, the background should be black (as in #000). That blends in with the notification bar and lower bar and gives full emphasis on the pictures also, the icons in the lower bar and notification bar distract. When you’re in the »view mode« (after you tap the image) where the app top bar is hidden, the icons of the notification bar and lower bar should be hidden (only visible as slight dots) just like in the normal Gallery app
Manager.title: Picture viewing enhancements

Manager.description: I was asked to file a bug report on the forum. It seems the test as you type the server address causes an issue if you have an invalid SSL cert which many of us will have running home based servers. While typing in the server address the client tests it and and invalid SSL Cert dialog pops up but then the next character I had already started typing brings focus back to the client so the SSL Cert Dialog is moved to the background and the connection can't be completed because its waiting on the dialog to be closed.
Manager.title: Android Cleint SSL Cert Window popup looses focus.

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce Web: login to ownCloud server Web: Create a folder "to delete" on the server Web: Create a text file "test.txt" inside and write some contents in it Android Client: Refresh the account to trigger sync Android Client: navigate into "to delete" and download the "test.txt" Android File Manager: navigate to the account's folder, see that "to delete" exists Web: Delete folder "to delete" Android Client: refresh the account and see that "to delete" disappeared from the ownCloud app Android File Manager: Using a file manager, navigate to the account's folder Expected result "to delete" folder is gone from the mobile device's filesystem Actual result "to delete" folder still exists and so does "test.txt". If that file was huge it would waste the mobile device's space without the user knowing. Versions Android app: 1.5.3 OC server: 6.0.1 File Manager: Ghost Commander
Manager.title: Delete already synced folder from server, still exists on client

Manager.description: Priority: Low The Android client doesn't save the scroll position when moving between folders. Steps to reproduce: Scroll down through a long list of folders open any folder use the "back" button you are back at the beginning of the first list Expected behavior: When returning from opened folder, stay at the same position that you were on in the original folder Patch to fix behavior: // save index and top position int index = mList.getFirstVisiblePosition(); View v = mList.getChildAt(0); int top = (v == null) ? 0 : v.getTop(); // ... // restore index and position mList.setSelectionFromTop(index, top);
Manager.title: Scroll position not saved moving between folders

Manager.description: Hello, when I install my own ownCloud app, where is edited name, and design.. and when i check in Play Store ownCloud payed app its marked as installed. What part of code I need to change, so once I install my own app, I don't want ownCloud orginal app in Play store to be marked as installed Best regards
Manager.title: "ownCloud" app name at Google Play Store

Manager.description: Hello, I want to know is ownCloud have the sync contact function on android device yet? Best regards
Manager.title: Sync contact

Manager.description: I have an HTC One V that I would really like to replace Dropbox's Camera Upload with something I am in control of. I got this to work perfectly with a Samsung Galaxy S3. Now I need to add an HTC One V to the same setup. I install the app, turn on uploading of pictures, take a picture, and nothing happens. I have looked through the owncloud forums and this issue tracker and it appears that this bug was resolved? Please let me know if I can provide more information. This is with the android app v1.5.4 and server 6.01
Manager.title: HTC One V InstantUpload does not respond.

Manager.description: Hello, after installing v 1.5.4 the login works, i see my files and folders but a second later i'm back at login screen. With v 1.5.2 it works properly. Tested on my nexus 4 and 7
Manager.title: Problems after login v 1.5.4

Manager.description: The update today (or yesterday, the one with sharing) made the ownCloud app icon vanish from the homescreen. As far as I remember this is not the first time this happens, and it sometimes happens with other apps too. I searched around a bit and it might be a problem the apps themselves need to handle: http://www.reddit.com/r/Android/comments/1s3fn3/anybody_else_notice_every_time_apps_update_in/ If an app changes the name/class of the default activity, the icon is removed. This is what causes some of it. Any idea @davivel?
Manager.title: App icon vanishes from homescreen on update

Manager.description: I have a local folder. In that folder i created a folder with content. At the next sync, the client downloaded te complete folder. The owncloud webinterface shows that all the files and folders have not changed within a year (wich is correct) and the new local folder is uploaded. I did not login in the webinterface that day and there are no other users using that folder. I use ownCloud 5.0.14a on Apache an Ubuntu 12 Client is Windows 8 Owncloud client is 1.5.2 buiold 2445 (the latest at this moment)
Manager.title: Adding a local folder downloads entire folder from server

Manager.description: Expected behaviour The upload queue is cleared. If there are pending files ask if the files should be uploaded using the new account ? Actual behaviour The file is stuck. If you change your account details and there are currently files in a queue to be uploaded the account details that were present at the time of the upload being queued will be used causing AccountNotFound exception or other access related errors. Steps to reproduce Queue up a bunch of files to be synced Change account details Environment data Android version: 4.4.2 Device model: Nexus 5 Stock or customized system: ownCloud app version: 1.5.3 ownCloud server version: 4.5.13 Logs ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) 03-03 15:17:50.473: E/FileUploader(13865): Error while trying to get autorization for user@ip 03-03 15:17:50.473: E/FileUploader(13865): com.owncloud.android.lib.accounts.AccountUtils$AccountNotFoundException: Account not found 03-03 15:17:50.473: E/FileUploader(13865): at com.owncloud.android.lib.accounts.AccountUtils.constructFullURLForAccount(AccountUtils.java:90) 03-03 15:17:50.473: E/FileUploader(13865): at com.owncloud.android.lib.network.OwnCloudClientFactory.createOwnCloudClient(OwnCloudClientFactory.java:73) 03-03 15:17:50.473: E/FileUploader(13865): at com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileUploader.uploadFile(FileUploader.java:488) 03-03 15:17:50.473: E/FileUploader(13865): at com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileUploader$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(FileUploader.java:458) 03-03 15:17:50.473: E/FileUploader(13865): at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) 03-03 15:17:50.473: E/FileUploader(13865): at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:136) 03-03 15:17:50.473: E/FileUploader(13865): at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:61)
Manager.title: Upload queue can't complete post account details changed

Manager.description: Dear reader, i searched the forums and found similar problems but no real fix for it. I have a Galaxy S4 and Owncloud installed on Linux. The owncloud is functioning fine, i can login with the App on Samsung S3, S2 and Webdav on win7 and with webbrowsers. So the problems doesnt seem to be in the server but on the S4. The S4 has Android version 4.3 on it. What happens is, as soon as i open the App (after i put in the server and password) a blank screen comes with the little Cloud in the Top and thats it. After that it does nothing. Does anyone has any ideas on how to fix this ? Thank you very much for your response in advance. And i already tried de-install and re-install etc. P.
Manager.title: S4 and App for OwnCloud blank screen after login

Manager.description: It would be great to have move features on Andriod App.
Manager.title: Is move feature coming to Andriod ?

Manager.description: I use the ownCloud app for android version 1.5.4 on my Google Nexus 5 (Kitkat 4.4.2). Somehow direct sharing of images doesn't work, no error whatsoever or at least not on screen or in the logs I viewed. Looks like the OC server isn't even accessed. For example I open gallery, choose a picture, choose owncloud in the sharing menu. Owncloud opens, I browse to my photo folder and click on upload. Nothing at all, again not even an error. Other types of files do work.
Manager.title: Android app direct sharing of images

Manager.description: Current behaviour: I can only select one file (for example to delete, rename or share it). Expected behaviour: I want to be able to select many files and folders. An "action bar" should appear (compare to android browser on text-selecting) with some actions, for example: delete, share, move, ... Mockup:
Manager.title: Action on multiple Files

Manager.description: As a user i'd like to have the ability to pull from bottom to down in the app to refresh the current folder (or account?). This behaviour is known from "eBay Kleinanzeigen"-App and the Android 4.4 E-Mail-Client. CC @jancborchardt
Manager.title: Pull to refresh instead of context-menu-entry

Manager.description: In the OwnCloud app there is a way to send a mail to apps@owncloud.com. Some kind of answer would be nice within one week.
Manager.title: Reply to mails please

Manager.description: Could the app please download images in a nice size? At the moment (1.5.4) it comsumes Megabytes of traffic. I understand some people need the original image or want to zoom as much as possible.
Manager.title: Shrink images before download

Manager.description: After a lot of searching and guessing, could you please change the label "Keep file up to date" to something understandable? Version: 1.5.4
Manager.title: What does "Keep file up to date" mean?

Manager.description: The app should never start itself when photo upload is disabled. At the moment the app (1.5.4) consumes most of the battery capacity even when it does not seem to run. Deleting Owncloud folder, "App data", "Cache" and rebooting does not help. Astonishingly, after doing all this the app still has my credentials and lists my server's data. I will wait with uninstalling to provide more information if needed. The loading circle in the app always rotates. Maybe this is helpful.
Manager.title: Enormous battery drain

Manager.description: I imported all the projects (dev branch) to eclipse, cleaned them, but still I am getting error messages in the "owncloud-android" project: styles.xml: "error: Error: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'actionBarStyle'." verstioned_styles.xml: "error: Error retrieving parent for item: No resource found that matches the given name 'style/ Widget.Sherlock.Spinner.DropDown.ActionBar'." Can you help me?
Manager.title: Can't get the eclipse project running

Manager.description: Expected behaviour If I want to download several mp3 files from the server but to playback them with another player than the ownCloud client itself, I would like to have some item in the long press menu that says "Download". Actual behaviour At the moment if I open a mp3 file the app opens a file view where it downloads the file and starts playback afterwards. Downloading several mp3 files from the server requires to "open" every file separately, wait for the download indicator to start, get back to the containing folder, open the next file and repeat the procedure for every file. Environment data Phone 1 Android version: 2.3 Device model: LG Optimus P500 Stock or customized system: Cyanogen 7.2 ownCloud app version: 1.5.4 Phone 2 Android version: 4.2 Device model: Fairphone Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud server version: 6.0.2
Manager.title: Allow download from long press menu

Manager.description: There was a request (at Chemnitz Linux Days) for the feature to not specify a password on the setup an account. Then the user should be prompted at every start of the app to type in the password.
Manager.title: Option to not save password

Manager.description: Hello, on Android 2.2 I have always crashes with ownCloud app in Version 1.5.4 while syncing from server to smartphone. I'm not able to send a report, because the popup window disappear before I can press a button.
Manager.title: ownCloud app crashes

Manager.description: I created a new text file, via owncloud's web interface (New -> Text file). The resulting file is 26 bytes long. Downloading it via the android client is impossible (F-Droid , version 1.5.4) Tried a 1024 byte dummy file and it works. Is there a bottom limit at work I am not aware of? ownCloud 6.0.2 (stable) - running in debian 7, nginx 1.4.4
Manager.title: Cannot download 26Byte file

Manager.description: how to fix this problem
Manager.title: Problem with styles.xml

Manager.description: Dear devs, from my point of view the current android client already works quite well - congratulation for that :) A very handy and convenient option of Instant Upload would be the "upload all" option, meaning to take to all existing photos (e.g. in the DCIM folder) into account and when this function is triggered, upload all of them to the "instant upload" folder of owncloud (best would be to only upload the missing one in the cloud). With this method a user could easily complete his cloud picture archieve, due to failed uploads or prior to installation of the owncloud client. P.S. A similar option is available with Google Plus and their instant upload funtctionality.
Manager.title: Instant Upload - Option "Upload all" (upload existing pictures / photos)

Manager.description: We think it would be ideal if you had the ability to change the folder your instant uploads go to. When sharing multiple users instant uploads you end up with a bunch of numbered instant upload folder and you do not know who's is who's. Additionally, the owners user or full name next to the shared folder would help with this problem and others, so either or both would be a welcome fix and improvement in functionality.
Manager.title: InstantUpload Folder Name Customization

Manager.description: Hello together, I just asked a question (non-english) using the feedback button and got the answer, that I'd write in English. In my opinion the support's (main?) language should be mentioned in the app. This would save time and support expenses. Best regards lub
Manager.title: notice the support language for feedback

Manager.description: Currently when I want to upload a file, the dialog shows the hidden files and folders before the other ones. This is very distracting since the hidden files Four possible solutions: Don’t show hidden folders or files (I don’t think that’s good because you might want to upload them) Have a switch to show hidden files (Might be good, but a bit more work and it would be a prominent switch.) Sort hidden files and folders after normal files and folders (Not very elegant and just shifts the problem) Sort hdiden files and folders among normal files and folders, alphabetically. Basically just omit the dot when sorting. I think option 4 is the most elegant and easy one. What do you think @rperezb @davivel?
Manager.title: Upload file dialog: hidden files/folders are shown first

Manager.description: Problem started with second last version (1.5.4?). Automatic ownCloud sync is activated on the smartphone. One file ist in state "keep up-to-date". Syncing drains the battery and my data plan.
Manager.title: 1.5.5 drains battery and data plan

Manager.description: My owncloud server is running in https only on a nginx server and I use server certificates from cacert, cacert root certificates are not included on my android device (and probably in any android). When I installed the owncloud app it was able to connect without problems to the server but I was only able to browse and read the files, any attempt to upload did stalled forever, in the server log I found lots of lines like those: x.x.x.x - username [04/Apr/2014:20:49:54 +0200] "HEAD /remote.php/webdav/documents/0523acaa096b5e583292145dc8bb77be%20(7).jpg HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Android-ownCloud" x.x.x.x - username [04/Apr/2014:20:49:55 +0200] "HEAD /remote.php/webdav/documents/0523acaa096b5e583292145dc8bb77be%20(8).jpg HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Android-ownCloud" x.x.x.x - username [04/Apr/2014:20:49:55 +0200] "HEAD /remote.php/webdav/documents/0523acaa096b5e583292145dc8bb77be%20(9).jpg HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Android-ownCloud" but nothing was uploaded. Today I installed CACert's root certificates on my android device and viola, everything works perfectly. I just wanted to let you know since I was not able to find a solution online, maybe others have a similar problem with a server using certificates not issued by a CA trusted by Android.
Manager.title: Strange issue with CACert certificates

Manager.description: Current situation: Prerequisite: have pending files that need to be uploaded to the ownCloud server. For example new images from the camera that should be automatically uploaded through InstantUpload folder. In Android go to Settings > Accounts > and delete the associated ownCloud account the Android ownCloud app will continue to try to upload the files and display error messages in the notification bar (File xyz could not be uploaded to the server). Expected behavior: Delete the associated ownCloud account. The ownCloud app will not attempt to sync, upload or download as there is no account associated.
Manager.title: Removing associated ownCloud account should cease all activity in the app

Manager.description: Hello, is it possible to upload new pictures/Videos to an Folder within the upload Date?
Manager.title: auto upload with Date Folder

Manager.description: The android app refuses my password containing diactritics such as é à û while this password is perfectly recognized and accepted by the desktop client and web page. Tested with android app v 1.5.4 on android 4.3 and 4.4.2
Manager.title: Unable to login with some passwords

Manager.description: I tried using the owncloud mobile sync app (1.5.5, purchased via google play store) with an IDN domain name, but the client can´t find the server. Using the web interface works without any flaws.
Manager.title: Owncloud server with IDN domain name not recognized

Manager.description: AC: There must be a new option on the action bar in the navigation drawer called Uploads should it be on the bar or under the menu botton as they are the settign or sync options? Those files that have been uploaded recently must be shown on the uploads screen No matter if the app is closed or the process killed, the files must be shown too Only the info of the active account will be shown There will be 3 sections: Current: uploads in progress, the progress bar will be shown, and on the right the cancel button so that it will be possible to cancel the upload Besides, those uploads failed because of a network error will be shown too (such as offline uploads); to distinguish these ones from those that are in progress, a message under the file name: "waiting for server connection" will be shown instead of the progress bar. Failed uploads: these are uploads that have failed and need the user attention Credentials error: in case the password has changed, by clicking on the file, the login view will be shown so that the user can update the password and the uploads goes on Folder do not exist: in case the folder where it was expected to upload the file does not exist; by clicking on this file, the folder tree will be shown so that the user can select a new destination Conflict error: in the long run, by clicking on the file it will be shown the 3 options, overwritte, rename or cancel (ftm it is still not implemented) Permission error: in case the user does not have permissions to upload any file to that folder, by clicking on it, the folder tree will be shown so that a new folder may be selected Uploaded Where succesful uploads will be shown The number of successful uploaded files shown will be limited to 30 max Files will be displayed deppending on its upload time, the latest the first shown. Besides the file name, the size, when it was uploaded (relative dates), and path will be displayed too.
Manager.title: Uploads view

Manager.description: Some questions about the favorite feature: At the moment, version 1.5.5 it is only possible to set a file as favorite from the details view of the file. Will it make sense to add this option to the long press menu as well? So that it will be possible to set the file as favorite from the file list. On the other hand, on the current version (1.5.5) it is only used one icon, the grey arrow, should we change it to the yellow one and the grey one? Deppending whether the file is updated or pending to be updated? It is possible to delete a file and it remains being a favorite file, however, we have desinged a different behavior on the iOS side, owncloud/ios-issues#26, I guess that we will follow the same behavior, don´t we
Manager.title: Favorite files behavior

Manager.description: When having the option "only upload when on wifi" checked i noticed a small problem when being abroad. Most hotel-wifis are open wifis but they need some kind of login through the browser. Owncloud client only checks to see if its connected to a wifi, when it actually should be checking if it is connected to internet(or atleast the owncloud server). Having used the camera quite alot the result was hundreds of notifications of failed uploads.
Manager.title: Instant upload on Wifi does not check for connection

Manager.description: Currently when switching folders, there is no animation at all, the new folder just flashes in. This is very confusing as to what happens. Instead, there should be a left/right animation, much like on iOS. Deeper subfolders should move in from the right, and going back should move the parent folder in from the left. cc @rperezb @davivel @masensio
Manager.title: Animations for switching folders / folder switching should be more apparent

Manager.description: The Android News-App gets a new icon (owncloud/News-Android-App#199), the official android files app should to that, too. this would look the android apps much more consistent, as all apps have the same scheme (blue gradien background with flat white logo). Owncloud Webinterface itself uses a white cloud on blue background, too. I tried it with the grey cloud, too. But this didn't look very nice. My suggestion is this: Opionions? @jancborchardt
Manager.title: Change App-Logo/Icon

Manager.description: As a user, i want to get to the parent folder, if i swipe from the left to the right side. If i switched from a child folder to a parent folder, i want to be able to get back to the last child folder by swiping from the right to the left side.
Manager.title: Switch to parent/child by swiping

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Android auto upload not work in russia lang

Manager.description: In GPlay the current version 1.5.5 is since much time, but in F-Droid there is still this old version. Is it possible for you to trigger an update?
Manager.title: F-Droid-Version still 1.5.4

Manager.description: The success notification is of no help at all. I expect the upload to be sucessful - no need to tell me. The failure message in contrary doesn't help either. I have no idea if the app will retry again (if so can I see the upload queue) or if I have to take manual action to trigger the instant upload again. @rperezb @MTRichards @jancborchardt THX

Manager.description: for English, pleas scroll down! Und zwar fiel mir heute auf, das mein Handy (Galaxy S3 / CyanogenMod / Android 4.3.1) schon mindestens seit Wochen keine Textdateien zum Server synct. Nur lokal liegt immer die akuellste Version richtig vor. Aktualisiere ich einen Dateiinhalt am Telefon erscheint zwar die Meldung, dass die Datei erfolgreich hoch geladen wurde und auf dem Server wird das Datum des Elternverzeichnisses aktualisiert. Aber beim öffnen über den Browser der wird weiterhin der veraltete Textinhalt angezeigt. Ich hab mit allen Mitteln versucht den Sync zu erzwingen. Manuell in der App das Verz und das ganze Konto, ab-/anmelden auf beiden Geräten usw.. Leider ohne erkennbaren Erfolg. The app does not sync completely textfiles with the server. If in the in the app the content of an file will be updated, the notice "file uploaded successfully" occurs and the date of the directory on the server gets the correct new update-time. But the content of the file will not be updated. I tried everything i know to force the sync. Manually in the app the folder and the whole account and to log-in/-out on the device and the browser. But nothing changes. greetz, Rob
Manager.title: no complete sync between app and server (Database Problem)

Manager.description: Currently after the photo is taken it's saved to two places - to my photos directory (that's expected) and to owncloud directory on the phone. The photo takes double space because of that. I'm interested in getting my photo sent to owncloud... and that's all I want :) This is really a problem because the owncloud location is not customizable and it goes to my very small internal storage. From time to time I have to remove the photos from the instant uploads directory (locally only).
Manager.title: instant upload without copying the photo to an owncloud directory on the phone

Manager.description: Hi all, I'd like to request that the license file is updated to include information regarding the use and redistribution policies for the application. if that is impossible, could someone please clarify the terms of the license and if I may fork-modify-redistibute this application for corporate use? Thanks very much!
Manager.title: [Request] Clarification of the License

Manager.description: It would be much better if the user could choose which folder he or she wants to put the InstantUpload photos (and soon videos) instead of a hard coded folder. In this way the user can have only one single folder wit all the pictures instead of having to make folders inside of the InstantUpload folder to make all the pictures end up in the same place. It would be preferred to be able to choose folder both for videos, and also for photos to make the separate.
