Manager.description: Traveled abroad yesterday and noticed something strange with the automatic upload of pictures. My default setting is to only upload when connected to Wi-Fi. All was well until I connected my phone to the airport network that requires me too start the browser and accept the TOS. Only after that do I get a connection to the Internet. What happened was that before I had a chance to accept the TOS, ownCloud started to try and upload 400 images (3-400MB in total) that I took during my visit. And of course the upload failed. But after accepting the TOS, the upload worked. And then it was time for me to board my flight and I switched off Wi-Fi and expected the upload to stop, but no, instead the upload jumped over to the cellular network and started to eat away my precious 20 MB/day quota when I’m abroad. Managed to switch off the cellular network and the uploads started to fail, after killing the app in the Android settings did the madness stop. Android did notify me when I connected to the airport Wi-Fi that I needed to sign in/accept the TOS. Is it possible to get the ownCloud app to halt the upload until there actually is a working connection to the Internet and not just a connection to a local Wi-Fi/AP network? It should try to “ping” the server and see if it gets a valid response back before starting the automatic upload. Expected behaviour Upload should have stopped when the Wi-Fi connection was turned off. Actual behaviour When Wi-Fi was turned off, the ownCloud resumed the automatic upload over the cellular network instead of just stop the upload and wait for a Wi-Fi connection. Environment data for Samsung Galaxy Note 2 Android version: 4.1.2 Device model: Samsung Galaxy Note II Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 1.5.7 Server runs 6.0.3
Manager.title: [1.5.7] Automatic upload over Wi-FI jumped to cellular

Manager.description: I can now confirm that the 1.5.7 Android App session time expires within a few hours although it should last at least one week. Similar to: owncloud/ios-library#31 @rperezb

I've tryed the same file several times and as result I upload stalled on 24%, 29%, 36%. Manager.description: This is more of a feature than an issue, but it could be of some relevance to the automatic photo/video uploader. There needs to be a way where we can select a local directory and a remote directroy so that they can be synced either both ways, or just to the remote/local folder (a bit like FolderSync) since if the app wasn't running, then not all my photos/videos would be uploaded and since the app doesn't search for any new media, then they won't be uploaded to the server. It'd be great if this was up in the high priority list, but I know that there may be higher priorities already queued up.
Manager.title: Sync Local File Directory AND Remote Directory together

Manager.description: Expected behavior File is uploaded or an error message is displayed. Actual behavior When using Google Photos app share function, it often does nothing and sometimes the owncloud app just crashes. Uploading the same file, using the share button, from Sony Album app or file commander, owncloud always works. Once it did start working, but failed once the apps had been restarted. Steps to reproduce Launch Google Photos app Select an image, press the share icon and select Owncloud press upload nothing happens, no errors, no network activity, no activity in apache logs. Recent apps show owncloud, and when pressed "The application could not be started" message appears and owncloud closes Repeat with Sony Album app or File Commander and uploading works every time. Environment data Android version: 4.4.2 Google Photos 4.4.3.69327628 ownCloud app version: 1.5.7
Manager.title: Sharing from photos app causes a crash

Manager.description: I can't use android client to create a new account (not add an account). The client returns "username or passowrd not match".
Manager.title: can't use android client to create a new account

Manager.description: Just experienced an issue with the app when an instant upload of an image (and possibly a video too) is being uploaded with Antivirus enabled on the server end of Owncloud. It appears that the upload is successful and the file is indeed uploaded, but since ClamAv (Clamscan) is scanning the file which might take a while on slow systems, the android app says it has failed. This is probably a timeout issue in my opinion.
Manager.title: Upload failed when server scanning via clamscan

Manager.description: We replaced the globe (aka shuriken) with a more understandable »link« icon. Please update the mobile apps (Android as well as iOS) with that: PNG: https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/core/img/actions/public.png SVG: https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/core/img/actions/public.svg cc @rperezb @MTRichards Except in the navigation bar on iOS – please keep the normal »Share icon« for that instead of using the link (as discussed before).
Manager.title: Use new »link« icons

Manager.description: So pictures do not show up in the gallery.
Manager.title: needs .nomedia in the owncloud directory

Manager.description: Hi, would it be possible to implement a function to auto-download and -sync all files on the cloud or in specific folders, so i don't have to select every file specifically? Sometimes i only have 3g or less, so downloading the files i need either takes forever or doesn't work at all when i need them. It would be nice if i would be able to autosync them while i have wifi and have them on my device when i need them. regards sicjay
Manager.title: [feature request] WLAN folder/all auto-sync

Manager.description: After recently getting the ownCloud app on Android and enabling instant photo upload, I noticed that after taking a picture the app is automatically saving a copy of the picture in the owncloud folder on the phones memory, even though I haven't gone to view/download the photo in the app. Since I take a lot of photos this is just wasting space on the phone. Its also not likely I'm going to use the ownCloud app to view the photo if I can view it from the Android photo app anyway, so there isn't really any reason for them to be there. It would be nice to have the option to disable this if not have it removed as it probably doesn't make sense for a lot of people to do this.
Manager.title: Don't instantly save a second copy of an image to instantUpload on the phone

Manager.description: I'm using an OwnCloud 7.07 server over https. The android app will not allow me to log in. I enter the server details and it shows me 'Connection Established'. After entering credentials and touching 'Connect', the login screen does disappear momentarily. I see the top bar with the 'upload' icon and a loading icon, but no files. Shortly after, I am sent right back to the login screen without any error message. I am using an HTC One M8 with Android KitKat (4.4.2). My owncloud server is running on a non-standard port, but I use DNS to forward it properly. As the 'Connection established' message is shown, I assume this is not part of the issue. Nothing is logged at all on the owncloud server in the owncloud.log or the httpd access_log or error_log.
Manager.title: Unable to log in

Manager.description: owncloud should provide a way to use custom upload folders and dated folders like "CustomName/Videos/Date" and CustomName/Pictures/Date to help organizing.
Manager.title: InstantUpload default folder

Manager.description: Scenario: Being in the Android Gallery and uploading single pictures, you 1. open the image, 2. tab the image, 3. select "Share", 4. select "ownCloud", 5. navigate to the desired destination directory, and 6. select "Upload". Problem: If you do this multiple times, you always need to navigate (5.) AGAIN to the desired directory even if you have multiple files going to the same directory (which is a very common case). Request: Owncloud App should remember the last directory you've uploaded something in using the "Share" functionality and present this directory first (not the root directory).
Manager.title: [Feature request] Share "ownCloud" - Remember last destination upload directory

Manager.description: Scenario: You have shot a lot of pictures and want to upload all or most of them at once. When selecting UPLOAD in an ownCloud directory the user can choose Files, or Content from other apps When selecting 1. you can browse to your image/picture folder and multiselection is possible. BUT you do not have any thumbnail/preview for the images you select. You first have to figure out this manually by going to the Gallery and write down the file names. Request: It would be VERY helpful to have a preview thumbnail in the files-upload view right next to image files.
Manager.title: [Feature request] Img Preview for File-Upload

Manager.description: Scenario: You have shot a lot of pictures and want to upload all or most of them at once. When selecting UPLOAD in an ownCloud directory the user can choose Files, or Content from other apps When selecting 2. and choosing "Gallery", one cannot select multiple files for upload. This is annoying when you have shot a lot of pictures and want to upload most of them at once. Currently you are forced to select Upload->Content from other apps->Gallery->Camera shots->Picture, for EVERY single picture. And you have to remember which picture you just uploaded and where to continue. Dropbox allows multiselection for uploading from the Gallery. Request: It would be nice to have the possibility to select multiple files from other apps like from the Gallery.
Manager.title: [Feature request] Multiselect for Img-Gallery-Upload (Android >= 4.3)

Manager.description: I think the App should have the ability to stream the content instead of downloading it to the device. And for those who wish to download, then there should be an option in the settings to dictate whether or not the user wants to download files to the device or stream it instead. If so, there could even be a download option when long-pressing on the content.
Manager.title: Stream Picture/Video/Audio instead of Downloading

Manager.description: It should be possible to create new folders in owncloud while selecting the folder to upload. Dropbox has this simple feature.
Manager.title: Create new folder in upload-dialog

Manager.description: How to start this service,I cann't start with using bindService, Can you help me ?
Manager.title: about class ContactSyncService

Manager.description: Basically, the same ability to share with a user / group sans link, that the webapp has, but in the Android app. Possibly via Long press > Share with user / group > Choose user/group > choose folder to store in
Manager.title: [Enhancement] Share with user / group

Manager.description: When I enter the owncloud URL with a trailing slash: https://192.168.0.3/owncloud/ I get an "unknown error" message when hitting the enter button. The Apache2 access log was showing the following entries: 192.168.0.246 - - [01/Sep/2014:20:35:21 +0000] "GET /owncloud//status.php HTTP/1.1" 200 773 "-" "Android-ownCloud" 192.168.0.246 - - [01/Sep/2014:20:35:21 +0000] "HEAD /owncloud//remote.php/webdav/ HTTP/1.1" 403 681 "-" "Android-ownCloud" You could see that the HEAD request gets a 403 Forbidden response and the context path was showing a double slash "owncloud//status.php". After removing the trailing slash the error message went away. The Android App should strip the trailing slash so that the user does not get confused by this kind of error.
Manager.title: Create account page shows "unknown error" when adding URL with trailing slash

Manager.description: In the database found under "/data/system/users/0/accounts.db" the owncloud password is stored as plain text. This means anyone with root access on the phone, probablly including closed source apps that need root, can aquire the password. This might lead to the discussion that a rooted phone is always a risk, however it would still be nice to add an additional layer of security here.
Manager.title: Password stored as plain text in the "accounts.db" file

Manager.description: When taking a picture with my phone, the image is instantly uploaded to owncloud\SofortUpload, since I got my device set on German. Today I changed the device to French - Pictures now arrive in owncloud\TéléversementInstantané. Maybe some of these options would improve the situation? Stick to a language, when it was already used once. Create a setting value for the name of the directory.
Manager.title: The InstantUpload feature is localised. This causes minor problems with language settings.

Manager.description: Owncloud 7.0.2 shows the url https://server.tld/remote.php/webdav/ to connect to via webdav. When I try to configure the Android app with this url, it always complaints: wrong username and/or password. By changing the url to https://server.tld/ all works fine, the app connects again and all is working fine.
Manager.title: wrong webdav-path

Manager.description: I am running the android app version 1.5.8. I am running an SSL-enabled owncloud server supported by a CA, that is not in the trusted CA list of my android device, so I had to manually accept the certificate in my owncloud client. I recently updated the certificate on my server to a new certificate by the same CA. I noticed that the file listing on my android client wasn't updated anymore. When trying to manually update the list, I get a busy icon for less than a second, but my file list doesn't update. No warning message was shown in the user interface. After I set the password for this account again (which wasn't changed), I got a certificate warning message again. After having accepted the new certificate here, I could again use my owncloud account. I assume that if the server certificate doesn't match, the connection is silently dropped and no warning is shown to the user. I suggest to show the certificate warning dialog here again instead of silently dropping the connection. @eriktews I (@rperezb) edit your issue to have a better tracking of the scope and expectations: STEPS: Having a ssl self signed cert installed on the ownCloud server Install the Android app and log in accepting the cert From the server side, change the cert Do any action on the Android app such as refresh CURRENT STATUS: The app stop working, every request to the server fails EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR: When this change is detected, we will show a similar popup to the one shown when you accept the cert for the first time This is detected when the current folder is refreshed, similar behavior to the case when the credentials have changed if any upload fails due to the change of the certificate the error shown will be: connection error NOTE: It has been reported on #1420 #1463 and #1515
Manager.title: After a manually accepted certificate on an owncloud server is updated, the android app stops communicating with the server

Manager.description: On the Android App, the video is not opening in full screen in the file preview panel. When we double tap on the screen, the entire screen becomes blank and the video plays in the centre.. It should also allow full screen option..
Manager.title: Video in full screen mode is not using full screen

Manager.description: mvn package doesn't want to work: [WARNING] The POM for com.owncloud.android:owncloud-android-library:jar:1.5.2-SNAPSHOT is missing, no dependency information available Failed to execute goal on project owncloud: Could not resolve dependencies for project com.owncloud.android:owncloud:apk:0.9.2: Could not find artifact com.owncloud.android:owncloud-android-library:jar:1.5.2-SNAPSHOT I had to update pom to use 4.4.2_r3 as well. But I still cannot generate the APK.....
Manager.title: Cannot generate APK

Manager.description: I just re-installed the app. After entering the URL it said: "Cannot authenticate against this server" but did not ask for a password. I tracked the problem here: line 257 in AuthentivatorActivity.java: boolean samlWebSsoSupported = AUTH_ON.equals(getString(R.string.auth_method_saml_web_sso)); returns true When setting it to false, it works alright.
Manager.title: Develop version: Cannot create new connection to server

Manager.description: Using version: 1.5.8 When selecting a file for sharing in Android and chosing owncloud, folders are not refreshed. In my case, with a fresh installation owncloud only showed me the top level folder hierarchie, but when selecting a folder it appeared empty. Could the current folder be refreshed just like when opening it with the owncloud app?
Manager.title: Folders not updated when sharing

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce Install oc-android (v1.5.8) Try to add a Server which only supports TLSv1.2 Ciphers Expected behaviour Android 4.4.* supports TLSv1.2 so it should work with the following ciphers: TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384 TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256 TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA Actual behaviour SSL-Initialisation fails Server configuration Operating system: Centos 6.5 Web server: nginx 1.7.5 Database: mysql PHP version: 5.3.3 ownCloud version: 7.0.2
Manager.title: Support TLSv1.2 ciphers (Android 4.4.*)

Manager.description: I just changed the password of my ownCloud account. After that, on my android device, I tried changing the password for the ownCloud account. That seemed to be easy enough, and my new password was accepted without problems. After that, however, the ownCloud android client was constantly complaining about a "failed synchronisation" for the instant upload images. Also when navigating inside the owncloud app, even though some folder content was shown, it seemed to be outdated, as of most folders the subfolders (especially those I had never loaded before) were empty, and the spinner on the top never stopped turning (even for the folders where some content was shown). Is there any log to check for the case when such problems happen? I tried setting the password multiple times, I'm sure it was the correct one, it never worked I then tried removing the account and recreating it, which also didn't change anything. Next I tried "force stopping" the app and removing all its data, which also didn't help. At last, I tried uninstalling and reinstalling the client (and the JellyBean workaround app, which still seems to be required on 4.4, correct?), and after recreating the account then, it finally worked again. Anybody else seen this? Any log or so I can check for details as to why the simple password change procedure didn't work in my case? Note: I didn't specifically check the version before reinstalling, but since automatic upgrades are enabled, I suppose it was the version 1.5.8 of the app before and after re-installation. I'm currently trying a second password change to see if this behavior is reproducible in my environment. Edit: Not reproducible at the moment. So I'm closing this issue. Maybe it will be a guidance for others having a similar experience...
Manager.title: Changing the password causes no more refreshes and failing photo sync, which only re-install will fix

Manager.description: The README.md says how to do that under "Building with Eclipse", but actually the path is empty. There's no such library.jar inside the whole repository. Could you please shed some light? Or any external resource?
Manager.title: How to build with Eclipse?

Manager.description: For people with low memory on their phones, or with new phones that can record in 4K (large files) it would be nice if it was possible to - instead of saving the data on the phone, directly send them to the Owncloud server and then delete the file from the phone as soon as the upload was successful, and only then. As it is today you first have to delete the "misc folder" and then the actual file if you have low memory. The proposed enhancement would do everything for you instead. CC @davivel
Manager.title: Send pictures directly to cloud and then delete from phone

Manager.description: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/owncloud/android/master/SETUP.md When importing am I suppose to check copy into workspace or use from the location where I git cloned the owncloud/android project. I want to avoid any future conflicts because of git or Eclipse. And Open Eclipse and create new "Android Project from Existing Code". should really be changed to something like Open Eclipse and import. Create new creates a new project there is no creating Android Project from Existing Code. You can only import existing code. Thanks.
Manager.title: Clarification on SETUP.md guidelines

Manager.description: I am using the android client (v.1.5.8 from f-droid) on a Samsung Note 8 (android v. 4.2.2) and I am trying to keep some pdf files in sync. I expect files to automatically syncronize to the server after I add annotations or highlights, i.e. files should be uploaded soon after they are modified. However, this does not happen, not even if I force a sync tapping on "Refresh account". When I check the modification time of the pdfs using a file browser, I can see the modification time is older than the one shown in the client. The only workaround I found is (1) to manually force a sync by long tapping the file and then choosing "Refresh file" or (2) to force the sync of another file in the same folder as in (1), then the other files are uploaded after I modified them (this seems to work consistently, at least as far as I could test) I don't have similar problems with other types of files, for instance text files are uploaded immediately after modification. Also there is nothing suspicious in owncloud.log on the server.
Manager.title: Client does not always upload pdf files upon modification

Manager.description: I am using the android client (v.1.5.8 from f-droid) on a Samsung Note 8 (android v. 4.2.2) and I am trying to keep some pdf files in sync. Since I tick on the "Keep file up to date" option for every file, I expect files to automatically syncronize to the server after I add annotations or highlights, i.e. files should be uploaded soon after they are modified. However, this does not happen, not even if I force a sync tapping on "Refresh account". When I check the modification time of the pdfs using a file browser, I can see the modification time is older than the one shown in the client. The only workaround I found is (1) to manually force a sync by long tapping the file and then choosing "Refresh file" or (2) to force the sync of another file in the same folder as in (1), then the other files are uploaded after I modified them (this seems to work consistently, at least as far as I could test) I don't have similar problems with other types of files, for instance text files are uploaded immediately after modification. Also there is nothing suspicious in owncloud.log on the server.
Manager.title: Client does not always upload pdf files upon modification

Manager.description: The app should show a list of already-existing files in the upload window. This will provide additional context for where the user is in the directory hierarchy, reducing the complexity of the required mental model. It may also help the user decide if they want to upload the file or not (e.g. if they see that there will be a conflict). I should point out that Dropbox and (IIRC) Google Drive do this.

Manager.description: Due to the recent poodle exploit I disabled SSLv3 in my apache configuration. Unfortunately after that uploading files doesn't work anymore with the OC Android client. Steps to reproduce: Having these lines in the apache virtual host configuration works: SSLCipherSuite ECDH+AESGCM:DH+AESGCM:ECDH+AES256:DH+AES256:ECDH+AES128:DH+AES:ECDH+3DES:DH+3DES:RSA+AESGCM:RSA+AES:RSA+3DES:!aNULL:!MD5:!DSS SSLCipherSuite ALL:!ADH:!EXPORT56:!RC4+RSA:+HIGH:-MEDIUM:+EXP:+eNULL:-SSLv2:SSLv3 Disabling SSLv3 like this will not work: SSLCipherSuite ECDH+AESGCM:DH+AESGCM:ECDH+AES256:DH+AES256:ECDH+AES128:DH+AES:ECDH+3DES:DH+3DES:RSA+AESGCM:RSA+AES:RSA+3DES:!aNULL:!MD5:!DSS SSLCipherSuite ALL:!ADH:!EXPORT56:!RC4+RSA:+HIGH:-MEDIUM:+EXP:+eNULL:-SSLv2:-SSLv3 My Environment Apache: apache2 -version Server version: Apache/2.2.22 (Debian) Server built: Jul 24 2014 15:34:00 Android with cyanogenmod 10.1.3-n7000 on a Samsung Galaxy Note OC Android client 1.5.8
Manager.title: Upload not possible when SSLv3 is disabled

Manager.description: The protocol activity allows to send the log via mail (cf. LogHistoryActivity.java). However, it explicitly uses Gmail. Source code looks like this: // Explicitly only use Gmail to send intent.setClassName("com.google.android.gm","com.google.android.gm.ComposeActivityGmail"); Why should owncloud do that? There are other mail clients around, which people use. And even worse, if Gmail is not available, owncloud crashes: 10-29 07:54:24.445: I/ActivityManager(31009): START u0 {act=android.intent.action.SEND_MULTIPLE typ=text/plain flg=0x10000001 cmp=com.google.android.gm/.ComposeActivityGmail (has clip) (has extras)} from pid 32649 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): FATAL EXCEPTION: main 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): android.content.ActivityNotFoundException: Unable to find explicit activity class {com.google.android.gm/com.google.android.gm.ComposeActivityGmail}; have you declared this activity in your AndroidManifest.xml? 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): at android.app.Instrumentation.checkStartActivityResult(Instrumentation.java:1618) 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): at android.app.Instrumentation.execStartActivity(Instrumentation.java:1417) 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): at android.app.Activity.startActivityForResult(Activity.java:3370) 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): at android.app.Activity.startActivityForResult(Activity.java:3331) 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): at android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity.startActivityForResult(FragmentActivity.java:840) 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): at android.app.Activity.startActivity(Activity.java:3566) 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): at android.app.Activity.startActivity(Activity.java:3534) 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.LogHistoryActivity.sendMail(LogHistoryActivity.java:161) 10-29 07:54:24.445: E/AndroidRuntime(32649): .... I would use Android's chooser to let the user choose which mail app to use (if there is no default). If no one objects, I'd issue a PR. @davivel @jancborchardt PS: The send mail option is still in develop branch only.
Manager.title: Send log via only - why only Gmail?

Manager.description: This issue is meant to discuss improvements in the Android Client. I posted a workaround before, little bit like a wake up call to that many users request one thing, but nothing happens. This is purely a discussion, and nothing else. It´s not personal against anyone either. I just want to make it clear what is missing, and what would improve the client - a lot. PR´s are more than welcome. As I see it today we are missing or could improve: Photos and videos gets downloaded and is stored both in the regular photos folder of the phone in DCIM, and also by ownCloud client in "Misc". #588 #592 #640 #601 #346 #156 #375 When a photo or video is taken and fails, it should retry again. #340 #646 Add a delay for Instant Uploads so you have time to delete the photos you don´t want before they get uploaded to the server. #643 A "smart upload" that get´s information from server and don´t upload it if there already is a copy, or upload it once more and overwrite the old file, or make a new copy, and only one copy in that case. #554 Only upload when phone is charging. #465 Two-way sync. #3 Browse the pictures without downloading them, instead - get the information from the server directly. #588 Delete the picture from phone (DCIM folder) after it have successfully been uploaded. #588 This is what my workaround fixes. But it should not have to be a workaround, it should be native, in the original ownCloud app. New suggestions: Download a folder - this is quite nice as people might have 100 mp3s in one folder for example. (Thanks @wakeup) ______________ Questions to begin with: Why haven´t this been prioritized before? What obstacles is present to make this happen? Why is this bad ideas design-wise? Why is so many users not being listened to? My intentions are good, and have always been. I spend 95% of my free time on/with ownCloud, of course I want to make it better but right now it feels like there are many different ways to deal (or not deal) with these issues. Could we please talk it through? CCing all that could be interested in this: @jancborchardt @davivel @lukeowncloud @stefan-niedermann @tobiasKaminsky @owncloud/designers
Manager.title: What could be improved or added as a new feature to make Android client better?

Manager.description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE: Create two accounts in the OC Android app, at least one of them with an internationalized URL Leave the OC app, open another - a file browser, the device gallery, ... Select one file and use the 'share' action; select ownCloud as the target app; OC Android app is open, showing a dialog over the upload activity to choose one account EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR: Both accounts in the list appear pretty formatted (the IDN account show international characters) OBTAINED BEHAVIOUR: The IDN account show "escaped characters" instead of the interartional ones.
Manager.title: Ugly formatting for account selection of International Domain Names in "sharing from" dialog

However, they are different instances. It would be good if this could be enabled.

Manager.description: Expected behaviour When you first launch the owncloud app it should determine the InstantUpload directory name and remember that setting. Actual behaviour It looks like that the owncloud app always determines the directoy on launch. If you switch system language in between then the upload will upload to a different directory next time. i.e. if the system language was english all the pictures were uploaded to InstantUpload, when switching to german all pictures after the switch are uploaded to SofortUpload. I think keeping the original directory name is easier on the user. At least I was suprised when it happend. Steps to reproduce On an ownclient install that already uploaded picture. Switch the android system language. The next pictures are uploaded a different directory. Environment data Android version: 4.4.2 Device model: Elephone P2000 Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 1.6.1 ownCloud server version: 7.02
Manager.title: generate InstantUpload directory only on first launch of app
OwnCloudClient.executeMethod() generates invalid HTTP requests

Manager.description: I'm new to Owncloud, I looked for thi bug in the issues but didn't find it. Hope not to generate a duplicate. When I try to upload to Owncloud a file from a different app (like Ghost commander or Download), it doesn't work, no error is generated. The correct sequence is this: I select the file in the other app I tap the share button I choose to share to owncloud app A pop up tree of the ownclud directory appears, I choose the directory where I want to upload the file I tap on the "upload button" nothing happens. If I look in the owncloud web app, the log doesn't show anything, so I suppose is something happening in android, not regarding the server. On the other side, uploading a file directly through the owncloud app, works.
Manager.title: Upload from android share menu fails

Manager.description: Expected behaviour I select a file to be my "favorite" and it gets stored on my android device. When I update the file from within android, it is updated on server (working good). When I update the file from within the server, it is updated on the client at next Network-Connect-Event or periodically when connection exists. Actual behaviour When I update the file from within the server, it is not automatically updated on the android-client (unless I open the owncloud app manually). Steps to reproduce set file as favorite and close owncloud app edit file on server disconnect and reconnect Wifi Environment data Android version: 4.4.4 Device model: Nexus 5 Stock or customized system: Android Stock ownCloud app version: 1.6.1 ownCloud server version: 7.0.3
Manager.title: Automatically sync favorited file on Wifi-connection events

Manager.description: AC: As an Android user I want to send more information on the feedback attachment mail. Currently, it is only send: "Feedback", now I want it to be: "Feedback - android vX.X.X" where x.x.x is the number of the installed version
Manager.title: [Feedback mail] As an Android user I want to send more information on the attachment mail so that support know in advanced the App and the version

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce Select to download an mp3 Go to a music app App realizes that there is a new audio In own cloud app, delete the audio locally or remote App doesn’t realize that the audio is not there anymore. When you click on it, it’s not possible to reproduce it Expected behaviour App realizes that the audio is not there anymore. Actual behaviour App doesn’t realize that the audio is not there anymore. When you click on it, it’s not possible to reproduce it Device Android 4.1.2
Manager.title: MediScanner isn’t trigger after deleting files

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce Select to download an mp3 Go to a music app App realizes that there is a new audio In own cloud app, rename or move the audio App doesn’t realize that the audio has been renamed. When you click on it, it’s not possible to reproduce it. The new one should appear in the music app. Expected behaviour App realizes that the audio has change its name, and it is shown in the music app. Actual behaviour App doesn’t realize that the audio has been renamed. When you click on it, it’s not possible to reproduce it. Device Android 4.1.2
Manager.title: MediScanner isn’t trigger after renaming/moving files

Manager.description: I have read the description of this app in the offical android app store. There is only the forum at forum.owncloud.org mentioned. I think there should be a link to the issue tracker system of GitHub as on Github the developer are reading it. And the text should encourage people to report issues and not just downvote it.
Manager.title: Update Description AppStore: Highlight Issue System on Github

Manager.description: Behind the three dots there should be an option to toggle between files on device and all files. @jancborchardt What is your suggestion for the naming and handling? Toggle button: On device only on/off Button: changes between "on device only" and "all files" The folders will always be visible as it is needed to browse. CC: @davivel
Manager.title: Switch files: onDevice/all
Opening file details very slow

Manager.description: When uploading a file using the Android app the file creation date is set to the upload date. Instead, the file creation date of the file from the Android file system should be used. EDITED by @davivel: the creation date of the file suffers an ancient bug, not sure if fixable; BUT the MODIFICATION DATE of the file should be set with the upload. See #761 (comment) EDITED by @davigonz: PR: #1849 PR android library: owncloud/android-library#140
Manager.title: File modification date lost when uploading file

Manager.description: @davivel and @jabarros I finished my proposal first reliable uploads -> https://github.com/owncloud/android/tree/reliable_uploads I find it works quite reliably. Unfortunately, the changes are substantial. Please review and add to backlog (conflicts are expected with each new commit). Details: I renamed FileUploader to FileUploaderService because it is now much more than a simple uploader but a real service; this should be reflected in the name, I think. I reused the DbHandler and called it UploadDbHandler (the old name was a little misleading). Further I replaced some Intent KEYS which where ints with enums (e.g., LocalBehaviour in FileUploadService). This avoids using untyped KEYS and will help avoiding mistakes. OCFiles is now serializable as it is stored persistently. ConnectivityActionReceiver is now responsible for detecting connectivity changes. It calls FileUploaderService. Due to these changes, the branch reliable_uploads is a little bloated. But actually there is not much new there.
Manager.title: Reliable uploads
Add build date to version number

Manager.description: As part of the reliable uploads enhancement (cf. #762) I introduced a list showing all uploads (scheduled, active, done, failed_retry, failed_give_up, paused) Currently it looks like this (just a draft): Now, how should it look like? In detail, What file/upload details should be visible? (currently: local path, upload state, time of upload request [missing: file size, preview icon]) What main menu items do we need? (currently: Clear list and retry uploads) What file menu options are required? (currently none) What should a click on an upload item do? (currently: if DONE: open details, if FAILED or SCHEDULED: retry) @jancborchardt A penny for your thoughts!
Manager.title: Layout for upload list (part of reliable uploads)

Manager.description: AC: As an Android user I want the subject of the mail to be populated when I share a file/folder by link within the Android app. Currently, it is empty, so that I want the same behavior as the web, Subject: "[user] shared [file/folder name] with you
Manager.title: [Share by link mail] As an Android user I want the subject mail to be populated when I share a file/folder so that It´s quickier the sent of the mail

Manager.description: This screen: has a lot of open space to the right. Context from other apps implies that the behavior here will be that selecting something in the left pane will open a preview on the right, but instead what happens is that the image is opened full-screen. Instead, a preview should be shown in the right pane and if tapped, then the image should be opened full-screen as we currently do it.
Manager.title: Show previews in the right pane of tablet landscape mode

Manager.description: This will make ownCloud fit in more with the rest of the platform.
Manager.title: Use the native Android folder icon

Manager.description: On The App it gave the Auto Upload when i take a picture, but when at that time is no connection or the connection fail the Upload will not try agin. Can you make a Funktion to set a retry time, that the upload reload on a later time. Or a auto check that it start when the Phone is online agan. Other Funktion Wish: Can you make a Funktion that i can say auto syn other Files or directorys. More Data Syn Funktions. Not only auto upload Videos and pictures.
Manager.title: [Funktion Request] reconnect when Auto Upload fail no connection

Manager.description: Why does owncloud app come with a media player for audio and video? It would make sense if media was streamed. But currently it is downloaded and then played. These files can be played with any player, cf. #775 Making a good movie player is out of scope for the owncloud app which is supposed to sync files. Currently the movie player does not work well: Movie starts over when turning device, when clicking on movie error is shown and movie stops, white background is annoying, no full screen, ... I propose to drop the movie player (which is the same as the audio player?).
Manager.title: Drop movie and audio player. Focus on important matters.

Manager.description: In the account list in the setttings, to the left of each account the avatar of that account should be shown. Same for iOS. PR: #1559 cc @rperezb @tobiasKaminsky @lukeowncloud
Manager.title: Show avatar in account list

Manager.description: I copied the content of one OC server to another. The desktop sync client works with the new OC server. But after deleting the old OC account from OwnCloud App (1.6.2) and adding the new one, I am now stuck in an endless loading loop (for about 2 hrs now). Although there were some connections to the server at the beginning of that loading loop, there is now no opened connection to the server. Reinstallation of the app, deleting app cache as well as owncloud folders on sd card did not help. Now when I delete that new account and add an account for the old OC server (which worked before), it also seems to endlessly load. The OC server is running stable version 7.0.3. It contains about 9800 files with a size of around 16 GB in that specific account. There are no specific errors or warnings logged on the server. EDIT: Just tested with an empty test account and it's the same.
Manager.title: Endless loading after deleting old OC account and adding new one

Manager.description: Hi, i have an Galaxy-tablet and there be 2 sd-cards on it and an Systempartition. i have extern an 64Gig SD-Card on it and i want move/swich from the internal sd-card to the external sd-card where i have easy more place, maybe it is well, if it is enable to select the folder or the drive where should be the owncloud-folder on which sd-card or which folder to be variable and use the best place for it :) best regards Blacky
Manager.title: Select/move/swich owncloud-folder

Manager.description: That would be awesome. At the moment I cannot put a picture from owncloud inside a gallery on my android. Android supports multiple galleries so I think why not have a feature to make any picture folder from owncloud appear in the android gallery? This will make it much easier to integrate pictures into apps, i.E. setting a wallpaper for the texting (SMS) app.
Manager.title: Share a picture folder inside the phone gallery

Manager.description: On Android if I have background data sync enabled for ownCloud it periodically starts a scan to refresh stats on files, but it goes through every file, not just those that have been tagged in the client as ones that should be kept up-to-date. In addition to this, it insists on querying every single god damn file and folder individually, using enormous amounts of data. Since I have thousands of files on my ownCloud-account this takes a long, long time, it keeps the connection open for hours and it consumes several megabytes every single refresh. It should obviously only refresh stats on the files that have been tagged, and even then, it should just send a single request to the server with all the files listed that it wants stats on and the server should just reply with a single response similarly with all the stats for the requested files.
Manager.title: Android-client wastes insane amounts of bandwidth and time

Manager.description: If you want to mark multiple files as favorite it is time consumption to first open the detail page and then select "keep file uptodate". @jancborchardt What do you think?
Manager.title: Long click on a file should allow to mark it as a favorite

Manager.description: Expected behaviour When I click a video which is played with the movie player nothing should happen. Actual behaviour Screen goes black and a popup window displays: Media file cannot be played with the stock media player (Without clicking movie plays just fine.) After clicking OK (the only button) the screen stays black. Then back and the movie starts playing from beginning. Steps to reproduce Click on movie file (mp4 in my case) Click on playing movie Environment data Android version: 4.2.2. Device model: Nexus 4 ownCloud app version: 1.6.2 (from master branch)
Manager.title: Media player: Error when clicking

Manager.description: Expected behaviour When playing a movie the whole display should be used. Video should maximize (hide control buttons, title bar, and everything else) either when clicking the movie or automatically. Clicking again should show them again and reduce the size of the video. Actual behaviour When playing a movie a large portion of the display is not used. No option to maximize to full screen. Steps to reproduce Play movie (mp4 in my case) Environment data Android version: 4.2.2. Device model: Nexus 4 ownCloud app version: 1.6.2 (from master branch)
Manager.title: Media player: Feature request: Fullscreen

Manager.description: I just bought the Android ownCloud app (v1.6.2) for my HTC Desire 200 (Android version 4.1.2) and I have an issue. I can seemingly login, meaning that I don't get an error message on my phone. But no files show up and when I try to upload something, I get the error "Upload failed, you need to relogin". Then I get to login screen, where logging in doesn't help. I just see the empty file list again. The log file of ownCloud (v7.0.3+dfsg-1 on Debian Jessie) shows errors: {"app":"core","message":"Login failed: 'adrian' (Remote IP: '192.168.2.149', X-Forwarded-For: '')","level":2,"time":"2014-12-09T11:37:40+00:00"} This line appears multiple times. Sometimes four times, sometimes eight times.
Manager.title: Upload failed, you need to relogin

Manager.description: Hi, I am using the ownCloud Android App version 1.6.2 and I would like to know if you could include support for EC-based ciphers, I am particularly interested in stop supporting SHA1. See closed issue for mirall (owncloud/client#764) implemented in 1.7.1. I am running apache and I have the following directives: SSLProtocol All -SSLv2 -SSLv3 SSLCipherSuite ECDH+AESGCM:DH+AESGCM:ECDH+AES+SHA384:ECDH+AES+SHA256:DH+AES:!RSA+AES256:!ADH:!AECDH:!MD5:!DSS:!aNULL:!eNULL:!LOW:!EXP SSLHonorCipherOrder on These directives allow you to use cyphers that support forward secrecy and work with a wide range of clients. In my apache log using Android-ownCloud 1.6.2 I get: [15/Jan/2015:12:18:46 -0500] 192.168.1.16 - TLSv1.2 DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA However, I would like to avoid using SHA1, and when I include the following directive in the SSLCipherSuite :!SHA1 the Android-ownCloud stops working. This is a paid app and the new ciphers have been implemented in the Windows and Mac clients for sure. I would greatly appreciate it if you could update the Android-ownCloud as well.
Manager.title: Update OpenSSL to provide EC-based ciphers

Manager.description: This kind of a follow-up on #639: I have some folders on my owncloud that contain a bunch (>100) media files. Some (far less than 50 %) of them are also downloaded to my mobile phone. In some situations where I don't have any or not sufficient internet connectivity or don't want to waste data volume but want to watch a video or listen to some audio file I browse through those folders on my device to find something suitable. At the moment, I have to scroll through the file list and keep track of the small green arrows that indicate that the file was downloaded. As I can only access the files on the device in that situation, it would be convenient if I could just sort the files by their status, i.e. files that are stored on the device before those that aren't and therefore have all the available files in one bunch.
Manager.title: Feature request: Sort files by on-device-status

Manager.description: Running on a Samsung Galaxy Express (GT-I8730) running Android 4.4.4, with v1.6.2 of OwnCloud app, and connecting to latest version of Owncloud 7, with encryption plugin active. I find that if I set the instant upload directory to an ordinary (ie local) directory then it works ok, but on an external share, it continually tells me the upload has failed, then tries again later. In fact, the upload is not failing - I end up with multiple copies of the image in the selected directory with an incrementing number in brackets after the file name. (The files all seem to be the same size, and to open correctly, so I am assuming that they do in fact contain all data.) The external directory is an Amazon S3 bucket. It may be relevant that rather than using Owncloud's external share setup, I have the bucket mounted as part of the local filesystem using the s3 fuse driver (I was not able to get the S3 external storage working through Owncloud's interface).
Manager.title: Instant upload incorrectly thinks it has failed for some directories

Also if upload fails several times, it gives up uploading it. Especially if the file is large (over 100 MB). I recommend the OC app should sync the camera folder instead of the current behavior.

Manager.description: I used the Android app to rename a directory from "Photo's" to "Afbeeldingen". After I did this all subdirectories and images in that directory were gone. At least they are no longer visible in the android app. They are still present in the webinterface and the native client on linux also has no issues seeing the images. This was a scary moment ! I managed to force the android app to rescan the renamed directory by adding another image to it via the owncloud directory on my linux box. When the android app got notified of this new image it also rediscovered my other images and subdirectories. Android app version 1.6.2 Owncloud server installation: 7.0.2 on Centos 6
Manager.title: Renaming a directory will hide its original content

Manager.description: As an admin I want to be able to prevent standard ownCloud apps from connecting to my ownCloud server, I want my users to use the custom ownCloud apps I have branded. The concept here is that a quick fix with a custom user agent string through ownBrander would enable a filter on "non-authorized" clients. Not perfectly secure for a determined user, but ok as a quick fix.
Manager.title: Custom Agent String for Android Client

Manager.description: In my issue report #876, I reported a bad behaviour of the client. I mentioned a "second step" as a work-around for this. The current implementation of the client if more file oriented. I have to download single files, mark singles files to stay in sync und upload single files is modified. To make ths a little bit more handy, the client should allow the upload of all modified files within a directory (from it's global menu). It isn't funny to manually sync / upload a couple of files by opening the context menu of each modified file. ;-) IMO it is worth thinking about an configuration option, where the user is able to choose between "manually upload modified files", or "automatically upload local changes".
Manager.title: add menu entry for global upload of modified files

Upload via browser works as expected. direct upload via mobile client also works, only instant upload fails and destroys the whole thumbnail cache

Manager.description: Hi, in order to distinguish between an real app problem or "just" a server side problem we should include a new question in the issue_template.md: Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? Please log in with: User: test / password: test / url: https://demo.owncloud.org Also we (or maybe /core) should try to write a test script that checks if the server is working fine. So many bad ratings on the play store would vanish as they are not related to the app but to the mis-configured server. (Apart to e.g. dropbox this is a problem as the user does not distinguish between server or app failures. But we cannot be made responsible for wrong servers... Maybe this should also be mentioned somewhere...)
Manager.title: Enhance issue.template

Manager.title: Search Function for the Android App

Manager.description: ownCloud for Android stores the local copy of the files in public storage. That allows that other apps in the device may access the downloaded files with no other special permission than access to the file system. The advantage of this approach is providing an extra way to share files with other apps. The drawback is that other apps may modify the files of the account with no barrier or control from the ownCloud app, what may result in security issues, We are planning to start using private storage instead. The lack of access though the file system will be a limitation for regular file browsers, but there are still other means to get access to the ownCloud files from other apps. Besides, we should also implement the DocumentProvider API to provide the newest and safer. Our main concern about this change is how the current users will receive it. We'd like to read opinions here to get an idea. How would you see that the app directly moves the current ownCloud folder to private storage? Would you prefer it as an optional setting, or as a mandatory option? cc @jancborchardt @MTRichards @rperezb @tobiasKaminsky @lukeowncloud @MMMarcy @stoyicker and any other who wants to join the discussion.
Manager.title: About private Vs public storage

Manager.description: @davivel @rperezb @tobiasKaminsky (Edited the title after @joeplus's comment.)
Manager.title: Long-press should initiate multiselect, not show context menu

Manager.description: Android client does not respect the same protocol as the desktop client for chunked uploads. For chunked PUT the client should send the OC-Total-Length header specifying the total file size (like the desktop sync client does). This gives a server a possibility, for example, to check the final file size as an integrity check. You may check with @dragotin and @DeepDiver1975 for details. BWT, we started drafting the spec. It is not yet finalized: https://github.com/cernbox/smashbox/blob/master/protocol/protocol.md You may also check if issues with failing 1MB+ uploads (e.g. #402) are not related.
Manager.title: android chunked upload: missing OC-Total-Length header

Manager.description: Storage is limited. Sooner or later the space on the android device gets low. The user needs help for the desicision: Which parts should not be synchronized in the future, to save disk space? On the unix shell I use this: du -a | sort -rn | less Example output of above command on the unix shell: root@pc> du -ax /etc/ | sort -rn | head 36156 /etc/ 18724 /etc/X11 18156 /etc/X11/core 3972 /etc/brltty 1700 /etc/apparmor.d This lists the biggest entries first. If you have a list like this, it's easy to find the stuff to delete/stop-to-sync. I think the best place would be in the context dialog of a directory. For example "Show disk usage statistic" could be the heading of this new feature. I can't help you to implent this by writing code. But if you need feedback on usability: just contact me. I love to help you.
Manager.title: Statistic table of biggest files and directories

Manager.description: Hey Guys, I've got a suggestion for another feature. If you take a photo and you have instant upload on, than the photo gets uploaded immediately. If the picture is blurred it gets uploaded anyway and wastes your limited mobile internet access. So if there is an option to delay the upload maybe one or two minutes, you have enough time to check the picture, delete it and take a new needle-sharp one and you save a lot of traffic.
Manager.title: Delay time for Photo/Video-Upload

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Download a sound file the internal player starts to play the track return to file list player continues to play in the background delete the file (locally and remote) Expected behaviour The player should stop. Actual behaviour Instead the player is still playing and the only possibility to stop it is to kill the owncloud app. At least I could not find another solution. Environment data owncloud server: 8.0.0.7 owncloud-app: 1.7.0
Manager.title: Internal music player does not stop playing when file is deleted

Manager.description: Hello, I'm trying to access a OC server through a federated infrastructure. When trying to connect to a server at the following address: https://cana.imd.ufrn.br/oc-shib I get the following error message of the app: "Cannot authenticate against this server" Accessing through a browser is all normal. As well as in the desktop client that shows the page to choose the Idp and , since the IDP is selected, your login page appears , once authenticated I have access to my files. The problem is access through the android client. Analyzing the source code, I note that The mAuthTokenType variable in AuthenticatorActivity class is definied for "owncloud.password", but the authentication method identified is SAML_WEB_SSO. So the authSupported method (in line 1065) returns false, generating the message "auth_can_not_auth_against_server". On the other hand. When the auth_method_saml_web_sso(in steup.xml) is definied to "on", the mAuthTokenType value is definied to "owncloud.saml.web_sso.session_cookie". Thus the app shows only the server url field, and when I input the url, a webView dialog is shown, loading the page to the IDP choosing page. But when I interact with it, it crashes and the application returns to the initial screen. Apparently the value of mAuthTokenType is definied during startup(line 219) and is no longer modified. Even when the authentication method identified is the SAML_WEB_SSO. Why is this happening? federated authentication is actually supported by app? Any help would be much appreciated. Thank you.
Manager.title: Federated Authentication error: "Cannot authenticate against this server"

Manager.description: Since the last update in playstore the android app crashes on gingerbread devices. Tested three different phones.
Manager.title: Crash at startup on gingerbread

Manager.description: Steps Upload file "test.txt" directly to server Open Android client Pick "Keep in sync" for that file and wait for download Go offline (airplane mode) In the web UI, change "test.txt" and save 6 On mobile (still offline), edit "test.txt" too and save Go back online Long press on "test.txt" and pick "Refresh file" At this point you get a dialog that says: "Remote file "test.txt" is not synchronized with local file. Continuing will replace content of file on server" with three buttons: "Don't upload", "Keep both" and "Overwrite". I want to overwrite the local file, so should I pick "Don't upload" or "Overwrite" ? Does "Overwrite" mean "Overwrite server file" or "Overwrite local file" ? "Don't upload" could also mean "Do not overwrite server version but overwrite local version". This is very confusing and even scary as I'm afraid to lose the wrong changes. Also the dialog mentions "continuing" but there is no "continue" button. How about changing the labels to "Use local version", " Use server version" and "Keep both" or something more explicit ? To be discussed with @owncloud/designers
Manager.title: Conflict dialog wording confusing

Manager.description: Whenever I use "Refresh account" there is a notification "Conflicts found" that appears in the notification bar of Android. Tapping it doesn't do anything. I still have no idea what file is causing the conflict. Some suggested changes: Add the name of the file in the notification (but could be a problem if many files) Tapping the notification should open the client in the folder with the conflicts, scrolled down to the file in question I realize that this might not work when more than a single file has conflicts. But redirecting to the first one would already help a lot. I could then solve it then refresh again, then tap the notification to go to the next conflict. (that would be the quick fix) That or... a special dialog/list with the conflict files ? I hope one day I'll discover which one of my files is the one with conflict. I checked all folders and there is no file with "(2)" so I cannot find where it is... @owncloud/designers
Manager.title: "Conflicts found" notification should link to folder

Manager.description: FAILURE: Build failed with an exception. What went wrong: A problem occurred configuring root project 'android-master'. Searched in the following locations: https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/com/android/support/support-v4/19.1.0/support-v4-19.1.0.pom https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/com/android/support/support-v4/19.1.0/support-v4-19.1.0.jar file:/.. /android-master/libs/support-v4-19.1.0.jar file:/../android-master/libs/support-v4.jar Required by: :android-master:unspecified

Manager.description: Hello, I would like to add a new option: Instead of copying files during upload it should also be possible to move them. Imagine this scenario: I have a lot of old images I would like to get off my phone to owncloud. Currently: open owncloud add photos in gallery: select the same photos and delete them With the new option these photos will be moved from e.g. DCIM to the owncloud folder (and as we have the update of media library they are still accessible by gallery. So there is no change for the user. After the successful upload the user can select the folder and delete it locally. Optional there should also be a setting to delete the files directly after successful upload. This will simplify the steps again. What do you think? @davivel @masensio @jancborchardt
Manager.title: Move files to owncloud

Manager.description: I am missing the possibility to mass-select files and folders to be synced User Story: to be able to simply sync a whole folder structure at home with broadband before I go out where I have weak or no connection
Manager.title: mass-select files and folders to be synced now

Manager.description: Hello Thanks To D Molkentein for closing Desktop client ref #3025 So using the Android ownCloud client to upload photos to the server - absolute godsend but have decided to create an SSH Server on the android device and scp - However - using the SSH session on Android device I noticed some overhangs of ownCloud that could be better - for storage efficiency on the client device The original files in DCIM were still there (expected) But a duplicate copy of the uploaded file was stored in the owncloud "virtual area" (/owncloud/username@owncloudHostHASH/PhotoArea1/PhotoArea2. Is this normal? If I go ahead remove the files from the owncloud area on the device (to free up space) will this remove process sync on the server? (Believe not) Apart from using SSH session on the phone to bulk remove- is there an automated routine in the ownCloud client to purge these surplus copies from the device after they have been uploaded ? Or plans to? Or do we need to create internal housekeeping mechanisms to purge these files? Thanks
Manager.title: Android Client : Uploads from device duplicated on Device

Manager.description: Hi, I've just moved from my Samsung S4 with stock camera to oneplus one with several camera Apps: "Kamera", Focal Google "Kamera". Only the Google Kamera App seems to trigger an owncloud upload. But all trigger a Google Picture Backup-Upload. I understand that the apps might not send the correct broadcast (as in issue #760), but could you please think about an option in owncloud to enable something like a Poll of the Camera Folder to check for new files? (any file, don't be smart and ignore files you don't think are worth it) Like in Issue #6 the FolderObserver class could be a way. This is really the whole purpose why I bought the official app - please improve it! Thanks, Michael
Manager.title: Fix camera instant-upload (suggestion inside)

Manager.description: Hi, I find the MOVE operation does not work well on my phone. When I move one file in one folder to another,it will delete the file in source folder and the file shows up in one sec in destination folder,then it disappears.Also,I cannot find the file at my account in website. My owncloud android version is 1.7.1 and owncloud server version is 8.0.2. I use Openstack Swift as back end storage. Looking forward to your solution! Thanks!
Manager.title: move operation does not work

Manager.description: As in title. For example, I have a photo folder, which I want to have always handy to show someone. So I pin the "Photos" folder, and, when on WiFi, it periodically syncs that folder.
Manager.title: [Feature Request] "Pin" a directory — make changes being made to it remotely be automagically downloaded

Manager.description: I noticed a couple of days ago that my phone started to drain the battery very fast and using a program to trace which programs are using wakelocks, I found that the owncloud syncing was responsible, making my phone never entering in deep sleep. I had to disable syncing, otherwise my battery lasts close to nothing. Not too long ago I added some external folders to my owncloud server with a lot of files (~67K files). I wonder if that could trigger this problem (but I think I noticed this problem in my phone a few days after I added the files to the server). A simple way to see if these 2 events are related would be to exclude the new external folders from the syncing, but I can't find any option to select which folder to sync, as you can do with the (linux) desktop app.
Manager.title: Eternal syncing kills the phone's battery

Manager.description: Are there any plans to create a sync API that can be used by other apps (similar to the [dropbox API[(https://www.dropbox.com/developers/sync)), or is there maybe such a thing already for Android? What I would like to achieve is being able to upload files from another app to ownCloud. Do you maybe have any tips/recommendations on how to best achieve this? From a quick research on the source code here and a search for WebDAV libraries for Java I doubt it, but is there maybe a simple way to do this generically for WebDAV via some library? I know this is not really an issue with the app, but I think this is still the best place to ask this question (considering that the android devel mailing list appears to be empty). Sorry if this is not the right venue to ask this, and thanks in advance for any pointers!
Manager.title: Android Sync API

Manager.description: A new feature I would suggest: I use in Android Blacloud.de to sync my photos to my owncloud I would prefer if Instant upload folder doesn't get created in Android phone with photos taken by the camera. This create duplicated photos in my phone. Then I have the same photos in the gallery and in the Instant upload folder created by Blacloud.de Rather is the client for android sync all photos taken by my phone from the phone gallery to the Owncloud Please no "Instant upload folder"
Manager.title: Blacloud.de client for Android sync with owncloud. Instant upload photos in Android

Manager.description: There are some problems with routers that don't have NAT-Loopback if you want to upload/connect to your self-hosted owncloud. Example case: Owncloud local network (ip 192.168.1.100) Owncloud global dns example.com (ip 90.50.100.30 ) if you want to connect over wifi (local network) to your owncloud and use example.com as url to it, then it will try to connect to 90.50.100.30 and it wont work. NAT-Loopback would lookup which ip you have and remap it to you local ip. Is there a possibility to get Advanced settings, on app side, where I can set the SSID (Wifi name) and the local ip to be able to connect through Wifi if I am connected to it? I saw that on another app called Transdrone (see screenshots attached). What do you guys think?
Manager.title: Connection problems with some routers over Wifi

Manager.description: Quite often i want to share a bunch of images from my phone. For that i select (say) 10 photos using my viewer application, and then 'share' with owncloud. Typically i would create a new directory there to put my photo in. This seems (to me) a pretty common way of doing. Currently it is not possible. You have to first (using the phone or the browser on your desktop compuer) create the directory, then goes back to the image viewer and upload them (and usually you're hit by #198 , but it's another issue)
Manager.title: Share with owncloud : possibility to create a directory

It would be nice if the client could sync the entire gallery. Is this behaviour planned? Best regards roy

Having duplicates of all my photos takes up valuable storage.

Manager.description: Hi, first of all: I already wrote an email to the developers, but for tracing, I'm opening this issue. What I have: OwnCloud 8.0.3 on Linux Android app v1.7.1 Android 5.0.2 Nexus 6 Owncloud settings (sharing, number of checkbox order in braces): allow share api (1) allow to share links (2) NOT force password (3) NOT allow public upload (4) allow users to send email notifications (5) set default date (6): 1 day -> do NOT force date allow re-sharing (7) do NOT restrict to groups (8) allow users to send email notifications (9) do NOT restrict to groups (10) What I did (app): choose account: one user, one admin browse to a folder or file select "share link" select app to share (tried with email and others) What then happens: sometimes message appears "you have no permissions to share this file" sometimes a password input dialog appears if the dialog appears: Can't leave the pw blank -> fails (you have to enter a password) if I select "cancel" -> nothing happens if I enter a password -> you do not have permissions to share this file What I expected: because of the settings at oc I awaited the email app to be opened to share the link: with and/or without password If I can provide you further informations, please let me know. Also it would be possible to provide you a "test" user account at this server instance. Please notice: My app and server is located to germany, so there's a great chance the given messages I provided does not match 1:1 to the orginal messages. I simply tried to translate by myself. Thanks!
Manager.title: Share links not working

Manager.description: Like many, I use the Instant Upload feature to backup pictures so I can remove the images from my device when it starts to fill up. However, often times I've noticed a failed instant upload is never retried and I've lost images because they weren't in sync with ownCloud. I would love a feature added to the app via a button press that checks for any files in DCIM that are not in the InstantUpload folder and uploads them. Or, if the app works by keeping track of successful uploads, forcing a sync on anything not marked as successful. Thanks.
Manager.title: Enhancement: Force instant upload via button press

Overall a sync interval should be configurable.

Server configuration Operating system: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS Web server: apache 2.4 Database: mysql PHP version: 5.5.9-1ubuntu4.9 ownCloud version: 8.0.2-8 Storage backend: disk Client version = 1.7.1

Manager.description: we play in four people in my server. it's everything fine a part from when one of them try to log in and i see this message in the console [14:00:07] [Server thread/INFO]: com.mojang.authlib.GameProfile@1d41db4id=,name=vnoi,properties={},legacy=false lost connection:Disconnected
Manager.title: problem connecting to the server.

Manager.description: I have ownCloud 8.1 running on debian wheezy with self-signed SSL certificate. Connecting from PC or mobile (Android 5.0.1) via https is working without issues. I have now installed ownCloud on my tablet (Android 5.1.1) and get an unknown error "Ein unbekannter Fehler ist aufgetreten!" when entering the login credentials (https://my-server/owncloud). I have then tried using http (http://my-server/owncloud) on the tablet and the connection can be established. In the admin settings I have set to "force https", but with tcpdump I still can see traffic going over port 80. Expected behaviour Login credentials using https accepted and able to login Actual behaviour https not accepted and only http accepted Steps to reproduce Open ownCloud app. Enter server address https://my-server/owncloud get error "unknown error" change server address to http://my-server/owncloud successfull login Environment data Android version: 5.1.1 Device model: Nexus 10 Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: v1.7.1 ownCloud server version: 8.1 Logs Web server error log none Insert your webserver log here none ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) none Insert your ownCloud log here none
Manager.title: Android connecting via http although "forced https" is set in setting
