Manager.description: In #413 and #8 it was suggested and also partially fixed to show the server's certificate. Example output (current version 1.7.x) 5891524778990fb6b40e3d988260e80192975a22c5529379f8d89d072b2b44ac 145a9f612e1f7e77a768ccc7be39b3508756a510ef8b61c7ac38133dc73f8ab4 ... 0f0527b439230c9c5b86c6a3b6d4a77ff61df10f4e2a523ea31d820036a8c9cd b8c70908110b0fea9fe2046feba68b7cb9893ea9825425c66eaf9f6a7b140130 However, it is very difficult to verify the whole certificate and a very unusual method. Therefore I suggest to calculate and display the sha256 fingerprint and, yes, these are deprecated checksums, for user convenience to show also sha1 and md5 checksum of the certificate. Example: sha256 c5:46:51:a8:14:24:dd:ee:64:86:37:7e:d3:a3:a2:5f:51:ca:00:7e:66:74:4c:cd:cd:27:27:78:02:72:40:79 sha1 48:39:2a:40:1f:ea:b4:2d:79:07:fc:fd:1c:8a:ea:90:b4:55:7d:65 md5 9d:6c:de:e1:ac:6e:da:ec:56:86:1d:b9:27:24:0d:bf
Manager.title: Add certificate SHA256 fingerprint to the current certificate view. Perhaps also sha1 and md5.

Manager.description: On my new HUAWEI P8 LITE I noticed the problem that photos are not always automatically uploaded. HUAWEI P8 LITE (Modellnummer ALE-L21) Android 5.0 Owncload Android Client 1.7.1
Manager.title: InstantUpload not always working

Manager.description: I know there's a couple of open issues about specific aspects of material design (like the FAB), but this is more geared towards a bigger overhaul. ownCloud's two biggest competitors, Dropbox and Google Drive, are both considered to be "Material Design" apps. Do we want ownCloud to stick with its current UI, which is closest to Dropbox, or should it move to a card layout, like Google Drive? Drive does let you switch between a list view and a grid view, so it's kind of the best of both worlds. Should ownCloud be cards by default, with the option to switch to a list view? I was thinking about doing a more formal poll, but I kind of want to get a feel for the community's opinion on the look and feel/UX of the future of the ownCloud app. As a side note, I think that the app and the web interface should look similar/be cohesive, so there should probably be a parallel effort of moving the web interface to material as well.
Manager.title: Material Design

Manager.description: Sometimes, ownCloud 1.7.1 hangs when doing an upload. I have no way of cancel the upload. I need to stop the app via the App manager in order to make it working again. In my case, those hanging uploads sit there forever (I had an upload hanging for 8 hours). It would be good if there was an option to cancel an upload (i.e. tap on the upload notification then see all pending uploads, and a way to cancel the upload).
Manager.title: Cancel upload

Manager.description: Currently when you open a file you are greeted with this beauty: @davivel @tobiasKaminsky @masensio you know what I mean. ;) We need a nice material design spinner here, and a proper Material design icon for aborting it.
Manager.title: File loading bar old style

Manager.description: Hello all, I have posted my issue first in the forum, as I was not sure if I am experiencing a bug or if I am too bad to use the app correctly. It seems to be some buggy behavior. I am using the current Sync App on Samsung S6 (Android 5.0.2) and on server side it is the newest/current ownCloud Server running on Linux Ubuntu. I have two major issues uploading photos to folders I have created. Via the ownCloud App, browsing to the folder and then using the upload function. This is kind of pain in the ***. When browsing the folders, when I choose the Camera, first of all, the photo list is always chronological, I have to go pass thousands of photos before having the ability to select the pictures I want. Also before clicking on "Upload", I need to way for all thumbnails to be displayed, otherwise the app will break/stop. So uploading one picture can be a matter of 5 minutes just wainting that thumbnails are built up.. Via the image library and adding images to albums I am not sure if this is an ownCloud feature. But in the image library I can select "Add to album" after selecting one or more photos. I discovered this quite late ;-) As there is no recognition symbol to ownCloud, I never paid attention to it. Also what is "bizar", the album list matches only 50% of the folder I have created on ownCloud, the other half is missing.. Anyways, I have selected 4 pictures and associated them to one of the albums. Now the photos are gone from the image library but are not in the ownCloud folders. They seem to be gone, deleted.. Additional info: While I was looking for the disappered photos and browsing the storage space, I noticed that the owncloud folder has a /tmp folder and a folde named like my account login. Some folders I have created where in the account folder, some others in the /tmp folder. I couldn't find out the logic behind this segmentation... I would be glad to know if the client was designed to be like that or if it is seen as bug and will be enhanced in some next release? Best regards, MW
Manager.title: Photo upload issue and other ??

Manager.description: Something like long click a file to select it and click on other files to select them (like in androids photos app) should be possible. And please remember the last folder one moved in a file.
Manager.title: Move multiple files at once

Manager.description: Use the share action from another app Go into a folder with files in it, but none of them downloaded You see »Nothing in here« Instead, the files should correctly be shown. Otherwise people might think ownCloud deleted their stuff. ;) @davivel @rperezb
Manager.title: Uploader: Gives misleading »no content here« when there’s no offline files in a folder

Manager.description: Hello all, I use instant upload over wifi. It's working great since you expose your server to the internet. I would like to have more security using vpn. But until I activate the vpn tunnel the sync is already starting and gives error messages about missing IP. I would like to have a delay time after wifi connect for the sync. If possible adjustable. Let's say from 0 to 30 seconds. This would help a lot. Greetings Chucrute
Manager.title: Upload only on wifi with vpn connection

Manager.description: First to say, I like Owncloud. But I am disappointed that there is no option to logout using the android app. For security reasons, there should be a option to logout when the user choose so. Also, there should be a option to automatically logout, when the device is entering locked mode. When user is logged out, remember server settings, and user name if the user choose this as a option.
Manager.title: logout when device is locked, or user choose log out

Manager.description: Sometimes an instant upload is failing. If this happens I'm getting an error message which is stating that it failed. But there is no option to retry the upload (or even an option in the settings to automatically retry it after some minutes or so). When I'm clicking on the error message I'm just redirected to the folder in which my pictures should be uploaded. Makes the owncloud app nearly useless for me at the moment because I can't trust that everything is just working.
Manager.title: Missing retry-option for instant upload

Manager.description: I am participating since a quite long time to the android app. But still I have some questions about the develop process. This should not be a rant, I am just curios and want to understand the internal processes better. I do not want to affront somebody. (And of course I am not quitting the development ;) ) How are PR chosen for the next sprint? There are some PRs with huge impact (like #821 or #982), but instead some "minor" PRs are chosen. PRs are getting included too slooooow. ;) The oldest PR is from 11/14. First this may prevent user to create new PRs. But the more important problem is, that updating the PR to the newest develop version is getting more and more complicated (see #821). What prevents you to integrate the PRs faster? Men power? Since the last release the oc devs seem to disappear. There were far less activity and responses. Is the develop process not continuous, but are you working in cycles? And have times where you do not work for the app? Please try to answer my questions :)
Manager.title: More transparency in develop process

Manager.description: Currently owncloud for android does a TERRIBLE job showing what is happening when there are problems with the network connection. I will show two examples: Right now i "appear" to be connected to my 3g network, but somehow cant connect to anything. If i open owncloud app, and try to refresh some file ( which i have sure it was modified on the server) owncloud will popup a progressbar with "Wait a moment" and a few seconds later the progress will disappear and nothing is done, the file is not downloaded, there are no error messages , just nothing. Even worse, if i try to enter any folder in this condition, i will get : "nothing uploaded here" which is clearly wrong !
Manager.title: No error messages when there are problems in the network connection

Manager.description: It would be nice to have your uploaded pictures and videos, to be saved in to a folder with the date it was uploaded. I now need to sort through everything in the instant upload folder to find what I'm after. Getting it to read the date stamp of the picture and video and putting in to the date folder would be even better. But I will be happy with the uploaded date folder. Thanks for a great app.
Manager.title: instant upload folder organization.

Manager.description: I use Picasa on my Windows desktop: it creates a special file in each folder called ".picasa.ini". This file is used to store useful information (people in the pictures, modification, ...). So, IMO, it's useful that ownCloud syncs it. Unfortunately, this prevents the Android app to consider the folder "full of pictures, and only pictures". As a consequence, the grid view is not shown. Instead of that, we have a file list, with thumbnails and the name of the folders. Would it be possible, for example, to exclude files starting with a point, when the app wants to know if there are only pictures in the folder? Config : Ubuntu 15.04 3.19.0-25-generic Server version: Apache/2.4.10 (Ubuntu) PHP 5.6.4-4ubuntu6.2 (cli) (built: Jul 2 2015 15:29:28) mysql Ver 14.14 Distrib 5.6.25, for debian-linux-gnu (x86_64) using EditLine wrapper Android ownCloud app: 1.7.2 Android version : 4.2.1 ownCloud server: 8.1.0
Manager.title: Grid view not shown if picasa.ini is present

Manager.description: I don't know if it's stated in #894, but the grid setting, when enabled, should be propagated down the tree of files to all descendent folders. If set in root fold, all the children will be shown in grid mode too. Then, if list view is selected for a subfolder, it will applied (and remembered) to that subfolder and all its children. Think in a 3-valued property: "list", "grid" and "inherited"; the default value for every folder is "inherited", with the exception of the root folder, where "inherited" makes no sense and is promoted to "list". The user only can choose in the UI between "list" or "grid", "inherited" is for internal use. OLD: The threshold was 80%, now it is 100%. I think this should be adjustable as each user may have a different wish. @jancborchardt What do you think? A slider with value? https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/sliders.html#sliders-continuous-slider --> With an editable numeric value
Manager.title: Change list vs grid view

Manager.description: It would be great if we could sort files in any way, when searching for upload them (from the ownCloud app), at least like usual folder browsing inside the app.
Manager.title: File sorting on upload

Manager.description: I need to install two ownCloud android apps on the same device - suppose CloudA and CloudB (different UI for CloudB). After installing CloudA and running successfully on the device, when I try to install CloudB, Eclipse shows INSTALL_FAILED_CONFLICTING_PROVIDER error. I tried by changing 'authorities' name in the manifest but it does not work. What's wrong!!!
Manager.title: multiple ownCloud android app on the same device - INSTALL_FAILED_CONFLICTING_PROVIDER error

Manager.description: The owncloud app is listed among the apps to share information whenever you choice to share something. However, most of the time the share fails, since the owncloud app does not know how to handle the data. This is really frustrating. The most advantage purpose of having access to the owncloud server on an android device is the point that one is able to add very quickly content.. Owncloud on the go... The Owncloud app should therefore try to handle as much shared data as possible. If there are multiple ways, it could offer a selection. E.g. saving as txt or odt. Furthermore, the settings could define standard saving options. E.g. Save in the folder notes/income/ save as $date-time-app-name. It should be possible to save text, images, videos, links, html, etc. An example how such a saving method could work would be the save dialogs of the firefox webbrowser, where one can simply save as default by a single click or allow customized saving settings.
Manager.title: Owncloud app should accept as many share content as possible

Manager.description: Not a bug per se but should be noted so the readme can be updated with instruction. There are issues compiling with android studio (Error:Configuration with name 'default' not found.). Eclipse compile with no issues.
Manager.title: Compile Issues

Manager.description: In a folder list and in a file list, accentuated letter are not considered properly to sort the folders/files. For example, the letter "e" with accent "é" should be considered as a normal "e". But a folder or a file starting with "é" is sent to the end of the list, after "z". Example: Étudiant should be before Radio Fé should be before Fr It's the same for other accentuated letters (I didn't test all of them): í, à, ô, ù, ñ, ...
Manager.title: Accentuated letter are not sorted alphabetically

Manager.description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE IT There is an account which has two folder: -a (Inside folder a, there are two png without background) -Documents login Access to folder "a" Thumbnails without background is shown go back to root CURRENT BEHAVIOR -- The background for png are shown in the folder EXPECTED BEHAVIOR -- background is only shown in png images, not in other icons DEVICE -- Motorola e v.4.4.4 This issue came from #1056 @tobiasKaminsky could you take a look? thanks
Manager.title: png background is shown in the folder

Manager.description: To maintain a similar appereance in the whole app, the uploader should have the create folder button in the action bar not in the bottom as a simple bottom. You can see in the next image:
Manager.title: Create folder button in uploader view move to ActionBar

Manager.description: This would be a great feature - Syncing the local Calender/Contacts with your OwnCloud account if the app is enabled on the server. This would be a great because I'm sure other people, and not just my self, don't like the idea of downloading third-party applications and would rather prefer an original app from OwnCloud for dealing with sensitive information like this. I know Google use multiple applications, so I'm sure someone will come up with an idea whether to either have an application that does everything (aka OwnCloud), or split it into different apps from OwnCloud, e.g OwnCloud Contacts, OwnCloud Calender, etc.
Manager.title: Contacts and Calender syncing In-App

Manager.description: I do have the Android Studio installed (but not the stand-alone tools), working with it since a while. I wanted to start OC development and followed the instructions in https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/SETUP.md . However, when running ./setup_env.sh gradle this fails on my machine in line 7 /setup_env.sh: line 7: android: command not found. Pls. assist, perhaps something is missing in the instructions, or not present in the PATH. If both the Android Studio and the stand-alone tools are needed, then it may be wise to add such a hint in the SETUP.md.
Manager.title: [Clarification request] SETUP.md instructions. /setup_env.sh: line 7: android: command not found

For now I added a dummy to my material branch, see b1f6b5e to avoid the compile error, see /home/travis/build/owncloud/android/src/com/owncloud/android/authentication/AuthenticatorActivity.java:228: error: cannot find symbol --> R.string.error_cant_bind_to_operations_service in travis: https://travis-ci.org/owncloud/android/builds/79025877
Manager.title: Master build broken

Manager.description: If an attacker somehow find themselves in a position to inject script into a WebView, then they could exploit the opportunity to access local resources. This can be somewhat prevented by disabling local file system access. It is enabled by default. The Android WebSettings class can be used to disable local file system access via the public method setAllowFileAccess. webSettings().setAllowFileAccess(false); This restricts the WebView to loading local resources from file:///android_asset (assets) and file:///android_res (resources).
Manager.title: Disable File System Access in Webview Activity

Manager.description: Please add a preferance to upload media only when a power is plugged.

I get following error if I don't have 22.0.1 not installed. I have tried changing compileSdkVersion to 23 and builtToolVersion to 23.0.1 in build.gradle but there is no luck. Other applications place pictures in /sdcard/DCIM also like Tasker and some others. Would others users like the option to auto upload other directory on the phone or even include sub directories? Thanks you for considering. -Jay

Manager.description: With the new (material design) implementation buttons can't simply bind java methods via configuration anymore but need to do this is the way we already did it except for one instance in the login screen, when you hit the refresh button (for example when you entered an invalid owncloud url). Bug number 2 (I know this should be separated..) is a UI glitch, or rather two on the login screen: the refresh button is oversized in the landscape mode the hint text has a size glitch when you refresh on an invalid address (spinning icon Vs. warning icon) Unfortunately I don't have the time now to fork/PR but I have the fix already on the other branches for #1090 and #1100 e.g. 044c597 549284e d78077d hopefully I will find the time to open up a PR tomorrow. Update The crash bug isn't present on 1.8/master just on my feature branches. The remaining two issues have been fixed on PR #1163
Manager.title: Refresh icon/action on URL textfield

Manager.description: Due to the fact that everyone can manage their own server, it is often hard to find why some things do not work. Maybe it is a good idea to implement a functionality check with (not complete) login thumbnails upload dummy file move dummy file and so on This could be done with a verbose log, which can then be posted directly here, if there is a problem. (And of course present a link to github issue tracker)

Manager.title: Development Roadmap

Manager.description: from @joede: Just a stupid question. If other tools like QuickPic can see the images, can these tools delete these files too? If so, what happens to the sync process? Does the ownCloud client sync the deletion of the file? from @tobiasKaminsky: @joede The deletion of the local file on the device is not synced to the server. But I do not know, if the app is noticed about the deletion. I bet that the app tries to open the local file and fails as it is not there OR the app downloads the file again (which is most likely) from @joede: @tobiasKaminsky so the OC app should disallow modifications of the filename and deletions. Is this possible?
Manager.title: Deletion/modification of owncloud files from "outside"

Possibilities of enable/disable and change the expiration time NOTE: This is related to: owncloud/ios#425 This is the first step to be able to share with users since we are developing the new view
Manager.title: As an OC user I want to SHARE VIA LINK with password protection and expiration time using the new interface so that I can secure my shared files

Android 4 works fine ownCloud android version, 1.8

Manager.description: Could you guys add the ability to share files and folders with other users from the app instead of only being able to share with a link?
Manager.title: Sharing with other users

Manager.description: Request: please make instant upload a per-account configuration. Background: I have a personal and a company cloud configured. I cannot use federated shares. I want my pictures to always sync with my personal account and never to my work account. Expected behavior: even if I've recently been looking in my work folder structure, new pictures should be synced to my personal account. Actual behavior: it is synced to whichever account had been most recently opened. (Perhaps related: does this mean that sync events only deal with "current account" and not specific accounts?)
Manager.title: Instant_upload and multiple accounts

Manager.description: Using file.getFileId() in ThumnailsCacheManager does not return the same value as it is stored in database (oc_filecache). Am I just confused? @davivel @rperezb
Manager.title: ocFile.getFileID does not match database value

Manager.description: For security, I think 2FA is a must, TOTP should be sufficient. So that a compromised password isn't too big of an issue. Also, would it be possible for the Android and Desktop clients to check the SSL certificate fingerprint? Bassically, in the settings menu it should have a little information about the SSL certificate including the fingerprint. The app should give a warning when anything changed, that way MIT attacks are nearly impossible.
Manager.title: Security

Manager.description: Currently when downloading multiple files, you often end up with 2 notifications: one for the download in progress, and one for the »success« notification of the previous download: When there is another download coming right after, it is unnecessary to show the success notification. An error notification when something went wrong is enough, and a summary success notification at the end (which of course vanishes like the one currently does.) cc @davivel @masensio @AndyScherzinger @tobiasKaminsky @stoyicker
Manager.title: Only use one notification

Manager.description: Currently when uploading files from other Android apps (like Gallery), only folders of your ownCloud show in the upload popup. But it should also show files – otherwise you might think they are gone. @davivel @masensio @AndyScherzinger @tobiasKaminsky
Manager.title: Show files in uploader

Manager.description: Currently in the list the file size floats on the right in free space (looks especially strange for short file names). Instead, it should just be right next to the date, separated with a comma and space from it.
Manager.title: Move file size next to date instead of floating right

Manager.description: There are many open issues that are only open as the corresponding PR is not yet merged. But it is hardly to see in the issue overview. So I suggest a new label "resolved by PR/ PR exists" or something that indicates that the issue is only open as long as the PR is not merged. For instance: #1181
Manager.title: New label: resolved by PR

Manager.description: #1168 (comment): Colorify primary action (upload) after #1209 is merged. File: Uploader.java / uploader_layout.xml Depends on: #1209, #1168 material buttons #1209 avoid duplicates #1168
Manager.title: Uploader: colorify primary action

Manager.description: I would like to be able to view a file without having to download it to my phone
Manager.title: View a file without downloading it

Manager.description: So I looked through the couple issue and PR threads pertaining to the Material redesign, and all I can tell is that at one point in the screenshots the drawer went at least up to the status bar, but then it started stopping at the app bar. Can't seem to find an issue pertaining to this, so... Expected behaviour The drawer goes from the nav bar, or bottom of screen with hardware buttons, to the top of the screen, or at least to the status bar. Actual behaviour The drawer stops at the app bar, almost certainly intentionally Steps to reproduce Open app drawer, using hamburger button or edge swipe. Environment data Android version: 5.1.1 Device model: OnePlus One Stock or customized system: Customized (CyanogenMod instead of Cyanogen OS) ownCloud app version: 1.8.0 ownCloud server version: 8.1 Are logs relevant with intentional behavior? Sorry if this is the wrong place, I wasn't quite sure where this goes.
Manager.title: Full-height material drawer?

Manager.description: Follow up issue for #1192 and #1200 Issue: For some languages the time is shown besides the date instead of just the date (see screenshot)
Manager.title: Date/Time format for certain languages

Manager.description: In order to pre-test the PRs by the community I suggest to create a public beta in a new branch. There will be an apk, that experienced user can download, install and test. This branch will contains all PRs that are "3 - to review" or above. Issues regarding the beta will get the label "Beta". Found bugs or improvements are implemented in the corresponding original PRs and merged back to beta. The main advantage of this is, that the PRs are tested by far more user than "only" the QA. Furthermore if the PRs have fewer issues, the workload of the QA should be lower and thus can result in a faster merge process. I am willing to maintain this branch and do a merge if the belonging PRs are changing. What do you think? @davivel @rperezb @jancborchardt @AndyScherzinger @lukeowncloud
Manager.title: Public Beta

Manager.description: Owncloud's upload will sometimes freeze in the middle of an "Instant upload" if I'm on the edge of my wifi or leaving the house. Then the notification that the upload is 55% (or whatever) just stays there as it is still uploading and it is non-dismissable. It would be nice if this uploading notification was dismissable. If owncloud has not actually sent any data for a minute it should queue it for later.
Manager.title: In-progress upload notification gets frozen and can't be dismissed

Manager.description: I've the last version of both owncloud and camera360 and I've noticed that when I take a picture is not automatically uploaded to my owncloud server. Photos are saves in the same folder used by the stock android camera app and from which the upload works correctly. It's just from camera360 that doesn't work
Manager.title: Instantupload doesn't work with camera360

Manager.description: Hey there, could you please reduce the over YOURLS integrate? Thanks! Best, Benny
Manager.title: Short with own YOURLS Links Shorter

Manager.description: Using owncloud-beta-2015-10-30.apk. In settings menu, where it should say "Protect your ownCloud app with a pin", it just reads "@2131165531". It further mixes local and English languages.
Manager.title: Beta: Internationalization issues

Manager.description: Using owncloud-beta-2015-10-30.apk. When clicking a file which is not an image and not already available on the device, nothing happens. Work around: Long click the file, select "Details" from the menu, then click the download button, go back to list. Now clicking the file works.
Manager.title: Beta: Cannot open files

Manager.description: Using owncloud-beta-2015-10-30.apk. When choosing "On device" from the side drawer I expect all folders which do not contain any downloaded files to disappear. Instead I still see the whole folder structure. This is confusing to me as a user. Further, there is no indication that currently only files "on device" are shown. Looking at a folder which I know has content but which says "Nothing in here. Upload something!" (string file_list_empty), is even more confusing. Note: Also string local_file_list_empty "There are no files in this folder." would not help much, either.
Manager.title: Side drawer: "On device" show empty folders

Manager.description: At least for me I read "27, 2 Mb" and not "Jun 27" and "2 Mb". While I understand the approach to have the Filesize left aligned, I guess this not perfect... Ps.: Is this beta related? I do not know from which PR this is...
Manager.title: Confusing: Size is too close to date

Manager.description: Using owncloud-beta-2015-10-30.apk. How to reproduce: Open a folder containing many photos, choose grid view. At this moment there are still no thumbnails. Open a photo, go back to grid. Now some thumbnails are shown. Scroll down, scroll up. Thumbnails are gone. Thumbnails are also gone after switching screen off and on again. Note: It seems that after after thumbnails of a folder are loaded, they do not disappear anymore.
Manager.title: Thumbnails gone after scroll down and up again

Manager.description: The synchronise icon is not shown (to be exact: when you know where it should be, you can click it). So it appears to be a problem with the visibility property.
Manager.title: [beta] In the file view, the sync icon is invisible (visibility property problem?)

Manager.description: @Wikinaut wrote: @lukeowncloud here https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/#/c/248699/ is a code patch (fully tested!) which I recently developed for the Wikipedia App, it adds variant and build name, and git version hash to the apk name. Perhaps you want me to formally send a Pull Request for oc/android, then let me know, and I will supply it very quickly. Changes are required in two files see patch set 10 : https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/#/c/248699/10/app/build.gradle https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/#/c/248699/10/app/src/main/res/values/strings_no_translate.xml
Manager.title: Add build date and git version to beta build

Manager.description: Open a non-picture file (e.g. mp3), click menu: It contains entry "Set picture as". Clicking this action has no effect. However, it should not be there in the first place!
Manager.title: Menu action: "Set picture as" also not non-picture

Manager.description: Open a non-picture file (e.g. mp3), click menu: It contains entry "Set picture as". Clicking this action has no effect. However, it should not be there in the first place!
Manager.title: Menu action: "Set picture as" also for non-picture

Manager.description: Open a non-audio and non-video file which (e.g. xlsx), download starts. Quickly open menu. It holds about 6 entries. Wait for the download to finish, press back button when being asked to open the file. Open menu again: It holds about 12 entries. Is this intended? Another related issue: Open file, abort download. Now menu hosts about 10 entries. This can't be right, can it?
Manager.title: Menu items change after download/abort

Manager.description: Open MP3 file. Toast appears: "Cannot read media file". Clicking play shows toast: "File does not belong to valid account" Switch screen off and on: Media player is gone, instead file details view is shown. I still expect to see the player. Is this behavior beta specific? (I do not have the latest original version installed.)
Manager.title: Playing MP3 fails / file not downloaded

Manager.description: It is possible to disable the app PIN without entering the PIN. When PIN is enabled, go to settings dialog, uncheck according checkbox. New activity is opened asking for pin. Ignore dialog and press Android's last apps key. Swipe out owncloud app (thus close it). Start owncloud app again. It does not ask for PIN anymore.
Manager.title: Disable PIN without entering PIN

Manager.description: When a file or folder is selected by long press, menu Share with users does not work. As a consequence, folders cannot be shared. But great work!! Just letting You know, I was missing this feature so much! It was one of the few reasons to enter the web interface..
Manager.title: Beta: 2015-11-05 Share with users in the menu does not work

Manager.description: Thank You Tobias for bringing this possibility to share with ownCloud users!! I suppose that You plan to add the options of sharing for files and folders (can share, can edit, access control - create, change, delete), as it is important to be able to set the folder readonly when sharing.. I just wanted to leave the mention that they are missing for now. Thank You sooo muuuchh!!
Manager.title: Share with users menu is missing detailed options

Manager.description: Hey all, Took delivery of a Android 6 enabled phone yesterday and put the Owncloud app on it. It does not like it one bit to be honest, frequent black screen / crash and upload is not working. I did notice that at no time was i asked for permissions management, this is new in Android 6 in that permissions are supposed to be requested as an when they are needed rather than at install time via marketplace and i'm wondering if this is to blame (access to storage etc). Anyone else using Android 6 ATM who can confirm?
Manager.title: Owncloud Android doesnt like Android 6 Marshmallow

Manager.description: Do you guys have an e-mail i can send it too or should i post here?
Manager.title: So i have a security issue to discuss - should i post it here?

Manager.description: I thought that I could use the "View Changelog" menu entry to check which version am I using, but I just noticed that it opens: https://raw.githubcontent.com/owncloud/android/beta/CHANGELOG.mg , which I believe is the changelog for the whole branch. I almost reported an issue using old build (I installed newer build on the phone yesterday, but not on the tablet, and I used the tablet today) Adding some kind of indication to identify the build in the app would be nice. Especially for filtering dumb mistakes like the one I almost made.. 😓
Manager.title: Beta: add some kind of indication of which build I am using.

Manager.description: Is there any difference between the two?
Manager.title: Beta: 2015-11-05 Menu entry "Upload images taken with camera" is repeated in the config

Manager.description: When I preview the photos in fullscreen and I decide to download the original, the preview gets replaced by the original when the download is finished. That is nice. When I view an original in fullscreen and then decide to delete it, I think, I should be presented with the large preview and stay in fullscreen mode. Do You agree with me?
Manager.title: Beta: 2015-11-05 Deleting a local copy when viewing in fullscreen throws me back to directory listing

Manager.description: I was very happy when You introduced the possibility of using the grid view for all folders as I have many forlders with both documents and pictures or scans. Sometimes I do switch between the views as both have its advantages. When I was using the beta now, I found out that it is a little schizofrenic when EACH folder remembers the last viewing method. Several times I switched to grid view to look for some picture quickly, and I went through several subdirectories. Later I was viewing some of the diretories in list view. After some time I ended up with directories (seemingly) randomly switching between grid and list views as I was going through them. It was kind of.. odd behaviour. I think it would be better to have the grid/list as a mode switch like in other file managers. (When You use Nautilus or anything else, Your view also doesn’t switch from icon to list view as You go through the directory tree). Do You agree with me or do You have a different reason to have the view remembered for each folder?
Manager.title: Beta: 2015-11-05 Suggestion: Make the list / grid view a simple toggle

Manager.description: When uploading a file from Android (only?) the time and date of the file ist changed to time and date of upload. Is it possible to keep the original date and time? Thanks!
Manager.title: Date changed to date of upload (not original)

Manager.description: I just noticed that the beta version uses a new permission. I tracked the origin of the change down to the master branch: 905b68b#diff-a48d6def78e18cbabab3c95ae3c9fc49R44 I created a comment there but I wanted to create an official issue as well, since I deem this important. READ_PHONE_STATE allows to access a lot of information about the phone, including the IMEI of the phone and details about the SIM card. Is this really necessary? Was it added by accident? I do not find any usage of TelephonyManager which would require the permission.
Manager.title: ownCloud requires new permission READ_PHONE_STATE

Manager.description: The details screen serves no real purpose anymore. It only duplicates the info which is available elsewhere: name size date file type (it even wrongly states SVG files are of type JPEG) ability to favorite So I would say we should get rid of that screen and remove the action in the long-press file menu. This also serves as reducing the actions in the file menu, see #1144 cc @tobiasKaminsky @AndyScherzinger @davivel @masensio @MTRichards
Manager.title: Remove »Details« action from file menu

Manager.description: @elpraga Would it be possible to use enlarged small definition thumbnails instead of the circle until the big thumbnail is available? In the same way google does it when looking at searched images in Chrome on Android? It could be a nice usability improvement. Related to #1044
Manager.title: Resized images: show small thumbnail while loading resized image

Manager.description: Before OC8.2, I had several external storages (SFTP) mounted on a per-OC-user base, so every user had to enter login and password to use the external storage. As I use LDAP, all user's logins are the same, so this was quite a bit of double work. Now I switched to OC 8.2's new method to use session credentials. I globally added the external storage with this option, so OC logs in every user with his or her OC credentials to the SSH server. This works fine in the web interface and with normal WebDAV-access. The android app, however, does not even display the external storage mounted with "use session credentials".
Manager.title: External storage added with "use session credentials" do not show in android app

Manager.description: @tobiasKaminsky judging from the latest .apk, the current name is »Owncloud Beta«. The correct capitalization should be »ownCloud beta«. :)
Manager.title: ownCloud beta name capitalization

Manager.description: Since Android 5.0, Android has a new camera api with the ability to save the photos as *.dng. This is a raw format and very interesting for photographers. Apps like "Camera FV-5" support this feature. Expected behaviour All Images/Photos will be uploaded into my owncloud, when a made a new one. Actual behaviour The instantUpload is uploading the *.jpg and not the *.dng file. The files are in the same folder and the files are written in the same moment. Environment data Android Version : 6.0 Device model : Google Nexus 5 Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 1.8.0 ownCloud server version: 8.2.0
Manager.title: InstantUploud does not upload raw photos

Manager.description: What happens: I select "on device" from the sliding menu on the left. Both list and grid views show only files on device. Nevertheless when I list through the pinctures in fullscreen, I still list through all picutres in the directory. What I expect to happen: When I select "on device" I expect to see only the photos on device when I list through in fullscreen. Hope I managed to explain myself 😄 I am not sure if current behaviour is intentional or not.
Manager.title: Beta 20151120 All pictures are shown in fullscreen even though on device is selected

Manager.title: Change storage path: folder already exists

Manager.description: When selecting an empty folder when changing the storage path, the app crashes as it tries to access the list of files is set to the content of the folder and thus is empty: LocalFileListAdapter -> swapDirectory and then getView is trying to use the empty list.
Manager.title: Change storage path to empty folder

Manager.description: I saw that the original folder remains after changing the storage path? Is this intended? As the UI says "moving" I thought that the old folder will be removed after a successful copy?
Manager.title: Change storage path: files are only copied?

Manager.description: I've activated instand photo upload only on wifi. If I connect back to wifi, the app starts with upload. But if the wifi connection where lost and some pictures have to be uploaded, the app uses the mobile connection to upload. Looks like, that the app doesn't check the wifi connection on every picture or video on start upload.
Manager.title: Instant upload doesn't check wifi on every upload file start

Manager.description: The uploaded files where copied to an own owncloud folder. Thats not good, because of to many files in the gallery and to much space consumption. Please use to check to uploaded file the original folder and files.
Manager.title: Don't use an own folder on mobile for uploaded files

Manager.description: Hi, I wanted to use "share with users", but all I got was: Sorry, your server version does not allow share with users within clients. Please contact your administrator Although I am the admin I was clueless ;) After digging in the code the problem is that my server is 8.1.x and not 8.2.x. So I suggest to change the error message to: Sorry, your server version is 8.1.2 and sharing with users within clients is supported by at least 8.2.0. Please upgrade the server (or similar).
Manager.title: Share: unspecific error message

Manager.description: With the branch: #1168 Access to settings: It's included a new option under the Instant upload section: "Behavior: Do nothing" This is not pretty clear to me its aim (without having the background of github discussions 😃 @MTRichards @jancborchardt any suggestion here? On the other hand, when you tap on it, you may change the options @tobiasKaminsky not sure about the difference between: move file to OC folder and delete origin file do nothing - probably, we should define a default mode which I'd say: copy file to OC folder ❓

Manager.description: With the branch: #1168 STEPS: 1.- Access to settings: 2.- As Behavior it´s shown: Do nothing 3.- Tap on behavior and change it to move file to OC folder EXPECTED BEHAVIOR On the settings view it´s shown: move file to OC folder CURRENT BEHAVIOR On the settings view it´s shown: do nothing If you change the device orientation, it´s updated Device HTC 4.1.2

Manager.description: Google introduced a new fingerprint authentification service with the release of the Nexus 5X and 6P called Nexus Imprint. Github user @afollestad created a library that wraps around the Google Api and provides fingerprint unlock with a passphrase fallback. Would it be possible to implement this as another method to unlock the app (instead of a PIN code)? Library: https://github.com/afollestad/digitus
Manager.title: Support for Nexus Imprint

Manager.description: When I upload a file from my phone to my server, the app creates a folder on my phone and copies the file to that folder... so now I have 2 copies of ever file I upload on my phone. This effectively cuts my phone storage in half, and is crazy if I want to upload hundreds or thousands of photos. What is the thinking behind this? Dropbox does not do this. If this "feature" is going to remain then it should be able to be turned off in the settings. Yes, I could upload a file then go and delete the copy that was made on my phone, but I don't want to do this.
Manager.title: Android - Duplicate files.

Manager.description: If the application data is cleared via app info (Settings > Apps > ownCloud > Storage > CLEAR DATA), then the PIN is removed, too. But as the account info is kept, starting the app again will give one access to the account without any PIN code. Tested on Nexus 5 with Android 6.0 and ownCloud Android App 1.8.0.
Manager.title: Clearing application data removes passcode

After a reinstall (due to some tests) I wanted to switch a fresh-install back to the external sdcard. This does not work as owncloud says that the folder is existing (we talked about it). Now the question is, how to deal with such a situation? Deleting the folder and download all files once again is not a good option. The official app does not care if the folder exists and tries to use it, or? Maybe, if the folder exists the app should ask: "use it" or "rename and move internal folder to external". What do you think?

Manager.description: Hi, The android client for owncloud is throwing the following error when trying to connect over HTTPS: "Unknown error ocurred!" after testing the connection. I just updated recently to core version 8.2.1 and suddenly the mobile connectivity stopped working. I am using nginx + php5-fpm (5.6.16-2+deb.sury.org~trusty+1 (fpm-fcgi)) in ubuntu 14.04 and the nginx config is directly the config you provide in the official documentation. I put here a capture of nginx logs when the mobile app tries to connect: [08/Dec/2015:19:12:54 +0000] "GET /status.php HTTP/1.1" 200 106 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/1.9.0" "-" It seems like the webserver responds properly but the mobile app fails to connect. I am trying to connecto from a Nexus 5 with Android 6.0, but this is also reproducible in other mobile phones and in Android 5.x This is getting very annoying and I would be very please if you could take a look. Thanks in advance.
Manager.title: Unknown error ocurred!

Manager.description: Since 1.9.0 the Android OC client is constantly syncing and keeping the device awake when the auto-sync option under "Accounts" is checked. I've got it installed on two 5.1.1 devices and this behaviour occurs on both. Once it has finished scanning the whole folder structure it starts again after 30-60 seconds, keeping the device awake (it never goes do deep-sleep), draining the battery and generating permanent traffic. This didn't occur with 1.8.0. Because of that I had to disable auto sync. Does anyone have this problem as well?
Manager.title: ownCloud 1.9.0 constantly syncing

Please let me know if there's a way to get a more helpful message from this.

Manager.description: One sorely lacking feature (unless it's already implemented in which case this is a bug report) is the lack of ownCloud's app acting as a document provider. A document provider essentially tells the Android operating system that it is an application that manages files. Google Drive is a document provider, and therefore whenever the OS-level file picker comes up (for example, when selecting a new image as a wallpaper), Google Drive is offered as one such service you can use to browse files. Implementing this feature shouldn't be too terrible hard, all the documentation on it is provided here: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/document-provider.html
Manager.title: Implement a Document Provider

Manager.description: One personal annoyance is that the ownCloud app downloads every image that I open on my devices to the internal storage. Sometimes, I want to view an image just temporarily and NOT have it automatically downloaded and stored to /sdcard/owncloud/.../. Perhaps downloading them into a cache would be more proper, then if the user clicks the menu button, offer to let them download the image and then it would be appropriate to save it to /sdcard/owncloud/.../. Otherwise every image I view from a different folder (and I have many, many folders) from the ownCloud app triggers Google Play Services to shoot me a notification asking if I want to backup that folder to Google Photos.
Manager.title: View Photos Temporarily without Downloading them to System

Manager.description: Since the last update to the new material design version, my owncloud log is being flooded with Error PHP Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/user-otp/user_otp/lib/otp.php:310) at /var/www/owncloud/lib/private/api.php#346 2015-12-14T13:46:02-03:00 Warning core Login failed: 'salas' Error PHP session_regenerate_id(): Cannot regenerate session id - headers already sent at /var/www/owncloud/lib/private/user.php#241 2015-12-14T13:46:02-03:00 The app appears to be working , but this flood is making very difficult be able to use fail2ban to block bruteforce attempts because connection from the new android app is generating a 'login failed' message. Nothing was changed on the server (otp in use for a long time with no problem) and this log started appearing right after update to the material design, so i think something changed on the client; ii owncloud 8.1.4-12.1 ii php5 5.6.14+dfsg-0+deb8u1 ii apache2 2.4.10-10+deb8u3
Manager.title: Lots of login failed in log after update to material version

Manager.description: Sharing in mobile devices does not support federated sharing with other servers' users.
Manager.title: Federated sharing support in mobile devices

Manager.description: Expected behaviour it should be possible to not autosynch/refresh specific folders. Actual behaviour the client is relentless and goes on for hours, synching scanning a folder that was removed locally, until the phone runs out of battery. i have a directory in my owncloud storage that i do not want to synch on my phone as it's rather big (~2GB). what i've done so far is select the directory in the client, select 'remove' and then 'local copy only'. i'm not sure if this is supposed to disable the synching of this directory from that point on, but as i see no other setting where i can exempt this folder, i guess it should. Steps to reproduce have a rather big folder in your owncloud (~2gb in my case) wait. Environment data Android version: 5.1 Device model: Moto G LTE 1st gen Stock or customized system: stock ownCloud app version: 1.9.0 ownCloud server version: 8.1.2 Logs Web server error log this goes on for hours: PROPFIND /remote.php/webdav/that_folder/[...] ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) there are no entries from the time the issue occured.
Manager.title: Client keeps scanning directory even though it should not be synched

Manager.description: What I'm doing : -Check automatic picture upload -Check only wifi What is happening : -Nothing most of the time -If I'm on wifi + owncloud in the background + I take a picture : It uploads it What I'm expecting to happen : -Should upload all the pictures that has been taken when I didn't had wifi -The app shouldn't have to be launched to upload pictures Some suggestion : -Maybe a way to disable the owncloud notification / icon on each upload. -Are the weird kind of "loading" dots on the top of the app made on purpose ? They look weird. -Users should be able to chose the folder name for auto upload, if you have more than one device it is a mess. Thanks for reading :)
Manager.title: Automatic upload works only sometime

Manager.description: PR: #1209 In list view, uploads view and details view, the size of the file is shown without decimals. In server side is shown with at least one decimal when the size is greater than 1MB. For example, these two files: Server: 343 KB (any decimal) 1,4 MB (one decimal when size > 1MB) Mobile device: 343 KB (any decimal, right) 1 MB (any decimal, should be shown the first one, as in server side)
Manager.title: Incomplete size in list and details view (PR 1209)

Manager.description: Currently when one has multiple accounts in the app the only way to switch between these accounts is to open the settings and select the appropriate account. Would it be possible to have a quicker way? e.g. from the sidebar?
Manager.title: Quick Account-Switching in navigation drawer

Manager.description: Maybe this is something I got used to by other apps and I really don't know whether this is an Android-UI-Guidline or not. Currently the ownCloud-Client closes when the back button is pressed in the root folder view. Other apps, e.g. the ownCloud Newsreader, first open the navigation drawer and when pressing back a second time with the open drawer it leaves the app.
Manager.title: Only leave application with open navigation drawer

Manager.description: I've just deployed a letsencrypt HTTPS certificate on my owncloud server. Firefox and Chrome are fine with the cert and can successfully validate it, however, the Owncloud Android app still issues a warning that the cert is signed by an unknown authority. A quick Google search tells me that this may be related to which Android URL API is in use, however, I can't give more details ATM. Issue occurs on Owncloud app 1.9.0.
Manager.title: Owncloud client warns with valid letsencrypt HTTPS certificate

Manager.description: Using fdroid's owncloud beta151222 on a Nexus 6p with PureNexus rom, I perform the following steps, Long press on a folder I would like to share with another user. Press the share button in the top bar. Click 'Add User Or Group'. Type in user's name. No list pops up and pressing the enter button does nothing. I noticed it still works well in the stable version. This essentially disables sharing with other users. Thanks for any help you can provide. I'm really enjoying beta.
Manager.title: [Beta] User list doesn't appear for sharing

Manager.description: Hi, instant photo uploading with android client 1.9.0 produces this error: Error PHP Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php:70) at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php#58 Photos were uploads successfully. sudo -u www-data php ./occ app:list Enabled: activity: 2.1.3 calendar: 0.8.1 contacts: 0.5.0.0 direct_menu: 0.5 files: 1.2.0 files_external: 0.3.0 files_pdfviewer: 0.7 files_sharing: 0.7.0 files_texteditor: 2.0 files_trashbin: 0.7.0 files_versions: 1.1.0 files_videoviewer: 0.1.3 firstrunwizard: 1.1 gallery: 14.2.0 provisioning_api: 0.3.0 templateeditor: 0.1 user_otp: 2.5 Disabled: documents encryption external notifications ownbackup storagecharts2 user_external user_ldap System: Owncloud: 8.2.2 [ http://download.owncloud.org/download/repositories/stable/Ubuntu_14.04/ ] System: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS Webserver: apache2 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.8 PHP: php5 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.14 Database: mysql 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2 Ciao Marcus 👎 1
Manager.title: Instant photo upload: Cannot modify header information ... Sapi.php#58

Manager.description: Reminder issue to commit and merge the following change 2641996 (right now only on beta) This can only be done after the material_buttons PR and the multi-select PR have been merged or to the respective PR the will be merged seconds. Thus looping in @tobiasKaminsky #1209 #1176
Manager.title: House keeping: add correct checkboxes after merges

Manager.description: The beta app is already a very powerful and handy image viewer, and as it provides the option to view previews without having to download the original and to control the cache size, it became my viewer of choice for many occasions. Would it be too hard to add the possibility to rotate the photo? I know it could be tricky as sometimes we only have the preview, and it would only make sense, if the rotation got uploaded automatically to server, but.. What do You think?
Manager.title: Idea for enhancement: Add the possibility to rotate images

Manager.description: Some previews appear with the original photo in the top left corner and the rest of the space filled by white. I checked the original preview on the server and it appears OK. Maybe some glitch in the way the previews are displayed? Let me know if I should provide more info.
Manager.title: Beta 20151226 - Some previews appear with white space added to photos

Manager.description: AC: Include 2 independent branded options Show share with users: yes/no Show share with link: yes or not NOTE: this will imply to modify the current one https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/res/values/setup.xml#L27 Related to: owncloud/client#4325
Manager.title: [Share options] I want to decide whether share with users is shown or not

Manager.description: Considering the beta app, currently we create thumbnails that look great for both the list and the grid, but when we tap and open an image, what we see is the same thumbnail that is shown inside the grid. I think the best way to handle this situation is to show a thumbnail that looks like the original one but it's smaller (we could compress PNGs to JPGs and resize them to the screen size, so that the image size is kept low and in the same time we can't really feel a compression+size). The original image will be downloaded when requested explicitly. P.S. I also think that showing a compress image (in terms of format and quality only) inside the web client would be great as well. For example I keep a huge amount of images in my owncloud, and would be great surfing on them without have to wait even more than 10s to have some of them loaded. – EDIT: it actually works in this way :) Another option would be loading images progressively.
Manager.title: Thumbnail size is wrong in full screen

Manager.description: following up on the discussion in #1346 I was thinking it makes sense to hide the FAB when the multi select is active and show it again when multi select has been done. Pro: it removed the then unnecessary FAB since it has no actions for a multi select and could be considered clutter at this very moment Con: show/hide might be confusing since it doesn't add extra functionality and might feel jumpy Since I am not a UI/UX expert looping in @jancborchardt and also @tobiasKaminsky since it relates to the multi select discussion. What do you think? Personally I would hide it during multi select simply to "see" a list and nothing else :)
Manager.title: Hide FAB on multi select

Manager.description: Hi, I noticed, that images uploaded to OC, are copied to owncloud/OC-installation/SofortUpload and that they are remaining there - until forever, thus still blocking urgently needed storage space on the SD-CARD . Selecting an Option like: Delete image (video) after successful upload will make better use of the limited resources on a handset. Since the image is stored in the DCIM folder as well, there is still ONE local copy available and not TWO copies, whereas the copy in the OC folder is only required for upload purposes. regards, hitam4450
Manager.title: (optional) Delete of successful uploaded files e.g. images, videos

Manager.description: I think that the current concept of Favorites is somewhat misleading. I might have a "Favorite" folder that lies deep within the folder tree which I want to access quickly, but it does not necessarily mean that I want this whole folder synced on my phone. Would it be possible to make "Bookmarks" in the left menu part (where the access to configuration, and on device / all files switch is now) that would be merely a list of shortcuts to get us quickly deep into menu structure?
Manager.title: Enhancement: Ability to create bookmarks

Manager.description: and as a consequence it is impossible to upload a file to a folder that was created after the app updated the folder list. I think it would be good if fresh folder list would be fetched withing upload file dialog (when shared from other application)
Manager.title: Folder list is not updated when a file is uploaded

Manager.description: This is related to #899 Scenario: select a single list item and click on details menu item: In case you hit the back button (or click on the arrow in the action bar), the selection mode gets disabled and you are still in the details screen. Imho this is only a not very nice detail and should be resolved automatically when #1275 gets approved and merged (since it removed the details menu item). So looping in @jancborchardt and @tobiasKaminsky
Manager.title: Multi select navigation state bug - to be discussed (#899)

Manager.description: Currently the share popup has these dark blue header boxes. This is a tad jarring and should instead be done by whitespace and proper header text (darkblue text color). Just like in the settings. (Also, the Share text at the very top of the box should be correctly left aligned with the rest of the text.)
Manager.title: Subheaders of share view

Manager.description: I am not sure when exactly that happened, but now I noticed that it is harder to see which files are selected in multiselect. Would You agree with me?
Manager.title: Beta 20150109: It is harder then before to distinguish selected files

Manager.description: I'd like to keep in sync additional custom folders (WhatsApp Images, Screenshots...). To keep things simple from a UI prospective we could store these folders inside the same paths selected for camera pictures.
Manager.title: Keep in sync additional folders

Manager.description: My OC server uses a CAcert.org certificate (which had to be manually "trusted" after checking the fingerprint when the oc client was setup initially). I recently updated the certificate, because it was close to expire. When upstarting the OC Android client, or when clicking "Konto aktualisieren" (account sync), no warning information was shown (that the certificate has changed). But when actually performing a file action like "delete file on the server" (I only tried "delete" actions), the client shows the certificate-untrusted warning, so that I then could manually check the new fingerprint and set permanent trust to the renewed connection's certificate. I regard the following as a bug: certificate is not tested during syncing (certificate-has-changed information is not shown during syncing; it is however tested when actually performing a file action like delete.
Manager.title: When server certificate has changed, always show certificate info. Certificate-untrusted info is not shown when syncing.

Manager.description: The background color of the Settings and Log sections is not white at the moment. But should be, exactly like in the file list etc. The background should be white everywhere, except black in the image view of course. :)
Manager.title: Background color should be white everywhere

Manager.description: The whitespace is enough as separator, and the grey lines look a bit old-style. Removing them will look much better.
Manager.title: Remove grey lines in sidebar

Manager.description: Just as said in the title. Amy reasom we do not do this at the moment?
Manager.title: Settings and log should replace the content just like the files list instead of opening separate views

Manager.description: For some reason in the beta all the settings are shown. When instant upload is not enabled, none of the extra settings belonging to that should be shown though.
Manager.title: Hide the extra instant upload settings if they are not enabled

Manager.description: First one to separate the settings from the actually daily useful filters. And then in the beta, the log entry should also be in the settings, advanced section. (Which I described in #1431)
Manager.title: Move Settings to bottom of sidebar, move Log to Advanced settings

Manager.description: The multiselect header has a strange horizontal blue line in there. Also, when multiselecting one file and then going to »Details«, the header is still in multiselect mode. Should be normal though, since in that view there is no multiselection.
Manager.title: Multiselect header glitch

Manager.description: Currently the secondary button is grey with the dark ownCloud blue as text. However that's a bit much use of the brand color. Better would be to have the text color here black. Or if that's too intense compared to the primary button, a dark shade of grey.
Manager.title: Secondary button text color

Manager.description: Expected behaviour When I hit the "Synchronize" menu item, files stored locally on my device should be uploaded to the server. Ideally, this should happen automatically. Actual behaviour Files are downloaded from the server, but local changes are not uploaded. Steps to reproduce Open Android app. Long press on a folder. Select "Synchronize" The folder is stored in the local filesystem /storage/emulated/0/owncloud/user@server/foldername/ Edit one of the downloaded files - or save a new file in the folder. Changes and new files are not automatically syncronised. Repeat step 3. Changes and new files are not automatically syncronised. I've gone into Android's system settings - accounts - owncloud - and enabled "Sync Files". The problem still persists. I suppose I want the same functionality as the Linux Desktop client - the ability to selectively sync folders. Is that possible? If not, can this menu item be renamed "Download" rather than "Synchronize"? Environment data Android version: 6.0.1 Device model: Nexus 6 Stock or customized system: CM13 ownCloud app version: 1.9 ownCloud server version: 8.2 Logs Web server error log N/A ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) N/A
Manager.title: Two Way Sync?

Manager.description: Not sure what exactly it’s caused by, but today has been the third instance of the ownCloud app eating my battery in a massive way. Even though I wasn’t really using it today so far. System is a Moto G with Cyanogenmod 12.1, Android 5.1. I use 2 accounts, no instant upload, some favorites though. Can anyone reproduce @tobiasKaminsky @AndyScherzinger @llucax @davivel @masensio
Manager.title: App drains battery

Manager.description: Hi ! When using the Android OwnCloud client, I have to manually select a file and click on "synchronize" otherwise, its content is not updated -- although the file properties are correctly updated in the Owncloud client. STEPS TO PERFORM perform the initial synchronization for instance I have a file called todo.txt in Documents/ which is properly synced I make a modification on my desktop client (KDE under Kubuntu). I make sure this is properly uploaded to the server : this is OK (checked from web interface) the file is not synced on the Android device I check the Owncloud client on the Android device : I can see the new filesize and new file date is displayed but when I click on the file, I can still see its former content the only way to make the OC Android client sync it properly is to select "synchronize" in the file context menu The problem is it has to be done manually each time. This is misleading as files attributes, in the OC client, are the right ones but the file content is not updated. Using : Server : Owncloud 8.1 (web4all.fr hosting) Desktop client : Kubuntu 14.04 LTS + Owncloud client v.2.1 Android Phone : Samsung Galaxy Core Prime LTE ; Android 5.0.2 Android Owncloud client : 1.9.0 Thanks to everyone involved ! Cheers !
Manager.title: Synchronization has to be performed manually

Manager.description: In detail view of any file, the first action in the menu is called @2131165569 but seems to be the share action.
Manager.title: Beta 20160120: Share action is called "@2131165569"

Manager.description: In the german version the new settings are not translate: First level: "On device" --> "Lokal gespeichert" In Settings (Einstellungen): "Storage path" --> "Speicherort" "Upload when charging only" --> "Upload nur beim aufladen" (absolut correct german would be: "Hochladen nur während des Aufladens" but "Upload" does not necessarily be translated and it would be too long) "Original file will be..." --> "Original speichern ..." ... "kept in original folder" --> "im ursprünglichen Ordner" ... "moved to app folder" --> "in Owncloud Ordner verschieben" "Common" --> Allgemein "Cache size" --> Cache größe" Beta specific settings (if needed): "Download latest beta version" --> "Letzte Betaversion runter laden" "Changelog beta version" --> Änderungsliste betaversion And btw: I think the translation "Dies einem Freund empfehlen" should be called "Owncloud weiterempfehlen" or "Die App weiterempfehlen".
Manager.title: Beta 20160120: Missing german translation for new setting options

Manager.description: Hello, I'm newbie in OC, but I'm stuck and cannot find any solution. I'm running OC8.2 on headless Debian Server (Trusty) with MySQL. I am running OwnClient Android appli on Android 5.0.2/Samsung S5: I have Instant video upload and Inst enabled on Android App, with upload via Wifi only Here is description of the issue and outcome of my investigations: If I'm connected on my Wifi home network with my mobile and I record a video, the video is immediately uploaded to OC. This is perfect. If I'm not connectd on wifi network and I record a video, this video will never be uploaded to my OC when I'm back at home, connected on my Wifi. Additinal information :idea: : I have also changed the OC folder for video upload several time (I have initially suspected that using same folder for images and videos could cause troubles), but it does not change anything. when a video is uploaded successfully (when I'm at home, recording and connected), I get the following error in the logs: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php:70) at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php#58 Your help will be appreciated. Zevleu Newbie Message(s) : 2 Inscription : Dim Jan 03, 2016 7:46 pm ownCloud version: 8.2.2 Webserver: nginx Database: MySQL OS: Linux PHP version: 5.4.45 Haut Re: Video upload does not work properly Message par Zevleu » Lun Jan 04, 2016 8:32 am I forgot to add that upload of images runs fine in all cases. The issue occurs only with videos. Zevleu Newbie Message(s) : 2 Inscription : Dim Jan 03, 2016 7:46 pm ownCloud version: 8.2.2 Webserver: nginx Database: MySQL OS: Linux PHP version: 5.4.45 Haut Re: Video upload does not work properly Message par tflidd » Lun Jan 04, 2016 11:04 am For Android issues please see https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues
Manager.title: Can't upload videos to OC from mobile

Manager.description: Actual behaviour I'm running OC8.2 on headless Debian Server (Trusty) with MySQL. I am running OwnClient Android appli on Android 5.0.2/Samsung S5: I have Instant video upload enabled on Android App, with upload via Wifi only Image upload runs perfectly. The issue is with video. Here is description of the issue and outcome of my investigations: If I'm connected on my Wifi home network with my mobile and I record a video, the video is immediately uploaded to OC. This is perfect. If I'm not connectd on wifi network and I record a video, this video will never be uploaded to my OC when I'm back at home, connected on my Wifi. Additinal information :idea: : I have also changed the OC folder for video upload several time (I have initially suspected that using same folder for images and videos could cause troubles), but it does not change anything. when a video is uploaded successfully (when I'm at home, recording and connected), I get the following error in the logs: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php:70) at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php#58 Environment data Android version: 5.0.2 Device model: Samsung S5 SM-G901F Stock or customized system: ownCloud app version: 1.9.0 ownCloud server version: 8.2.2 Logs Error PHP Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php:70) at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php#58 2016-01-22T22:04:57+00:00 Error PHP Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php:70) at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php#58 ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) {"reqId":"1tjBrYjQLLFxJ55ma0ZR","remoteAddr":"192.168.0.14","app":"PHP","message":"Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php:70) at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php#58","level":3,"time":"2016-01-22T22:04:43+00:00"} {"reqId":"XA+ExzSWjJtMQlVkq7Ow","remoteAddr":"192.168.0.14","app":"PHP","message":"Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php:70) at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php#58","level":3,"time":"2016-01-22T22:04:57+00:00"}

Manager.description: When the server uses a different/new certificate, the client just does not update any files anymore. There is no warning or anything. GoTo Settings -> Add account -> Type in server address -> Client is going to check the connection and asks if you trust the certificate. Accept and everything works again. Probably only an issue with self signed certificates.
Manager.title: (Self-signed) cerificate changes

Manager.description: This version does not upload photos on automatic, when installed on Lollipop. So I tried to upload a photo manually. Without success and without any errormessage. Installed on Kitkat (4.2.x) it works. I tried the newest beta with the same result and an enormous error-message stating it has something to do with permissions. (This issue has nothing to to with sd-cards, which are not writable!) Spielmops

Manager.description: Expected behaviour Server changed SSL key after expiry (self signed certificate). Clients should ask for accepting self signed certificate and then work fine Actual behaviour Browsers and desktop clients correctly recognize new certificate, ask for overriding self signed and work fine after accepting. Mobile clients (Android and iOS) continue browsing repository, but fail to download and upload files (without any error message in client or server - not sure about this but didn't find anything). Steps to reproduce Use Server with self signed SSL certificate Create profile on mobile clients Let server certificate expire Change server certificate to new self signed certificate Browse files with mobile client and try to download or upload files Workaround delete profile on mobile client recreate profile on mobile client (offline data keeps present, but certificate is validated) Environment data Android 4.1.2 and iOS 9.2.1 ownCloud app version: current (1.9.1) on Android, current (17.02.2016) on iOS ownCloud server version: 8.2.2 Logs Web server error log [Wed Feb 17 23:20:27.719478 2016] [authz_core:error] [pid 18301] [client x.x.x.x:47288] AH01630: client denied by server configuration: /var/www/owncloud/data/htaccesstest.txt (only message since last apache restart) ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
Manager.title: Downloads fail on mobile clients after server changed ssl key (browsing works fine, iOS also affected)

Manager.description: The Amazon App Store is still distributing version 1.8.0 of the ownCloud client app for Android. This has happened before: #423 and #561.
Manager.title: APK on Amazon Appstore is out of date

Manager.description: Expected behaviour The feedback option creates a new e-mail message to incoming2@owncloud.com. We expect this address to exist, delivering our e-mail message containing the feedback content. Actual behaviour The mailbox does not exist, according to ownCloud's mail server, kerio.owncloud.com. It results in a NDR being sent back. Steps to reproduce Open the Settings Tap 'Feedback' in the bottom of the Settings screen Produce e-mail message and tap the send button Receive e-mail message, it's a NDR, containing: incoming2@owncloud.com (kerio.owncloud.com: Mailbox does not exist) Environment data Android version: 5.1.1 Device model: Sony Xperia Z5 Compact (E5823) Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 1.9.1 ownCloud server version: 8.2.2
Manager.title: using Feedback option results in receiving a NDR

Manager.description: Expected behaviour All the failed uploads go to Current queue Actual behaviour Nothing happens Steps to reproduce Upload some files Before the uploads end, set the device in aeroplane mode (the uploads go to failed) Disable the aeroplane mode to recover the connection Tap on (...) on uploads view, and then tap in "retry" Environment data Android version: 5.0.1 Device model: Nexus5 ownCloud app version: 1.9.1 ownCloud server version: 9

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce Uploads some files From server, delete the account before the uploads finish Using another account in the app, open the uploads view Current behaviour The uploads of the deleted user appears as failed, with UNKNOWN cause Exptected behaviour The uploads of the deleted user are removed from uploads view Environment Tested with: Nexus5 v5.0.1

Manager.description: About the uploads view: · "Retry current uploads" (in ... menu) should be replaced for "Retry failed uploads" · The three upload list are named: Uploaded Current Failed Uploads They should be more uniform like that: Current Uploads Failed Uploads Finished Uploads (as they are named in "..." menu) or Current Failed Uploaded/Finished Related to the lists, the padding in upload list is a little bit, so that all the uploads in the list are very close.

Manager.description: Expected behaviour When a failed upload is tapped, is added to the "Current" queue to be upload. Actual behaviour Until the current retried upload is ended, no files are added to "Current" queue. Steps to reproduce 1.- Set to upload some large files 2.- Before the uploads end, set the device in aeroplane mode (the uploads go to failed) 3.- Disable the aeroplane mode 4.- Tap on several files to retry the upload Environment data Android version: 5.0.1 Device model: Nexus5 ownCloud app version: 1.9.1 ownCloud server version: 9

Manager.description: Expected behaviour Session expires, and credentials are requested only once. The uploads go to "Failed" list with cause "Credentials error" Actual behaviour Session expires, and credentials are requested twice. Manager.description: Expected behaviour If I set my password to test² I'm able to login to ownCloud via web or the native clients for debian and Windows 7. This should be the case for the android app also. Actual behaviour The app shows "wrong username or password" if I try to connect. If I set the connection to unencrypted and sniff the traffic, I can see that the app changes some special characters to question marks. Screenshots can be found here (german): https://florianmai.de/2016/03/13/owncloud-fuer-android-hat-probleme-mit-sonderzeichen/ Steps to reproduce Setup an account Change password to something containing characters like ² or ł Login via android app Environment data Android version: 5.1.1 Device model: Oneplus One Stock or customized system: Stock OxygenOS 2.1.4 ownCloud app version: latest on the play store ownCloud server version: 8.2.2 Logs Web server error log Webserver is working fine ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) No log found there
Manager.title: Problem with special characters in passwords

Thanks
