Manager.description: Expected behaviour The app is performing a long-running wifi-only upload (in my specific case, triggered by instant upload triggered by me being briefly near my home). I then leave wifi range within a few seconds of entering it. The app should suspend the ongoing upload (because I told it on its settings page that I only want it to upload on wifi). Actual behaviour The app proceeded to drain my data allowance by continuing to upload on an (unfortunately very fast LTE-based) cell network. Steps to reproduce Start wifi-only upload Leave wifi range Watch it drain your data allowance Environment data Android version: 6.0.1r22 Device model: One plus One Stock or customized system: Cyanogenmod nightly from Mar 21 ownCloud app version: 1.9.1 from FDroid ownCloud server version: 8.2
Manager.title: Continues Wifi-only upload when not on wifi

Manager.description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE 1.- Upload a large file (it is added to "Current view") 2.- Upload again the same file before the first upload finishes ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR Both uploads do not appear in the uploads view. Only one of them is uploaded. EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR Both uploads appears in the "Current" list. When both are finished, both files are stored in ownCloud, one of them renamed by adding "(2)" to the filename. Both files appear as "Uploaded" in uploads view. Tested with Nexus9 v6 and Galaxy S3 v4 Server v9 App version 1.9.1
Manager.title: If the same file is uploaded twice, both uploads are removed from list

Manager.description: Like the title says use the toolbar - Google's new, to be used implementation of the top bar instead of the action bar which can be considered legacy. Motivation The actionbar is simply a bar which can have a menu, search widget and in newer AppCompat versions also a drawer implementation but isn't as flexible as the toolbar. Reasons and benefits The toolbar can be customized on many ways like but not limited to: adding any kind of views to it, like the progressbar which would be nice especially when we integrate the multi select branch (no dark blue line below the then grey bar) no dark blue line below the bar when the drawer is opened animate it, like scrolling it away on a list/recycler view which seems nice on the file browsing views the material drawer can be full height, like mentioned in #1210 because this is only possible for the toolbar not the action bar (it can be done with hacks though) I would like to work on this in case we agree this is worth implementing which I strongly suggest to make the bar future proof and also to be able to implement the above mentioned gimmicks. So pinging @davivel @jancborchardt @malkomich @tobiasKaminsky and @przybylski for feedback on this matter.
Manager.title: Use toolbar instead of actionbar where applicable

Manager.description: There is this option to either leave a picture at the original place or move it to the app folder. When set to move files to the app folder, the current v1.9.1 from F-Droid does not really move them but leave behind 0-byte files: This also happened to this very screenshot, that I had to upload manually, as it does not land in the default pictures directory /sdcard0/DCIM/Camera but in /sdcard0/Pictures/Screenshots. Samsung Galaxy Ace 2, Android 4.2.1
Manager.title: Move file leaves 0-byte files behind

Manager.description: Expected behaviour Connect to ADFS 3.0 Actual behaviour with ADFS 3.0 the user cannot connect at all, and more institutions move towards ADFS 3.0 so this issue is much higher priority Steps to reproduce With an ADFS 3.0 institution of us states the android client isn't capable of "SNI (Server Name Indication)" - a feature of SSL TLS and both Web Application Proxy and AD FS 2012 R2 use it to enable simpler deployment and remove networking prerequisites. While the customer are trying to find a workaround, maybe engineering can have a look at your end if it is possible to cope with SNI. Environment data Android version: 1.9.1 @MorrisJobke @rperezb 00005104
Manager.title: Connect to ADFS 3.0

Manager.description: Hi, after a chrash I wiped my tablet. After that I installed ownloud app and tried to connect with my owncloud server. After I entered the server address I get an error: could not establish a connection. (in German: Konnte keine Verbindung aufbauen) The connect button is grey,I can't connect to the server. Before the crash everything works fine. If I enter the url in a browser I get the login on my server and everything is fine. Sync client on my pc althoug works without problems. I use a Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 with Cyanogen Mod 11, and current owncloud app (Ver 1.9.1). Owncloud-Server ist 8.2.2 on BananaPi with Debian Wheezy an nginx. SSL enabled, SSL certificate from LetsEncrypt. I connect to the server with an DynDns Domain name like https://myDynDns.com:40000
Manager.title: [Android]: could not establish a connection

Manager.description:
String number 358: "Settings, database and server certificates from %1$s's data will be deleted permanentlty. 

Downloaded files will be kept untouched.

This process can take some time." permanentlty --> permanently Steps to reproduce https://www.transifex.com/owncloud-org/owncloud/viewstrings/#is/android/74359823 There are some other; is this really the best place to announce typos?
Manager.title: Typo in the Android transifex XML

Manager.description: When uploading an image the app should automatically generate a thumbnail. This enhances the UX as the app has only to generate thumbnails for files on the server when entering a folder.
Manager.title: Upload files: automatically create thumbnail

Manager.description: Expected behaviour Tell us what should happen Actual behaviour Tell us what happens instead Steps to reproduce Environment data Android version: Device model: Stock or customized system: ownCloud app version: ownCloud server version: Logs Web server error log Insert your webserver log here ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) Insert your ownCloud log here

Manager.description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE 1.- Set two or more accounts in app 2.- In one of them, go to uploads view 3.- From this view, go to settings and remove the current account 4.- Select another account 5.- Swipe to display the left drawer ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR In drawer appears the removed user as header EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR In drawer appears the current user Tested with Nexus9 v6.
Manager.title: Username in drawer not refreshed when account is removed from uploads view

Manager.description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE 1.- Select to upload a huge amount of files (more than 30) ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR Sometimes, the progress bar of the bottom files is filled EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR Only the progress bar of the top file is in progress. All the remaining are grey (pending) Tested with Nexus5 v5, Nexus9 v6
Manager.title: When a lot of files is sent to uploads view, progress bar is not correctly managed

Manager.description: Let's say I upload some images from my Android phone's photo gallery into a folder called "Uploads" on my ownCloud server. When I use the ownCloud app to view the Uploads folder, if I tap an image that I want to see, it gets automatically downloaded to my phone and put in a new folder named Uploads. Great... If I view 100 photos now I have 100 duplicate images on my phone wasting space. Seems to me the act of downloading and saving, as opposed to simply viewing the image on the server, should be an optional selection. For example long press on the image and choose Download from a popup menu.
Manager.title: Need to view from server without downloading

Manager.description: At the moment I'm using owncloud android app 1.9.1 (via Stackstorage) but I'm missing out on a feature. All folders I created and files I uploaded in the web/windows client are only visible when I manually refresh the directory (pull-down refresh) in app. For example, I create a directory structure like this in-browser: Root = Folder 1 == Folder 2 === Folder 3 When I open my storage in the android app, I land up in root and there is no folder visible and the message "Nothing in here. Upload something!" is showing. I have to manually refresh the directory and then Folder 1 becomes visible. When I open Folder 1, it is empty again and I have to manually refresh to see Folder 2. The same for Folder 3. A nice feature would be that the file/dir listing is automatically refreshed so I don't need to manually refresh the x.xxx folders I have in my storage. Not sure if it's a bug or a feature request, but I hope you guys can help out!
Manager.title: Feature request: Auto-refresh file/directory listing

Manager.description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE Upload files ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR Path does not appear in uploaded files EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR Path appears Tested with Nexus9 and Nexus5
Manager.title: Upload path does not appear in "Uploaded"

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce With tablet in portrait, open the navigation drawer and tap on "Uploads" menu Open again the navigation drawer and tap on "All files" menu Tap on FAB, then on icon to create new folder Rotate the tablet to landscape Current behaviour Dialog to name new folder appears, but * software keyboard does not* Device turns to a full black screen; if then click HOME, app crashes Expected behaviour App is correctly redrawn, folder may be created after; if keyboard doesn't appear in 3., but appears with an extra tap on the name field, solution is acceptable. Environment TABLET (seems a key factor), Nexus 10, v5.0.2 Logs 3-18 10:33:00.103 22208-22208/com.owncloud.android I/AppCompatDelegate: The Activity's LayoutInflater already has a Factory installed so Manager.description: It happens pretty often that my instant upload fails. I'm not quite sure why that is the case, it then just displays "Upload failed". Is there a way to find out why it fails? Regarding that an upload can fail for any reason (e.g. networking), it would be nice if the owncloud client retried uploading by itself or from time to time synchronises the instant upload directory with not yet uploaded files from the phone (those that failed, "really new ones" are being tried to upload) either automatically or manually (synchronize folder or so). The current state on my Owncloud Client 1.9.1 on Cyanogenmod 12.1 is that the images that failed on uploading just never appear on the server and that I don't even seem to have a manual way to do it (except finding out by myself which images weren't uploaded and then select and upload them manually).
Manager.title: Needed: Automatic or manual retry of failed instant upload

Manager.description: So we have a couple of problems: User should generate Private Key every time when his password changed. Normally to generate Private Key user has to do it manually from web->username->Personal. iOS/android APIs not provide this functionality iOS/android APIs not provide handle of error (when user should to regenerate Private Key manually before getting any respons from server), just common handle like UNHANDLED_HTTP_CODE | UNKNOWN_ERROR

Manager.description: Problem: Android N is coming out in October, and we need to prepare the ownCloud app to work with the expected changes. In fact, we are expecting a few changes, many largely due to the concern of Android to conserve batteries. The big issues we know of are: The current instant uploads approach will no longer work. The alternative is the media store, so we need to switch to use it. BUT, it is not clear how immediate the notifications are so it might not be immediate instant uploads. The synchronization of the accounts will also not work because of the loss of the background The DOZE subsystem from Android 6 continues with ownCloud (designed to save battery life), but gets worse in N from our perspective. When the phone is left alone, and even moving but the screen is dark, after a some period of time makes other systems not available, such as the network. This means uploads in progress will be killed. A user can then reactivate them manually in ownCloud, but we need to deal with the fact that at any moment the system can interrupt the network, and thus kill sync and uploads/downloads. Users can disable Doze as well, but this is not ideal. However, a user can be asked this with a redirect to the system dialog about turning off Doze. One alternative for instant uploads is to create a service that is watching the folder for changes, and then we know immediately when a photo appears (solves 1). But then the second problem with Doze happens, and we need to figure out how to deal with it. Perhaps we can use the new chunking and add pause/resume capability, and chunk handling, so that when Doze interrupts the network, the app is able to resume rather than restart the upload. Ideal dev end state: Create a service that watches the file/folder for cnahges Update the uploader to be able to work in the short active windows between when Doze is on Add the ability for the pause and resume of uploads using the new 9.1 chunking, as well as older ownCloud instances. This likely means chunking and pause/resume will only be enabled on servers 9.1 or newer, and for older servers pause resume is not possible. (maybe) We need to consider how we resume downloads or we have the same problem as well for a synced folder / favorites Effort: This is a major effort when combined. Individually, this is also large individually. Conceivably this could be just a little later than the release of Android N. @davivel And @davivel was here: Problems to fix: Pictures / videos taken with the mobile need to be added automatically to OC if the user enable 'instant uploads : #6 ; related also: #744 Adapt to Doze; this will require some direct experimentation, "Doze mode" may be enforced with development tools: #1684
Manager.title: Android N Updates

Manager.description: As an ownCloud user, I want to sync files to my mobile devices automatically so that I can have always the latest files available on my mobile platform Acceptance Criteria: Current “not granted offline” continues as currently implemented in iOS (tap on a file downloads, tap again downloads latest, changes are uploaded to server if found) Current “not granted offline” in Android needs to be updated to meet user expectations: tap on a file downloads tap again downloads latest #333 local changes are uploaded to server if found, without user interaction #1683 Current favorite functionality is renamed available offline The available offline overlay icon is a download arrow with a bar underneath Mobile sync error status is changed to red circle x from desktop Successfully synced files are shown with a green check mark from desktop Syncing files are shown with a circular blue arrow from desktop File transfers in process are the same circular blue arrows from desktop Android Badges and changing current favorites to sync folder #1218 Automated Sync Folder #1136 iOS Badges and changing current favorites to sync folder owncloud/ios#463 🎉 2
Manager.title: Updating Sync Capabilities on Mobile

Manager.description: Not sure if I'm doing this correctly but, I've read the SETUP.md file I've imported the project into Android Studio However I cannot do anything as it keeps giving me this error: Error:A problem occurred configuring root project 'android-stable'. Cannot evaluate module owncloud-android-library : Configuration with name 'default' not found. I've tried using different branches. I've ran the setup_env.bat file and still nothing Any help?
Manager.title: Cannot import into Android Studio

Manager.description: When I'm taking pictures, I usually take a couple and choose the best out of them afterwards. But by the time I've chosen my favorite and deleted the other copies, owncloud already uploaded all pictures. So now I have to delete 6 pictures in the client (which is tedious, because there doesn't seem to be multi select.) I would love to have a setting where I can set a delay (5mins, 15mins or 30mins for example) to upload the pictures. If the photo is still there by then, upload it, if it isn't, delete the queue entry. For everybody finding this on Google until it might be implemented: I solved this by using FolderSync (or any other sync app) I use anyways and upload the pictures every 30mins. Sometimes I take them right before an upload cycle, but most of the time it works just fine.
Manager.title: Feature Request: Delayed Instant Upload

Manager.description: Expected behaviour Tell us what should happen Instant upload after taken picture Actual behaviour Tell us what happens instead Instant upload failes Steps to reproduce Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) Environment data Android version: 4.4.2, 5.0.,1 Device model: Galaxy Grand Tab S 8.4 Stock or customized system: stock ownCloud app version: 2.0 ownCloud server version: 9.0.2.2 The account info are as : https://ipocserver/owncloud, user and password logged in successful! However the server address in the failed picture uploads reads like : user@ipocserver/owncloud/ownCloud/SofortVideo Error message: Zugangsdaten falsch! I repeated the setup the account several times, double and triple checked all input info, however the error remains still the the same! I do know where /ownCloud comes from! However, the SofortUpload directory is shared with my OC 9.02 Backup server at a different Ip address! After removing the share, the Error message remains the same! regards, hitam4450
Manager.title: Instant Upload failes with wrong server address

Manager.description: The multi-window is a new interface design in Android devices available from Android N API (#1675), to keep in the screen more than one application. There are two different modes in mult-window interface: multiple app mode, and picture-in-picture. I suggest to implement the compatibility as a first approach to adapt our interface, because I think the picture-in-picture may not gives much functionality to the ownCloud app. https://developer.android.com/preview/features/multi-window.html

Manager.description: Thumbnails of images are currently shown in 3 different places. The uploadlist, the local file browser and the normal folder view of an nextcloud folder. The code to generate a thumbnail / kickof the thumbnail generation is present in all of there places. To unify this, i would like to propose a ThumbImageView class which subclases ImageView. This Class should handle all concern regarding File or OCFile -> Thumbnail, by calling ThumbManager and so on. The ImageView objects are reused in the list views, all code accesing these Views has to check whether the reference they use, still refer to a View with the initial File, this could be solved by having a Reference to OCFile or File on the ThumbImageView aswell as the unique thumbnail CacheKey! So we have some new methods like void setFile(File file); void setOCFile(OCFile file); int getCacheKey(); (maybe override .hashCode(), but this could be problematic with OCFiles not existing) Another possibility would be to introduce two additional classes FileThumbImageView and OCFileThumbImageView.. As far as i understand it, the Upload Queue and local filebrowser lists use File and the nextcloud folder browser uses OCFile.. This should only a refactor not any addition of new functionality.
Manager.title: Create a ThumbImageView

Manager.description: I noticed that with the dropbox app when I take a picture from my phone it uploads the picture and changes the name from IMG_YYYYMMDD_SOME_OTHER_CHARS.jpg to a more friendly YYYY-MM-DD HH.MM.SS.jpg Is there some way to do that also with the owncloud app?
Manager.title: [Feature request] Rename uploaded pictures with a friendly name

Manager.description: In #1176 multi select feature was developed and it is needed to have also available the "Available offline" option when multiselection mode. In a first iteration it would be only files (not folders, so that this feature is not fully implemented): If any of the selected are av. offline -> all become av. offline If some of the selected are av. offline and some are not -> the already av. offline remain as av. offline, and the not av. offline become av. offline. At the end all selected files are av. offline If all the selected are already av. offline -> option "Not av. offline" to unset them as av. offline
Manager.title: Include "Available offline" option in multiselection mode

Manager.description: Actual behaviour Configuration OwnCloud is configured with a base path /owncloud using docker image mwaeckerlin/owncloud: docker run -d --name owncloud-mysql-volume mysql sleep infinity docker run -d --name owncloud-volume mwaeckerlin/owncloud sleep infinity docker run -d --name owncloud-mysql -e MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=somePassWord -e MYSQL_DATABASE=owncloud -e MYSQL_USER=owncloud -e MYSQL_PASSWORD=someOtherPassWord --volumes-from owncloud-mysql-volume owncloud-mysql-volume docker run -d --name owncloud -e BASEPATH=/owncloud -e WEBROOT=/owncloud -e URL=some.url -e UPLOAD_MAX_FILESIZE=16G -e MAX_INPUT_TIME=7200 --volumes-from owncloud-volume --link owncloud-mysql:mysql In front of OwnCloud, there is a Nginx reverse proxy, that does SSL (with a valid certificate), and redirects http to https, using docker image mwaeckerlin/reverse-proxy, the relevant part here is: docker run -d --name reverse-proxy -p 443:443 -p 80:80 --link owncloud:some.url%2fowncloud [...] mwaeckerlin/reverse-proxy I configures instant upload, also from mobile. What Happens Some files succeed, some files fail. I don't see any major difference between those files. Sometimes files do upload after some numbers of retrials, some did not (yet), even so I retried many many times. Upload bar goes to 100%, then fails. Uploads may fail regardless whether they are triggered by the instant upload or manually by using «share» with the OwnCloud app. Expected behaviour All files always succeed. Steps to reproduce Try to share some files, sometimes it works, sometimes it does not. Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) Since it is an occasional behaviour, I can't really test that. Environment data Android version: 5.1, 6.0.1,.5.1.1 Device model: Sony XPeria Z3 Compact, Xperia M5, Xperia Z2 tablet Stock or customized system: - ownCloud app version: 2.0.1 ownCloud server version: 9.0.3 Logs Web server error log Funny, upload just succeeded, when I wanted to get the logs for the failure. This after about 10-20 fails for the same file. So here you see all the logs for the file where I replaced the original file name by filename and the external IP by 66.66.66.66. The first attempts were fails, the last attempt was successful: On Nginx: 66.66.66.66 - mwaeckerlin [08/Jul/2016:08:44:01 +0000] "HEAD /owncloud/remote.php/webdav/clientsync/navigation/filename..gpx HTTP/1.1" 301 0 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/1.9.0" 66.66.66.66 - Manager.description: I installed Owncloud and am loving it except for the mobile app (android). I'm use to the Dropbox app. The Owncloud app downloads the file before I can view it where Dropbox allows me to view automatically. Can Owncloud do this and how? If not, can someone tell me how to change the default download directory for the mobile app as I don't want my phones memory filling up when I have an external memory card I could be using. I'm using a Samsung Galaxy S4 running 4.4.4 stock ownCloud app version: 2.0.1 ownCloud server version: 8.0 Thank you
Manager.title: view not download - how?

Manager.description: Files get synced if I open the file I changed foo.txt on my desktop PC. The next day I want to see this change on my mobile device. But the change was not on the device yet. I needed internet connection during opening foo.txt Expected behaviour I want my device to sync (up and download) the whole account automatically. Background: I want to have my updated files in a wireless area (for example in a train). It is too late if the android app tries to sync the file when I open it. This needs to be done at home, before I leave. I want this for all files of a given account. Steps to reproduce Edit file on PC Wait some hours (For me syncing once an hour would be a good default) Switch of internet connection at android device New content is not available :-( Environment data Android version: 4.1.2 Device model: Samsung Galay S2 Stock or customized system: stock ownCloud app version: 2.0.1 ownCloud server version: Where can I see this?
Manager.title: Auto Sync all Files

Manager.description: Actual behaviour When the app automatically upload a picture after it's been taken, the exif of the image file indicate the date of the upload, not the original date and time of the picture. If the upload succeed imediately after the photo shoot, there is not big problem. But when the upload fails, the exif of the image indicate the datetime of the retried upload, not the original exif. Expected behaviour The exif of an uploaded image should always be the original one. Else, it mess up the order and the chronology and it's a problem. Environment data Android version: up to date. Device model: One Plus One Stock or customized system: Cyanogen ownCloud app version: up to date. ownCloud server version: 9.0.1
Manager.title: Auto upload, exif problem

Manager.description: ExtendedListFragment.onCreateView() mProgressBar = (ProgressBar) v.findViewById(R.id.syncProgressBar); mProgressBar is null, so setProgressBarAsIndeterminate method crash. Need remove merge block in res/layout/top_progress_bar.xml.
Manager.title: Issue report

Manager.description: A video is recorded or photo is taken and instant upload kicks in. The phone is put into sleep mode and next time it is woken up OwnCloud displays an error message. Upload failed 'app was terminated'. Presumably Android is terminating the service when the phone goes into sleep mode. I understand that the desktop client breaks files down into chunks for uploading. Could the Android client not implement the same behaviour? Then the service could be created as START_STICKY and resume uploading from the previous chunk when it gets restarted. This would also help when switching between wifi hotspots or moving from wifi to cellular data. The issue is occurring on a Samsung Galaxy J7 with Android Marshmallow
Manager.title: Instant Upload fails when phone goes to sleep

Manager.description:
Actual behaviour I have enabled automatic image upload on my Android owncloud app. Suddenly I got Unknown error and the image could not be uploaded. When I looked at the server error log, I read the actual error message: 507 Insufficient Storage. Expected behaviour Why is not the server error used, which explains exactly what is going on. Unknown error is not very descriptive. Steps to reproduce Enable automatic image upload on your Android app Set a too low quota on the server Take a picture with your phone and wait for the automatic image upload I don't know if this problem is specific to the photo upload. Maybe it concerns all upload when there is no space available. Manager.description: Steps to reproduce Enable instant uploads and set the camera folder with default google camera Take some photos/videos Actual behaviour Anything is uploaded Expected behaviour All the content is uploaded Environment data Android version: 6.0.1 Device model: Samsung Galaxy Note 4. Model number SM-N910F Security Patch Level: 1 July 2016 Kernel version: 3.10.40-7733605 Camera app: default Samsung camera, version 3.0 ownCloud server version: 9.1 Checked in other Android versions, Samsung devices, camera apps and the problem does not happen. It seems to be a problem related with the storage location from camera and photo/video taken Notice this device doesn't have slot for SD Card; due to that, the app stores always files in main storage, and the option in the app to select storage volume is disabled.
Manager.title: Instant uploads in Samsung Galaxy Note4 with default camera

Manager.description: Actual behaviour Account with two-factor enabled displays "Wrong username or password" but without two-factor enabled it logs in correctly. Expected behaviour Needs support for two-factor authentication (new screen to prompt for otp if the account has it enabled.) Steps to reproduce Implement Two Factor App (TOTP Provider 0.4.1) Set an account to use it (i.e. with Google Authenticator) Account can no longer log in using Android app Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) App is unavailable there (and it would lock the account if it were) Environment data Android version: 6.0.1 Device model: SM-N920V Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 2.1.2 ownCloud server version: 9.1.1 Logs Web server error log Insert your webserver log here ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) Insert your ownCloud log here
Manager.title: Unable to Login to account with TOTP Two-Factor Authentication enabled

Manager.description: Actual behaviour currently it's only possible to upload particular files Expected behaviour it would be cool if one could upload whole directories (e.g. /blah/documents/private/) in addition. Steps to reproduce Open ownCloud app on android (your ownCloud files are shown) click on the round plus icon click on upload it's only possible to select files, but no directories. Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) I didn't test, but i think it's safe to say that yes. Environment data Android version: 5.1.1 Device model: Sony Xperia Z1 (C6903) Stock or customized system: stock ownCloud app version: 2.1.2 ownCloud server version: 9.1
Manager.title: uploading directories

Manager.description: Actual behaviour When using a site with an untrusted SSL certificate, I get a "the identity of the site could not be verified" pop up as expected. However, when I try to click the "Yes" button to dismiss the popup (or even "No"), the app doesn't dismiss the popup. Expected behaviour The app should dismiss the popup when I press either "No" or "Yes". Steps to reproduce Open up owncloud app Type an server address with a self-signed certificate Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) Nope Environment data Android version: 5.1 Device model: Motorola Moto X Stock or customized system: Nope ownCloud app version: 2.1.2 ownCloud server version: ownCloud 7.0.4+dfsg-4~deb8u4 (Debian) (stable)
Manager.title: Cannot click through "the identity of the site could not be verified" popup

Manager.description: Steps In app, login in an account In server, delete the account In app, select the account in drawer or in account manager Redirection to login view The account does not exist anymore, so credentials will never work (username is non-editable). If you tap on "Go Back" button, the files view or settings view (depending whether the app has more accounts or not) is shown for a little while, but you are redirected again to login view. It is a bit annoying to switch to another account or tap on "new account". Expected behaviour? Switch to another account, or to login view if the app has no accounts. The question is if server side answers in the same way if the credentials have changed and if the account is removed to detect these two different cases.
Manager.title: Blocking when an account is deleted in server side

Manager.description: Steps Select files/folders Select copy/move Current behaviour The contextual menu shows three options: New folder Refresh account Grid view Expected behaviour Only "New Folder" is shown, because the other two are vain in that view
Manager.title: Options in contextual menu in copy/move options

Manager.description: ### Reproduction of the problem use login screen of owncloud app version 2.1.2. Fill in my own owncloud https URL (self-signed certificate). Note that this happens also in pure http. Give valid credentials, and push on CONNECT button. I got the message: unknown error occured just below the password field ### Expected behaviour Login success. Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) no, with demo.owncloud.org, the login process is working well. ### Environment data Android version: 6.0.1 Device model: Galaxy S6 Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 2.1.2 ownCloud server version: this is the latest version from apt repository in raspbian. ### Logs from web server: tail -5 /var/log/apache2/access.log [24/Oct/2016:11:10:22 +0200] "HEAD /owncloud/remote.php/webdav/ HTTP/1.1" 200 476 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.1.2" [24/Oct/2016:11:10:22 +0200] "GET /owncloud/index.php/ocs/cloud/user?format=json HTTP/1.1" 302 775 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.1.2" [24/Oct/2016:11:10:22 +0200] "GET /owncloud/index.php/ocs/cloud/user?format=json HTTP/1.1" 302 775 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.1.2" [24/Oct/2016:11:10:22 +0200] "GET /owncloud/index.php/ocs/cloud/user?format=json HTTP/1.1" 302 775 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.1.2" [24/Oct/2016:11:10:23 +0200] "GET /owncloud/index.php/ocs/cloud/user?format=json HTTP/1.1" 302 775 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.1.2" from owncloud: nothing to show
Manager.title: Login fails

Manager.description: Actual behaviour Mini FAB labels disappear due to a bug Expected behaviour Mini FAB labels should always be visible Steps to reproduce Open owncloud App Click on "+" sign on bottom right of the screen (See screen shot) Do not upload anything and just go back to the App Close the application (without closing the application it works normal) Open the app again Click on the "+" sign again 7- Mini FAB labels will not show

Manager.description: Actual behaviour android app ignores session cookies. Expected behaviour android should check for the session cookies so the access can be revoked fromm the server side. Steps to reproduce create user test on server login with user on server login from android. on personal page on server look for active sessions android client is not shown in sessions overview. Environment data Android version: android 6 Device model: moto g3 Stock or customized system: cyanogenmod ownCloud app version: 2.1.2 ownCloud server version: 9.1.2 expected to work from 9.1.0
Manager.title: use session cookies for android app

Manager.description: 00006805 Actual behaviour app can't connect to server because of uppercase character in URL Expected behaviour Should connect Steps to reproduce Try to connect to server with uppercase char in url
Manager.title: uppercase letter in server URL results in no connection

Manager.description: Actual behaviour When trying to download an image while offline, the app is stuck in a black screen. Expected behaviour When in "disconnected mode", the Downloading... black screen shouldn't be displayed or as soon as the Download failed notification arrives at the device, stop showing it. Steps to reproduce Turn off WiFi/data connection Open an image/video (to see the differences) image stays stuck on the black Downloading... screen video shows the Downloading... progress bar briefly Environment data Android version: 4.3 Device model: Nexus 7 Stock/customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 2.2.0
Manager.title: Downloading a image while offline displays a black "downloading screen" forever.

Manager.description: Changes in the device orientation can lead to an indefinite spinner in the share dialog. It's hard to isolate the specific condition that is triggering this, but it's happening often. Steps to reproduce: Select a file and choose to share it. Change the device orientation. Repeat and retry this 2 steps until the load spinner stays stuck. After this happening once, it's reproduced systematically. Current behavior The Loading... spinner stays in focus forever. If you try to click the back button, the app doesn't respond, and a couple of minutes after closing it, crashes. Expected behavior Spinner should be displayed while getting the share settings for that file and a timeout should be triggered if these settings cannot be pulled from the server. Test environment Android 6.0.1 on a Samsung Galaxy Note 4
Manager.title: Share dialog spinner stays `Loading ...`

Manager.description: Steps Connect to Wifi Setup the Wifi to auto-disconnect on lock (when the screen locks itself, it will disconnect from Wifi completely and never reconnect until unlocked) Unlock the screen Go to Google's picture app Select many pictures Share and select the ownCloud app Select a destination folder and start the upload Let the phone aside and see the cloud icon in the notification bar, it's uploading Wait for phone to auto-lock, wait longer, go have coffee Come back to phone, unlock it Check notification area Expected result Notification area must display a permanent message "Upload failed due connection problems" or something similar because Android disconnected the Wifi when the phone automatically locked itself. Actual result No notification at all from the ownCloud app. Two times I thought it successfully finished uploading and when I checked my pics folder from the laptop there were missing pictures. Versions ownCloud server 9.1.3 ownCloud Android app 2.2.0 Android Nexus 4 mobile phone with Android 5.1.1 @davivel even holidays have their bug reports 😉
Manager.title: Connection error with auto-disconnect, no notification

Manager.description: Steps Navigate into a deep folder From another app, upload some stuff using the "share" feature and picking ownCloud Wait for upload to finish and all notifications to disappear Now I want to go have a look at the upload list Expected When inside a deep folder, I'd like to have a way to go to the main menu. Actual No way to go to the main menu directly. Need to click the "Back" button on the top left of the mobile app until I reach the root folder. Only then can I access the upload list. I'm not familiar with the regular Android app design, maybe the current approach is an existing and acceptable design pattern. Now you might say that it's not a common use case to want to access the finished upload list and that it's ok to have that menu item there. To be discussed. @davivel @owncloud/design
Manager.title: [UX] Main/settings menu only accessible from root folder

Manager.description: Note: I usually use vimtouch to open text files Install vimtouch (or any other text editor) Upload some text file "test.txt" from another machine In the ownCloud app, navigate into the folder of the file "test.txt" Hold on the "test.txt" item (we want to edit but don't want to view the file with the built-in viewer) Use the "three dots" menu to select "open with" but be clumsy and tap a bit on the left of it Expected No trash icon so close to "three dots" Actual Risk of tapping the delete icon when aiming for the three dots menu. Note: in general I'm not too happy to have to use this menu when editing a file. But due to the new built-in viewer I need to do more manual action to be able to open the file in an external editor. (maybe I'll make another separate report)
Manager.title: Trash icon too close to "three dots" menu

I've already navigated the tree once to upload the file, perhaps useful to not have to do that again to manipulate the uploaded file? Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? At that point it may make more sense just to allow arbitrarily many instant upload sources, rather than incorporating more and more specific use cases as they arise and polluting the configuration menu.
Manager.title: Additional instant upload sources

Manager.description: Hi all. I have just stumbled across this while looking for an alternative to Dropbox camera upload. I have an owncloud server set up and working on Ubuntu 16.04 and I can connect to it find, add, download, delete files etc no problem. I have tried using the "instant upload" option but I just can't seem to figure out how to get it to work. I set the path to my camera folder and take a photo and absolutely nothing happens in the app whatsoever. Nothing gets queued, nothing uploaded, no errors, nothing. Dropbox syncs the same photo fine. I am pulling my hair out trying to figure this out and I can't find anything in the manual while would help. I am using a Galaxy S7 and my camera is set to save to a 64GB microSD card. I tried changing back to phone storage and set that folder in the owncloud app but it makes no difference. PLEASE can someone help?
Manager.title: Automatic upload?

Manager.description: We are currently working on publishing the beta app in FDroid, so it would be a good moment to start to do the same in Google Play Store. There are two ways to set up beta tests in Play Store: Closed beta: to run a test with small groups or if we know the exact users we want to test the ownCloud app. Users in this test group can be managed by email address and only they will receive updates for the beta version (via link). Open beta: to run a test with a large group, anyone can join the beta program and submit private feedback. Since ownCloud app is in live production version, users can opt-in to the beta program from the app details in Play Store (It's possible to set a maximum number of beta testers) In none of the options, testers can submit public reviews. AC Decide: closed or open beta // Open beta Decide Feedback channel (let the users know how they can provide us with feedback): email address, private feedback through Play Store (only for open beta), github repository, central. // Apps email Prepare beta release Create open release beta in Play Store. Upload a the beta signed apk. Add beta release info in Play Store. Send beta release to review. Publish beta. CC @michaelstingl @jesmrec @davivel ❤️ 1
Manager.title: Configure BETA program in Play Store

Manager.description: Actual behaviour Trying to start the app wil result in a message saying: owncloud crashed. Instantupload and file sharing cease functioning as well. Expected behaviour App starts without crashing. Steps to reproduce Start the app. Owncloud seems to function again after restarting the phone. However, once the app starts crashing again, it becomes dysfunctional again - I.e. I need to restart the phone for it to function again, there is no workaround. Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) (Not sure) Environment data Android version: 7.0 Device model: Samsung Galaxy S6 / SM-G920F Stock or customized system: stock. May 2017 Samsung update installed. ownCloud app version: 2.4.0 ownCloud server version: [will check later] I 'm not sure how to obtain crash logs from android - if there are any.
Manager.title: app crashes

Manager.description: Actual behaviour No Implementation of client side certificates. Server side certificates are working without an issue. Expected behaviour Implementation of client side certificates on core and android app so clients may be forced to log in with password and certificate. Implementation should allow to clients (or android app) to provide certificate for intermediate validation prior to login on owncloud. Steps to reproduce N/A Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? Manager.description: Actual behaviour Working with the Owncloud app stops working suddenly, now I get the error "SSL initialization failed". I tried to delete my account in the app, now I'm not able to reconnect to my ouwncloud server with the same error: "SSL initialization failed". The problem came up after an update of the phone's OS (at least I think so). The device is a Blackberry Z10 which is able to run Android apps since there is an special Android layer within the OS called Android Player. Using the web interface of the owncloud server from within the browser on the phone works. I'm pretty sure the problem lies in the server's SSL configuration. But I'm not able to find the cause resp. to adjust the settings. And I haven't access to all config data since it is a shared server. Test on https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/ gives A+ Expected behaviour Of course I would like to connect to the server using the app. Steps to reproduce In the app try to add a new account Type in the server address: https://.... The connection will be tested and the tests ends with the mentioned error message Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) No, I'm not able to reproduce the problem with demo.owncloud.org. It works fine. Environment data Android version: Blackberry OS 10.3.3.2163 Device model: Blackberry Z10 Stock or customized system: Stock system ownCloud app version: 2.4.0 ownCloud server version: ownCloud 9.0.10 Manager.description: Actual behaviour i have created two factor app , from this document : https://doc.owncloud.org/server/10.0/developer_manual/app/two-factor-provider.html on web browser , everything is ok , provider works like a charm , but on Android application , it says " wrong username or password " . i read about adding App password , but nothing change , maybe i do wrong , don't know , Expected behaviour i want to show my provider on android application too . user is coming to login , after checking username and password , it shows an extra page , to verify authentication . Environment data Android version: 2.4.0 Logs ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) HTTP\\\/1.1 401 No 'Authorization: Basic' header found. Either the client didn't send one, or the server is misconfigured, No 'Authorization: Basic' header found. Either the client didn't send one, or the server is misconfigured

Manager.description: Tasks in order to make Android app compatible and targeted to Android O We are going to take advantage of this issue to update the Android tools and dependencies before upgrading the target version to 26 (Android O). Read +info about building for Android O: https://developer.android.com/about/versions/oreo/index.html?hl=en#compatibility
Manager.title: Android O

Manager.description: I see this in build.gradle This project was started in Eclipse and later moved to Android Studio. In the transition, both IDEs were supported. Due to this, the files layout is not the usual in new projects created with Android Studio / gradle. This file merges declarations usually split in two separates build.gradle file, one for global settings of the project in its root folder, another one for the app module in subfolder of root. Guys, Eclipse and Android are no team any more, and this makes no sense since 2015 ! I would like to make an PR to change project structure with an app directory, like most Android apps are, but when I see how much open PR's are there I see no chance doing this. Am I right ?
Manager.title: General project structure

Manager.description: Dear developers of the owncloud/android project, We are MSc students from the Delft University of Technology doing research on why builds break in open source projects. To do this, we are analyzing Travis build statistics and build history of owncloud/android. By analyzing the build history of owncloud/android, we found the following: The project has 16.1% failing builds in the history The project has a average amount of build failures compared to other similar projects When looking at owncloud/android’s build metrics, we could not find clear factors that are highly correlated with this result. To identify the reasons behind build breakage, we would like to collect developer insights into the reasons why build breakage occurs. If you have five minutes, please answer the survey we have created. Your response will be very useful in our study. Thank you.
Manager.title: Researching Build Breakage

Manager.description: Hi, I found CookieSyncManager is instantiated in WebviewDialog. I understand it was instantiated to avoid crashes when instantiating CookieManager. But from API 21, it is no longer needed and deprecated. CookieManager can work well by itself. (According to the doc)

Environment data Android version: 4.3 Device model: Samsung Note 3 ownCloud app version: ownCloud beta 2.5.1-beta-1 ownCloud server version: latest, cannot check now I don't have the logs, anyway this behavior is repeated both with the ownCloud server they set up at work and with my personal one. Notice that in both instances Solid Explorer can login and access the files without a problem, though it doesn't have a sync function. The Windows client also works without a problem on both servers. p.s. I'm using the beta version because it seems that you have to pay for the regular one... I don't want to pay only because this app never really worked for me, every time I go back to it to check, I just cannot login. Although in a previous version it would crash on the attempt, so that's somewhat of an improvement.

Manager.description: App version 2.5.0 does not recognise the 10.x server version. Server is 10.0.3 while app says "min. 8.2 version has to installed on server to share". Therefore no additional sharing is possible. Usernames which were added to the share list earlier are listed and can be deleted. Creating a share link works, too. Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) Not possible to test because there are no other local users on this test installation to share with. Environment data Android version: 13.0 Device model: maguro Stock or customized system: lineageos ownCloud app version: 2.5.0 ownCloud server version: 10.0.3
Manager.title: share feature does not recognise server version

Manager.description: Steps Select multiple files for upload Go to uploads section Expected File sizes displayed for all files Actual size only displayed for files not currently uploading. For any file currently uploading or waiting for upload, the size is hidden. Why ? My use case is that I'm uploading on a slow network and would like to be able to estimate how long I need to wait until I can stop forcing the phone to leave WiFi on by using the phone (because wifi auto disconnects and resuming loses progress, there's another ticket for that). Even better would be to show how much was already uploaded vs bytes total. I believe the desktop client does that. Optional is a speed measurement. Version 2.5.0
Manager.title: Display file size during upload

Manager.description: Steps Enter folder with multiple files where none of the files were ever synced Touch and hold on each file to select them Find the option for "available offline" in the top bar Expected result Easy to distinguish icons with no ambiguity Actual result There are two icons there: an arrow down and another arrow down with an underline. I suspect that many people would not know which one to pick. Maybe find a better icon for available offline. Version 2.5.0
Manager.title: Confusing download buttons when mixed

Have a look at the next gif got from this project that includes a wizard example we can use:

Manager.description: It's not really a problem, but I find it really annoying having to manually upload my photos because instant upload dosent have the feature to not upload when using mobile data, I still want to have access to my files when on mobile data, so no the fix is not going to options a disabling it.
Manager.title: Option not insta upload on mobile data

Manager.description: It would be great to have this feature included in our side menu for example, as suggested here. There's a pretty old PR, #737 that follows a different approach, creating a specific activity to show the quota. Although we can use the library PR maybe, owncloud/android-library#102 and take advantage of GetRemoteUserQuotaOperation TASKS [LIBRARY] Get quota from the server by using GetRemoteUserQuotaOperation. Already merged via owncloud/android-library#102 [APP] Get quota when getting user profile info and stores it in DB. [APP] Include quota in drawer menu, handling different cases with quotas using MB or GB [APP] Handle pending, unknown and unlimited quota, switch to WebDAV endpoint. Related: owncloud/core#31376 [APP] Handle quota 0
Manager.title: As a user, I would like to know the space remaining in my account

Manager.description:
Actual behaviour When trying to log in using the android application (version 2.7.0) entering https://cloud.chillstice.com yields the message: Secure connection established; however, when logging in with the correct credentials it tries to log in for 3 seconds and fails with the message: Unknown error. The desktop client works fine and the ownCloud panel accessible at cloud.chillstice.com works properly. Expected behaviour The application should log in like I was able to do many times before moving to a subdomain. Steps to reproduce Create a subdomain redirect to the directory ownCloud is installed in. Try to connect using the new address with the android application. Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) NO :C Environment data Android version: 7.0 Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7 Verizon (SM-G930V) Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 2.7.0 ownCloud server version: 10.0.7.2 Logs Web server error log No relevant errors ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) No relevant errors More Info Today I finally figured out how to properly create subdomains and how to set ownCloud to be accessible under the 'cloud' subdomain. I changed the config.php to include the following: 'trusted_domains' => array ( 0 => 'chillstice.com', 1 => 'cloud.chillstice.com', ), 'overwrite.cli.url' => 'https://cloud.chillstice.com/', 'htaccess.RewriteBase' => '/',
Then I ran 'occ maintenance:update:htaccess' The SSL certificates for the subdomain have also successfully been updated and are live. I only started having this problem after setting up the subdomain.
Manager.title: Android App successfully tests SSL connection but fails to log in 'Unknown error'

Manager.description: This option shouldn't be that tricky to implement and can be included in the side menu to start completing it as #2204 suggests. New available option Available offline list
Manager.title: As a user I would like to list all "available offline" files/folders

Manager.description: Actual behaviour In https://central.owncloud.org/t/android-instant-upload-with-multiple-accounts-select-target-account/7427 a user reports that in a multi-account setup they can not select the account to which photos shall be instantly uploaded. The photos are currently only going to the last account which was used. This means that they end up in the wrong folder sometimes. In nextcloud it seems to show the same behavior: nextcloud/android#440 Expected behaviour Users should be able to select to which account they want to upload, either after taking a photo or in general. Steps to reproduce Take a photo Go to the ownCloud app and select another account Take another photo look where they have been uploaded to Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) Environment data Android version: Android 7.1 Device model: Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini (i8190) Stock or customized system: Lineage OS 14.1 ownCloud app version: 2.7.0 ownCloud server version: one of them 10.0.7, the other 10.0.6
Manager.title: Feature Request: Select account for instant upload

Manager.description: Currently, the "descending" option to sort the file list is placed within the action bar menu as following: We can improve this behaviour in two different ways: By changing the wording to Sort descending , so only the word Descending can be confusing By setting the option in the same dialog as the sorting method, in the bottom as a checkable option: CC @michaelstingl
Manager.title: Improvements in "Descending" file list sort method
